Her reason for working with Yehu is because of its good reputation in the community and easy accessibility of loans. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom are currently in school. Christine has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Christine hopes to own a poultry firm. Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her a job skill.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es: El  grupo se llama “ESTRELLAS DE BELEN” se encuentra ubicado en El Estado de México. Está conformado por 11 integrantes, entre ellas está la sra. Yuriana A. R. de 29 años de edad, ella lleva 5 años de casada con el señor Fidel A. Medina él es campesino, Siembra y vende maíz.Ella tiene una recaudería, la señora nos comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio por que los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaban para cubrir sus necesidades y las de sus dos hijos, cuado inicio su negocio vendía en la calle en un lugar muy pequeño y su mercancía la acomodaba en el piso, sólo vendía habas y elotes ya que su esposo es campesino y los elotes eran de su  casecha, despues de un tiempo también empezó a vender chicharo y poco a poco su negocio fue prosperando, logro rentar un local y de esta manera tambien empezo a vender diferentes verduras. Con el credito quiere comprar fruta y hacer creecer su negocio considera que de esta manera incrementarán sus ingresos y tendrá la oportunidad de brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.En el mismo grupo esta la señora Isabel V. de 31 años de edad, ella  tiene un taller de costura desde hace  10 años ; nos comenta que desde que tenia 11 años sus padres le enseñaron a coser ya que en su localidad esta es la actividad principal. Ella está sola con tres hijos, inicio su negocio con una máquina y sólo vendía en la pequeña plaza que se hace en su localidad cada semana, despues empezo a coser sudadera y bermuda, entonces salió a vender a diferentes plazas y lo que es aún mejor comenzo a vender sus prendas sobre pedidos. Quiere el crédito para comprar más variedad de tela para que su negocio continue creciendo. Pretende tener mayor estabilidad para tener la seguridad de que sus hijos tendrán la oportunidad de salir adelante. Su hijo el mayor de apenas 14 años sueña con ser un exelente abogado.
texts.en:
This group is called “Estrellas de Belén” (Stars of Bethlehem).  It is located in the state of Mexico and has 11 members.  One of the members is Mrs Yuriana A. R. who is 29 years old.  She has been married to Mr Fidel A. Medina, an agricultural worker, for 5 years.  Her husband grows and sells corn.  She has a small fruit and vegetable store and tells us that she decided to set up her business because her husband's income often didn't manage to cover their needs and those of their two children.  When she started in her business she sold in the street from a very small stall and kept her merchandise in her apartment.  She only sold beans and corn since her husband is an agricultural worker and the corn was from his harvests.  After a while, she also began to sell peas and, little by little, her business started to prosper.  She managed to rent premises and began to sell more vegetables.  She would like to use her loan to buy fruit and grow her business.  She believes that in this way her income will increase and she will have the opportunity to give her children a better quality of life.

In this same group is Mrs Isabel V..  She is 31 years old and has a dressmaking workshop which she has had for 10 years.  She tells us that since she was 11 years old her parents taught her how to sew since sewing is the main economic activity in their region.  She is alone with her three children.  She began her business with one machine and only sold in the small square in her town each week.  She then began to sew sweatshirts and bermuda shorts.  She started selling in more town squares and, even better, she began to sell her garments to order.  She would like this loan to buy a better variety of fabric so that her business can continue to grow.  Her oldest son is barely 14 years old yet he already dreams of becoming an excellent lawyer.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Alaisha

texts.en:
Alaisha N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sisters and brothers). Alaisha lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Alaisha has a food stall. She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days out of every week. Alaisha sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale.  

Alaisha has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of tomatoes, pineapples, onions and Irish potatoes.

The main business challenges for Alaisha include thieves and transportation. Her goal for her business is owning a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of Irish potatoes, onions, tomatoes and pineapples.

loans.name: Mrs. Soem Yeu Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soem Y. is the village bank president for this loan, selected by the twelve people in Trapeang Ronoung village in Takeo province who make up this loan.  The members will use their portion of the loan to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Soem Y. raises and sells ducks to earn money to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand.  For this purpose, Mrs. Soem Y. is seeking a loan to buy more ducklings. Her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Nub, is a palm juice collector who earns some money from selling palm sugar. Through these activities they support five children, two of whom are students and the others are helping in their parents’ businesses.

loans.use: To buy ducklings to raise and sell

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara O. Veliztiene 47 años se encuentra casada con el señor Julio Medrano Alba, tienen 5 hijos menores de edad, todos se encuentra estudiando en la escuelita de Alba Rancho. Sara vive cerca de ZOFRACO en Alba Rancho ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en una zona rural. Ella tiene vacas de las cuales obtiene leche de buena calidad y que vende a una empresa que elabora diferentes productos derivados de la leche.

Sara es una persona responsable, trabajadora dedicada a su familia con deseos de sacar adelante a todos sus hijos. Ella quiere este préstamo para comprarse una vaquita más y así aumentar un poco sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Sara entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar los estudios superiores de todos sus hijos y así junto a su esposo se sientan plenamente satisfechos de haber desempeñado un buen papel de padres.
texts.en:
Señora Sara O. Veliz is 47 years old.  She is married to Señor Julio Medrano Alba.  Together they have 5 dependent children, all of whom attend Alba Rancho's little school.  Sara lives close to ZOFRACO in Alba Rancho, which is located in a rural area 20 minutes from the city of Cochabamba.  She raises cattle that produce high quality milk.  She sells the milk to a company that makes various dairy products.

Sara is a hard working, responsible person who is dedicated to her family and has hopes of helping her children get ahead.  She wants this loan in order to purchase another little cow.  It would increase her income a bit and improve her standard of living. 

Amongst her plans for the future, Sara intends to take out a new loan to be able to pay for higher education for all of her children.  Then, she and her husband will feel fully satisfied with having done a good job in their role as parents.

loans.use: To purchase a head of dairy livestock.

loans.name: Paul Macharia

texts.en:
Paul has practiced farming in Olkalou for the last two years. He is 40 years old and married to Esther Njeri. They have four children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD. by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan. He paid off his first loan of 33,000 Kenyan shillings well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy carrot and pea seedlings for planting in the coming season.

In the future, Paul hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy carrot and pea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Alben

texts.en:
Alben R. is from the village of Sampagar, Damulog, Bukidnon. He is 27 years old. Alben is separated from his spouse and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Alben owns & operates a business buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods & toothpaste in the local community. He is also buying and selling vegetables like squash, eggplants & string beans. Alben has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alben joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alben has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Alben is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & canned goods for his newly established retail store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Alben from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Michel Joaquín

texts.es: El Sr. Michel Joaquín E. C. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “Alcaldía Municipal Villa el Carmen” desempeñándose como Bodeguero tiene  dos años  de trabajar para esta institución, tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc.  Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Michel Joaquín E. C. is an active worker in the Municipality of Villa el Carmen, where he works as a shopkeeper. He has been working there for two years and has one school-age son. He has taken out two loans through CEPRODEL, both of which he has used to buy construction materials like sand, cement, stone, gravel, cinder blocks, etc. in order to expand and improve his home. The loans he has received through CEPRODEL have been of great benefit to him because they have made it possible for him to improve his and his family's living conditions. [To see one of Michel's previous loans on Kiva, click here.]

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand, cement, and stone

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread for embroidering clothes

loans.name: Casita Blanca Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama casita blanca, porque la casa de reunion esta pintada en color blanco y esta ubicada en Toluca, estado de México. El grupo esta compuesto por 10 integrantes, la Señora Maria Elia J. C. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 46 años, estudio la primaria y es comerciante, tiene 3 hijos, 2 hombres y una mujer. Ella se dedica a elaborar sombreros su negocio que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita el prestamo para comprar el material con el cual realiza los sombreros, se siente contenta y feliz de poder contribuir en el gasto familiar para salir adelante y tener una vida de calidad, busca tener un futuro más estable y hacer crecer su negocio. Observaciones, la persona que no se ve bien se llama Antonia M..
texts.en: This group is called Casita Blanca because the house where they meet in Toluca, Mexico is painted white. The group has 10 members, and Mrs. Maria Elia J. C. is the president. She is a 46-year-old merchant who attended elementary and middle school. She has three children, two sons and a daughter. She has made hats to sell for 10 years and is requesting this loan to purchase materials for hatmaking. She is happy to be able to contribute to household expenses and help her family get ahead and have a better life. She wants to have a more stable future and to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Donato; el tiene 34 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; el socio alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de carpintería el realiza trabajos como armarios, camas, muebles entre otros más el lleva ya un par de años en este negocio el cual le a traído muchas satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales el socio es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia que son el motivo principal que él tiene. 

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de material como madera para seguir realizando sus trabajos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "El Amanecer" ("The Dawn") communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Donato is 34 years old and is married with 2 children.  He alternates his daily activities with his carpentry business.  He does work such as armoires, beds, and furniture, among others.  He has been in this business for two years, and it has brought him a lot of satisfaction both economically and personally.  Donato is a pretty happy person with a great desire to move forward for the sake of his family, which is his principal motivation.

He is asking for the loan to purchase material such as wood to continue his work.

He is happy because of the loan, and he promises to make the payments.

loans.use: to buy material such as wood to continue his work

loans.name: Altanchimeg

texts.en:
Altanchimeg, 29, is married and lives with her husband and two daughters in Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they have owned since 2010. Her husband drives a taxi and earns about 300,000 MNT monthly. They have an average standard of living. 
Altanchimeg began selling foodstuffs in 2008. She rents a stall at a local market and her current working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. She wants to expand her business and increase her profits. Altanchimeg is a hardworking and modest person who says, " I work hard to expand my business and save money for my children's future study". She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase more food items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé le 26 août 2009. Il est composé de 16 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Elles on monter leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DAGATH

Madame KHOUD. S. (debout à l'extrême droite du groupe sur la photo avec une écharpe verte claire) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle fait du petit commerce de légumes. Elle a une bonne maîtrise de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle s'approvisionne au marché centrale de la ville de Louga. Et comme activité secondaire elle fait de l'embouche ovine.
texts.en:
The lending group BOK JOM was created on 26 august 2009, and is comprised of 16 women from the same village who met either through being neighbors or family ties. The group is part of the Village Bank DAGATH.

Mrs KHOUD. S. (the woman standing on the far right of the photo wearing a green scarf) is the leader of the group. She is 49 years old, married, and with six children. She is also caring for her granddaughter. 

She has been selling vegetables for a living for more than 20 years, and is thus quite efficient at this business. She stocks up on vegetables at the central market in the village of Louga. She is also involved in the fattening of sheep as a second income-generating activity, she is also

loans.use: Purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es: Juana Paula se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Tiene más de 9 años en este negocio. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso diariamente, ella tiene 2 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo pues se tiene que proporcionarle alimento, vestimenta y estudio. Juana es una mujer muy emprendedora por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para la compra de azúcar, frutas, bolsas entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Paula sells juice drinks. She has had this business for more than 9 years. She began this means of earning a living because of the need to have a daily income. She has two children, but she is responsible for only one, and she has to provide him with food, clothing, and an education. Juana is a very enterprising woman who is always looking for a way to support her family. The loan will be used for the purchase of sugar, fruits, and bags, among other items.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fruit and bags.

loans.name: Ligia Aurelia

texts.es:
Ligia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce en León. Es una madre soltera con tres hijos y cuenta con su propio negocio el cual consiste en brindar servicios en un cafetín a los habitantes de dicho municipio ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace 20 años donde ofrece comida corriente y a la carta, refrescos, entre otros.

Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio ha podido diversificarlo en variedad de comiday a bajos precios lo que atrae la atención de los mismos. 

Una de las necesidades que tiene  es contar con más capital para adquirir los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de comida y así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por tal razón decidió solicitar un crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad y así comprar los vegetales, la carne, el pollo, arroz, aceite, gaseosas y los caramelos para la venta.
texts.en:
Ligia is from the town of El Sauce.  She is a single mother of three children and owns her own business: a café which serves the locals in her town.  The café is located in her home where she has been offering meals, set menus, soft drinks etc. for 20 years.

Since she set up her business, Ligia has been noted for the good service that she provides to her customers and, thanks to her own efforts, she has been able to diversify in her business, offering a wider variety of meals at low prices, which attracts her customers' attention.  

One of the problems that Ligia has is that she needs more capital so that she can acquire the supplies she needs to make her meals and thereby satisfy her customers' demands.  For this reason, she decided to request a loan from Ceprodel in order to fulfil her need and to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, rice, oil, sodas and candies to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, soda, rice, oil, candies, etc.

loans.name: Judas

texts.en: Judas is 38 years old and married with four children ages 13-4 years. He lives in his own home with his wife and their children in Kibaale district Uganda. For three years he has been operating a motorcycle business and he bought his first motorcycle with the savings he made from his piggery project. He hopes in the future to upgrade his business to a taxi. Judas wants a loan to buy a another motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Musyoka

texts.en:
Musyoka is 51-year-old man. He is married and is blessed with six children. Musyoka is a charcoal dealer in Kongowea, Mombasa.  His business has been in operation for the last two years. 

Musyoka has been a KADET client and this marks his first loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase more charcoal for his business.  The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to provide for his family.  His dream is to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 34 years old and a hard-working business lady. She is happily married and she is a proud mother of two children, 11 and 3. She has been selling fruit for four years. 

She hopes to become a major supplier of fruit to all major towns in the country. She also wants to open up several outlets within five years. Through attending Faulu Kenya seminars, she has been able to learn the art of customer care and good customer relations and for this she is grateful to Faulu Kenya.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more fruit.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en: Ana Maria is 55 years old and a single mother of two children. Her daughters are 28 and 14 years old. Ana Maria works in agriculture growing corn and other vegetables. She has not been making very good profits from her crops this year. As a result, she is looking to expand the range of crops she sells by purchasing seeds and other materials for raising crops. Ana Maria is a hard working and responsible woman who promises to complete all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seed and materials for raising crops

loans.name: Lourdes Isabel

texts.en:
Lourdes is 54 years old and lives in Ibarra, Ecuador. She is divorced and lives with her three children. Her oldest daughter is 13 years old, her son is three years old, and her youngest daughter is two months old. Lourdes is a humble person. To support her family, she runs a store and paints ceramics to sell in the market. Lourdes began her business bit by bit. First, she sold toilet paper and sanitary napkins door-to-door. Later, she started selling eggs. Eventually, she opened a storefront and has been continuing to slowly expand her business. Lourdes reports that her sales are currently down due to school vacations but she has a good business because she has the only store on the block.

Lourdes is requesting a loan to stock her store with rice, sugar, noodles, lentils, toilet paper, and soft drinks and to purchase ceramics to paint. This will be her first loan. In the past, she was afraid to put herself in debt. Now, as her businesses have grown, she is confident she can repay her loan. Lourdes believes this loan will help her move forward with her children. Her dreams are to have her own land to build a house and live with her children and to have a larger store with a freezer and more windows.

loans.use: to stock her general store and buy ceramics

loans.name: Dany

texts.en: Dany, 27 year old, is a tailor. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $9 per day. She has three children. All of the children are studying. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $3 on rent, $8 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy fabric to make clothes to sell. Before, she worked in the factory and she knew how to sew very well, but she did not have enough money to start this career. After working in the factory, she saved some money so she quit work and started working as a tailor at home. If her career can get more customers, she will extend it by buy more sewing machines and place them at home. For her children, she will try hard to send them to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 71 years old, a widow with one adult child. She has been a dairy farmer for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 12,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will start pineapple farming. Her hopes are to own a big farm which will help her support her siblings.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and venture into mixed crop farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy DVDs and CDs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, 35, has been engaged in mixed farming for the last 15 years in Nkubu, producing eggs, milk, maize, and cabbage for the local market. He currently employs four farmhands and does welding for additional income.

Peter has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. He says the income will be used to educate his children, who are 13, 10 and 6, and uplift his family's living standards. He is focusing on being the major supplier of eggs and poultry in the area.

Peter says Juhudi Kilimo loans are having a great impact on small farmers, but disease outbreaks and drought are still a challenge to the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou est un homme marié de 59 ans qui vit au Sénégal. Il est marabout de profession mais  s’active en même temps dans la vente d’habits(Thioups) et de téléphones. Il a une expérience de 20 ans dans son activité. Il a choisi cette activité par opportunité, et ce qui l’intéresse  le plus ce sont les gains financiers. Il est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis juin 2002. Il a déjà remboursé 11 crédits antérieurs. Il sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu pour le règlement d’une commande de thioups qu’il aurait reçu. Son objectif est de renouveler son stock  pour répondre à la demande  de la clientèle  en ces veilles de fête. Son souci  est d’améliorer  le niveau de ses profits.
texts.en: Mr. Mamadou is a 59-year-old married man who lives in Senegal. He is a traditional healer by profession but is active at the same time in selling clothing (of thioup cloth) and telephones. He has 20 years of experience in this work, which he chose by chance. Most interesting to him are the financial gains. He has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since June 2002. He has already repaid eleven previous loans. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs for settling a bill for an order of thioups that he would have received. His goal is to renew his stock of goods to respond to customer demand as the holidays approach. His concern is to improve his level of profit.

loans.use: to buy "thioup" cloth to resell

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 35 years old. He is married to Josephine and together they have five children. He is a livestock trader and has been in the business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of KES 7,000 from the business.

This is Philip's third loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans successfully. He will use some of the loan amount to buy more livestock and the rest to renovate a fence. 

Philip will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot for irrigation farming. His dream is to own a large ranch and have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Kumbowedza Group

texts.en:
Chipo is a  divorcee aged 43. She Lives in Kadoma with her child who is aged 20 and still at school. She rears chicken which she as been doing for the past three years.  She mainly supplies butcheries and supermarkets. She also has income from a small tailoring business.

The business is affected by early death of chicks.

She has a loan of $400 which she was granted by Microking Finance. She will use the money to buy more chicks.  She sees herself increasing the volume of trade in five years to come.

loans.use: To  buy chicken feed and day-old chicks.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro sigue participando en el banco comunal “Inti Pakareq” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Alejandro sigue con el negocio de la carpintería y le va muy bien.  

Alejandro con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

Alejandro requiere el préstamo para materiales como por ejemplo madera, cola de carpintero, clavos y otras cosas más. 
 
Alejandro se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alejandro continues participating in Asociación Arariwa’s Micro Lending Unit’s “Inti Pakareq” communal bank in the city of Cusco.  Alejandro still has his carpentry business and he’s doing very well.

Alejandro did very well with the previous loan and was able to obtain good benefits so is asking for another loan because it’s very helpful.  He needs the loan to buy supplies like lumber, carpenter’s glue, nails and other materials.

Alejandro is grateful for the opportunity provided through this means and commits to make his installment payments according to the timeline.

loans.use: to buy lumber, carpenter's glue, nails and other supplies.

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en: Cerina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Cerina has a shop that sells canned goods, coffee powder, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more inventory. Cerina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, coffee & chocolate powder, & beverages

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 48-year-old single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She has a produce business that she started three years ago. She started with one million UGX but now her business is worth 3 million.

Her challenge is high fuel and transportation costs. Her personal goal is building a permanent home.

Resty needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Tafanana Group

texts.en:
Marian is a 41-year-old widow who has four children aged 23, 20, 14 and 6 years. Two of her children go to school and she does not have any other dependants. She receives a pension from her late husband's workplace as additional income.
Marian is a cross-border trader who specializes in kitchenware and clothes. She purchases her stock from South Africa. She operates from home and has been in business for more than two years. Marian also has a poultry project. 
The challenges she faces in the business are the instability of exchange rates and some customers defaulting on their payments. In the next five years, Marian want to own a vehicle for use in the business. With the profits from the business, she will be able to send her children to better schools. She will also be able to develop the residential stand she bought.

loans.use: to buy clothes, gas stoves, and chicks.

loans.name: Santos Hilario

texts.es:
El señor Santos Hilario es casado,  tiene 27 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 1 hijo, se dedica a la artesanía, a la elaboración de muebles, roperos, chinera, mesas, sillas, etc. inició este trabajo con el apoyo de su papá y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia.

solicita un prestamos para la compra de madera que le servirá para producir mas muebles, va a comprar madera de pino colorado y pino blanco, espera en el futuro tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Santos Hilario is 27 years old and married.  He has a third grade education and has a son.  He makes furniture, wardrobes, china cabinets, tables, chairs, etc.  He started doing this with his father’s support and has been doing it for 20 years.

He is asking for a loan to buy lumber that he will use to make more furniture.  He will buy red and white pine and hopes to have a prosperous business in the future.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like the local fish.

loans.name: Fausto Joffre

texts.es: Fausto vive (paraiso ecuador). Ella le dieron oportunidad de trabajar en lo que mas le gustara y el escogió la panaderia. con esfuerzo logro acogerse de ese trabajo para poder sustentarse . ella trabaja todos los días  apartie de las 08:00 has la noche su trabajo lo realiza con ganas. a futuro ella quiere tener su vivienda . con el préstamo comprara  (Harina, huevos, azucar).
texts.en:
Pablo lives in Paraiso, Ecuador.  He was given the opportunity to work in a job he enjoys, so he decided to work in a bakery.  With great effort, he was able to achieve recognition for his work and support himself as a result.  He works every day from 8am to nightfall when his work is completed.  In the future, he wants to have a home.

This loan will be used to buy flour, eggs, and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old. Eden is married and has 3 children. To make a living, she owns and operates a upholstery shop. She has been in her business for 7 years and earns 10,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Eden joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 which will be used to obtain materials for her shop. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to obtain materials for her shop

loans.name: Sira's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Tankonfara a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Ce  groupe en sein des femmes très braves et désireuses d’apporter un plus à leur foyer. Elles habitent toutes le même village. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les femmes. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame sira (en médaillon en haut et à  droite), est l'emprunteuse vedette. elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles. c'est une femme très déterminante dans la bonne marche des activité de son banc villageois. son activité consiste à l'achat de sacs de sucre et de bidon d'huile de palme et d'huile raffiné pour la revente au détail dans, le village.

Avec son nouveau, prêt elle va acheter trois de sacs de sucre pour la revente par sachet d'un kilo et de petits sachet à 100 F CFA.

les bénéfices tirés de cette activité lui permettront d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille d'une part et d'autre part d'assurer la scolarité de ses filles.
texts.en:
The Tankonfara group was created on 17 May 2011 when the banc villageois was founded. This group is composed of very brave women who want to contribute more to their households. All the women live in the same village and have a solid relationship. Their work primarily in small-scale commerce. 

Sira (the one in the thumbnail at the top right of the photo) is the featured borrower for this group. She is married and a mother of four children, three of whom are girls. She works hard to ensure that the banc villageois runs smoothly. Her business involves buying sacs of sugar and palm and refined oil and reselling them at retail in the village. 

With this new loan, she is going to buy three sacs of sugar to resell by the kilogram and also by smaller bags for 100 francs CFA. 

Earnings from this business will allow her to improve her family's living conditions and also to ensure her daughters' schooling.

loans.use: to buy sacs of sugar and five liter drums of oil to resell

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe tiene 30 años de edad,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación, tiene un hijo y actualmente vive en casa de sus suegros, y le ayuda a su suegra en los oficios. 
Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella cocinar, lava y plancha, además visita a su mamá cada semana para hacerle un poco de compañía y llevarle algunas cosas de comer. 
El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para realiza la siembra de cultivos de granos básicos, ya que tiene que pagar mano de obra para la preparación y siembra de maíz. 
Su sueño es ver a su hijo graduándose de bachiller y además darle una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: para realiza la siembra de cultivos de granos básicos, ya que tiene que pagar mano de obra para la preparación y siembra de maíz.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 42 years old and married with two children. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, fruits, and other groceries.

Editha has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, fruits, and other groceries

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Charcoal is the main source of fuel energy for domestic use in rural Ghana. Janet sells charcoal to a community of 3,000 inhabitants. Her sales are good and she enjoys much patronage from the people. She hopes to receive a Kiva loan of $925 to improve her charcoal sales.

loans.use: working Capital to improve her charcoal selling business

loans.name: Shakar

texts.en: Shakar is a 47-year-old mother of two and lives in Salyan region, yenikand village. For 18 years she has been in the business of breeding chickens, hens, ducks and turkeys. She is requesting a loan of $500 to increase her breeding stock by 50 hens and to buy feed.

loans.use: To buy 50 hens and feed

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.en:
"I have a social-interest home which has cost me many years of work in order to own, but it is very small and I would like to construct an antechamber as we are now a family of 5 and there is not enough space. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 dollars in order to build this room."

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor

“Tengo una casa de interés social que me costo muchos años de trabajo tener pero es muy pequeña, me gustaría construir un cuarto al frente ya que somos 5 de familia y el espacio es muy reducido”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room.

loans.name: Favor

texts.en: Pastor Favor O. is 36 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, in Nigeria. She has been with LAPO for the past eight years. Favor sells provisions and food items. She would like a loan to purchase additional foods for her business..

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase iron for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz K. is a widow with seven children.  All of her children had to quit their studies after their father’s death.  To make household expenses, she started making artificial flowers for a meager income of $50 a month. To support her in managing the domestic everyday expenditures her eldest son works at a local factory as a driver. Her son feels that if he is able to become a partner in one of the factory vehicles, he will get decent profits which will substantially raise their living standard. They request a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: invest in a vehicle

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: My name is Balqees M. B.. I am married and a mother of nine: six daughters and three sons. I could not send my children to school because of our poor financial circumstances. My husband used to make kites but after the government banned the business we had to face very difficult times. Then two years ago, my husband started another business of selling spices via his bicycle by acquiring a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. Our business does well and we would like to have another loan to make our business even better. I plan to save the extra income for my daughters' weddings.

loans.use: Expand spices business

loans.name: Nabweru North A-2078(Iii) Group

texts.en: The group has been together for five months. Evelyn is married with two children. She sells both used shoes and clothes. Teddy wants to use the loan to buy a dryer for her salon. Allen sells used clothes. Jane is a tailor and she intends to purchase more cloth and material with the loan. Evelyn wants to use the extra profits from her business to complete her house that is under construction, that is plastering and cementing it. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To stock more clothes and shoes thus expand business

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo B. is 42 years old, and is married with 2 children. She is strong and focussed in her business, always wanting to improve her business style & income; this can be seen in her expression when she says ‘thank God KIVA loan is finally extended to me’. She sells drinks and provisions and is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her buy more drinks and provision for sale. She has been a LAPO member for the past 3 years. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
R. Nargiza lives in the J.Rasulov region of Tajikistan. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and she has proven to be a reliable client. The stability of her business has helped her to repay her previous loans on time, and to improve the business terms significantly.

Mrs. Nargiza sells children's clothing and she has a good assortment. She has applied to KIVA for the loan of 1600 STJ to open a new trade outlet that will permit her to increase and expand her existing assortment of clothing.

loans.use: To open a new store

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo produces several varieties of potatoes. Through his land, he has been able to make this work one of his biggest productive investments. He learned how to do this work when he was a child from his parents, who were farmers. They taught him to plant and care for the land. This occupation has helped him to maintain his family and give his children an education and security. However, he needs support to achieve a good harvest this season.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

DON HUGO, se dedica a la producción de diversas variedades de papas, gracias a sus terrenos de cultivos ha podido hacer de esta labor una de sus más grandes inversiones productivas. El desde muy niño aprendió a realizar esta labor con la ayuda de sus padres quienes fueron agricultores y le enseñaron a sembrar y a cuidar los terrenos. Esta actividad hasta hoy le ha ayudado a mantener su hogar y brindarles a sus hijos educación y seguridad.Sin embargo requiere de apoyo para obtener una buena cosecha en esta temporada

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his potato crops

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es:
From the age of 6, Justo Pastor Mendez has worked in agriculture. He has his own nursery where he grows all kind of plants, including fruit trees and vegetables which he cultivates on his small plot of land, and later sells. It's important to note that he has grown his business over time by investing many resources and putting in a lot of hard work to succeed.

Ceprodel has been an important factor in his business, providing the loans which enabled him to improve the conditions of his nursery and purchase a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables to plant. Now he needs to invest in more seeds and is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary materials to grow his business and continue to improve his quality of life.

El señor Justo Pastor M. desde hace seis años se ha dedicado al negocio de agricultura teniendo su propio vivero de plantas frutales donde cultiva todo tipo de plantas y hortalizas en su parcela para luego al momento de la cosecha comercializarla a sus clientes. Es de importancia destacara que a medida que ha transcurrido el tiempo ha venido mejorando este negocio invirtiendo muchos recursos y esfuerzos humanos para lograr su mejora en el negocio.

Ceprodel ha sido un factor importante por lo que le ha brindado créditos que le han permitido mejorar las condiciones del vivero obteniendo mayores cantidades de frutas y hortalizas para su respectiva siembra. Su necesidad hoy en día es la compra de semillas e insumos para el cultivo por ello ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de estos insumos para mejora de su negocio y de su nivel de vida en su municipio de trabajo.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE SEEDS NEEDED TO GROW THE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES HE CULTIVATES AND SELLS.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sophorn K. lives in Kchas village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer and a widow. She has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in school. Mrs. Sophorn K.’s business now has a small problem because she has doesn’t have enough draft animals to plow her rice field. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy another cow to be used as a draft animal. Mrs. Sophorn K. is shown in the photo with her son.

loans.use: To buy one cow to be a draft animal

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan S., 35, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, with her husband, Seng Ly Heng, and their four children. One of their daughters works in a local garment factory and helps to support the family, while Ngan S. sells fish in the food market. She typically makes $5 USD each day. Her husband operates a motortaxi service and his income varies each day.

Rising inflation has affected many Cambodian families over this past year and this family has been figuring out ways to decrease their expenses and save more money. Ngan S. has asked for a loan of $700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her family to commute to work each day. This will cut down on the family’s public transportation costs and will allow them to save money to be used for other needs.

Ngan S. was unavailable for a photograph at the time of the interview, so her husband, Seng Ly Heng, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase new motorbike

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
10 years ago, María sold sweets in a school in central Lima, but it was difficult to travel there, so she decided to install a store in her house. Thus, every afternoon, until midnight, María will leave to sell sandwiches outside of her house in a little sandwich car. It was her daughter who convinced her to start this business. The loan that she has requested will be used to buy a sandwich car, stock her store, and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 10 años, María vendía golosinas en un instituto en el centro de Lima, pero luego le fue difícil trasladarse hacia allá, por lo que decidió poner una tienda en su casa. Asimismo, todas las tardes, hasta la medianoche, María va a salir a vender sandwichs afuera de su casa en su carrito sanguchero. Fue su hija quien la animó a incursionar en este negocio. Los préstamos que ha solicitado los utilizará en comprar su carrito sanguchero, stockear su tienda y arreglar su casa.

loans.use: Buy a sandwich car, stock her store and fix up her house

loans.name: Clavelitos Group

texts.en:
The Clavelitos ("Little Carnations") group is made up of six men and eight women from Oruro, a small mining city in southwestern Bolivia. Most of the group sells food: Julia, Eugenia, Gladys, Sabina, and Hilda sell prepared meals, Clemente and Maximo sell potatoes, Gregoria sells coffee, Filiberto sells meat, and Jorge sells beer. Of the remaining group members, Juan Alvaro sells replacement parts, Beatriz and Florentino sell clothing, and Jacinto sells pants. Most of the group members have 5 years of experience or less in their respective businesses, though four of them have more than 10 (and Beatriz has 25!). Their meetings are held every other Monday at 5pm at Clemente's house.

Most of the group members plan to use their loans to buy more ingredients to prepare food or more merchandise to sell.

Translated and elaborated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

el grupo los clavelitos consta de 14 integrantes, la mayor parte de los integrantes del grupo se dedican a la venta de comida, tambien comercio como ser venta de verduras, carne, ropa usada y de abarrotes.las reuniones son cada lunes a las 17:00 en casa de Clemente H. C..

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare meals and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam T. is fifty three years old. He is married and has two children.  One of his children is working and the other is still in school. Sam enjoys operating his business and is motivated to work hard because he dreams of a better future for his kids. He owns and operates a "drinking spot" and sells items such as canned drinks, alcoholic beverages etc. However, he is constrained by the lack of capital and is unable to make meaningful progress. He requests the loan to buy more crates of beer, canned malt, Pepsi and Coke so that he can earn increased profits. He also believes in maintaining good customer relations.  The loan will enable him to materialize his dream. 

He is a member of the community group named "Hyebenehi" Trust Group.  In this group, members guarantee and assist one another to repaying their loans. His picture was taken after one of the group meetings.

loans.use: to buy more beverages for his business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es una persona  a la que le gusta luchar y que no se da por vencida fácilmente, madre de 4 hijos:   Armando de 18 años estudiante universitario; Uriel de 13 años estudiante de secundaria; Luís de 6 años estudiante de primaria y Marlen de 4 años estudiante de pre-primaria.
 El negocio lo comenzó su esposo en al año 1975, y trabajaba con varias editoriales. Al fallecer él en al año de 1993, aprovechando la cartera de clientes que existía y el contacto con las editoriales, ella decidió continuar  con el negocio al que él se dedicaba, que es la venta de libros de texto y guías para estudiantes, ya que es un negocio que  conocía y le gustaba, además  era una actividad que le permitiría estar mas tiempo con sus hijos para no descuidar su educación. Hoy en día mantiene un buen número de clientes, principalmente maestros de escuela primaria y secundaria.

Ella necesita un préstamo por MXN $10,000 que pagara en 6 meses para adquirir libros y surtir los pedidos que le hacen los maestros, ya que ellos necesitan estar actualizados con las guías de estudio y exámenes. Con tu apoyo ella podrá continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Francisca is a person who loves to work hard and does not give in easily. She is the mother of 4 children: Armando, age 18, college student; Uriel, age 13, middle school student; Luis, age 6, elementary school student; and Marlen, age 4, pre-school student. Her husband started the business in 1975, and he worked with various publishers. Upon her husband’s death in 1993, Francisca took advantage of his established client-base and his publishing company contacts. She decided to continue with his business selling text books and student guides because it was a business in which she already had experience and which she liked. Furthermore, it was a business that would allow her to spend more time with her children so that she would not neglect their education. Today, she maintains a good number of customers, especially elementary and middle school teachers. She needs a loan of $10,000.00 Mexican pesos, which will be repaid in 6 months, in order to purchase books and fill the teachers’ orders because they need to stay current with their study guides. With your help, she will be able to continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase books

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory A. sells provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to expand her business by stocking her shop with products her customers need. She is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She needs a loan of N60,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. 
She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou R., 46, a mother of three children, lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where she works with her husband making brooms from bamboo and grass which they sell to the vendors at various markets in town, earning about $10 per day on average. Sou R. usually spends $100 on food and $20 on utilities per month.

She and her husband would like to request a loan from KIVA to purchase more bamboo and a grass named sdoub to increase the volume of their products to meet their growing customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more grass and bamboo to increase the volume of her products.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Lizbeth Pertenece al banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, tiene 34 años de edad, 1 hijo menor de edad, su esposo es comerciante.

Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles y compro artículos de zapatería, sandalias, 1 mesita al frente de la casa de su mama en el Mercado de Bellavista .

Con este préstamo de  S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invirtió en la compra de  mas sandalias zapatos, implemento su local, ilumino y compro rejillas para poner los zapatos.

Lizbeth se siente contenta por todo lo que a logrado en la vida y Agradece a Manuela Ramos por tener confianza en  ella y mantener la cordialidad de trabajar  juntos.
texts.en:
Lizbeth belongs to the Community Bank "Juntas hasta el final" ["Together till the end"]. She is 34 years old, has 1 young child, and her husband is a shopkeeper. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought shoemaking items, sandals, and 1 small stand in front of her mother's house in the Bellavista market. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she will buy more sandals and shoes, set up her stand, and buy lighting and racks to display the shoes. Lizbeth is happy for everything she has achieved in life. She is thankful for Manuel Ramos for having faith in her and for the opportunity to work together.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more sandals and shoes and to set up her stand and to buy lighting and racks to display the shoes

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
S. Rano is 44 years old. She is married and has four children. Rano has been running a grocery store for the past 2 years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and also detergents. The goods she has for sale are of very good quality with a wide selection. Rano is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to buy groceries from her again. Rano is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $ 600 USD for the term of 9 months to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Rano reach all of her aspirations.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, and as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th century BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet and New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the goods to increase the range available to clients.

loans.name: Khiv's Group

texts.en:
N., 52, is the leader of a loan group consisting of five members. She is a widow  and a mother of two children. One of her children is married and lives separately, and the other is single and lives with her, owns a taxi service with tri-wheel motorbike (toc toc). N. produces balls of rice which are used for the traditional worship and ceremony in the commune. She is good at making this product and earns a reasonable income from this business. N. recently planned to increase her business and is applying for a loan to build a small shop for making and selling her balls of rice. 

The other members of the group are: L., 44, who sells porridge for breakfast and is looking for a loan to rebuild her shop. P., 24, who works as a security guard for a private company is taking a loan to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. T., 55, who is a motor taxi driver is looking for a loan to buy a new motor for his business. And S., 62, who owns a grocery store is requesting a loan to buy more cooked ingredients for her store. They all live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a small shop to make and sell her balls of rice

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria I., 38, is married with six children.  She has six years of experience in planting taro, yams and bananas. She sells to the village people and the general public three days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145).  SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for home improvement.

loans.use: Purchase weed killer, timber, water hose, wheelbarrow, spade, bushknives, iron roofing and cement

loans.name: Yiriwaso Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes  du groupe Yiriwaso sont toutes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et  3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter et d’accroître leurs chiffres d’affaires. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente  de chaussures, d’orange, de pomme de terre et d’habillements pour enfants.  
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter,  50 paires de chaussures, 25 sacs de 100 kg d’oranges, 10 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre et 18 complets  pour enfants. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de la ville de Sikasso et au Burkina faso. Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché de Sikasso ville  sur place et souvent de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant en détail et à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 18 000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour payer la scolarité et la santé  des enfants  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The six women of the Yiriwaso group are all married and on average 34 years old with 3 children. They live in monogamous households in Médine, one of the areas of the city of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They are on their fourth collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their constantly increasing clientele and to increase their sales. They run a range of businesses, which include among others the sale of shoes, oranges, potatoes, and children's clothing. With this loan, they intend to buy 50 pairs of shoes, 25 100-kg sacks of oranges, 10 100-kg bags of potatoes, and 18 children's outfits. They supply themselves at the grand market in the city of Sikasso and in Burkina Faso. Their merchandise is sold on-the-spot at the Sikasso grand market and often door-to-door to a clientele composed of women and men, in cash at retail and on credit. They foresee realizing an average monthly profit of 18,000 FCFA each, of which one portion will be used to pay for their children's education and health, and the remaining portion will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a range of items

loans.name: Cinthya Jakylin

texts.es:
Cynthia es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Celeste.
Cynthia es casada, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Cynthia vende gelatinas que prepara con la ayuda de su esposo, sus ventas los realiza en la puerta del hospital de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Cynthia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, gelatina.
Los sueños de Cynthia son tener una tienda de calzados y comprar un carro.
texts.en:
Cynthia is a member of the Banco Comunal Maria Celeste. She is married, 22 years old, and has 2 sons. Cynthia sells jellies that she prepares with the help of her husband. She conducts her sales near the doorway of the Ayacucho city hospital, coming there every day to sell. Cynthia needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar and gelatin. Cynthia's dreams are to have a footwear store and to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de azúcar, gelatina.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Ashiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a very determined and responsible lady. She cares for her family a lot and never sees them in trouble. She tries to fulfill all the wishes of her three children with her embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells to the clothes shops and earns income.

Her husband has a poultry business. He has three years of experience in this business. Parveen baji is applying for a loan to buy chicken feed for her husband’s poultry.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Sonia baji wants a loan to buy bed sheets to sell.

Kalsoom akhtar baji wants a loan to buy goats for her animal-selling business.

Parveen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy chicken feed for her husband's poultry business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is 47 years old and lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Khaled has been selling fruits and vegetables for over 23 years. He has requested a loan of US$700 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his work. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.

Khaled is unique because he sells a wide variety of merchandise in his business. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he faced some funding obstacles but decided to proceed because he had a good reputation on which to build a business. He plans to improve his business further in future.

loans.use: Khaled will use the loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for his work.

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw O. is single with no dependent. He has received schooling through senior high.

Yaw sells and rents compact disks and video cassettes at Bla in Hohoe. Yaw will use the loan to buy more of the current foreign movies to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Yaw plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more of the current foreign movies and sell

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Каримов Аъзам является активным нашим клиентом. Он печет отличные лепешки. Даже соседи  приходят что бы купить у него пару вкусных лепешек. У него много клиентов.  Клиенты к нему приходят с тележками (арба) заполняют тележки лепешками и везут на рынок. Вечером они приносят получившую прибыль Аъзаму.  Ему нравиться его работа, он считает что хлеб всегда будут покупать и это является постоянным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Azam K. is our active client. He bakes excellent flatbread. Even his neighbors come by in order to buy a couple of delicious flatbreads from him. He has many customers. His customers come to him with carts (arba), fill the carts with flatbread and take them to the market. In the evenings, they bring resulting profits to Azam. Azam likes his work; he thinks that bread will always be in demand. This business is his only source of income.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of several bags of flour

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre, vive con su hijo Junior de 12 años, quien es el motor que impulsa su vida. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para poder mantenerse, el comercio ha significado para ella su principal fuente de manutención, y cuando llegó su pequeño hijo, hace 12 años, tuvo que optar por una labor que le permitiera estar más tiempo en su casa para cuidarlo y ayudarlo con sus tareas y educación. Es por eso que empezó a vender ropa a domicilio, labor que consiste en visitar las casas de sus amistades y vecinos para ofrecer las diferentes prendas que compra en uno de los centros comerciales más conocidos de Lima, esto en el centro de la ciudad. Susana vende a precios cómodos, es por ello que obtiene gran cantidad de clientela, además las prendas son de buena calidad, siendo un negocio muy rentable para ella. Con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprar 2 motocarros, los cuales alquila al día, obteniendo un ingreso extra por ello. Para un futuro cercano, a Susana le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa en su domicilio para no tener que caminar tanto. Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y está muy feliz con su grupo solidario, ya que ha quedado  las socias más puntuales, y todas son buenas amigas. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas, para así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Susana, 32, is a very happy woman. She lives with her 12 year old son, Junior. He is the motor that drives her life. Since she was very young she has worked to be able to support herself. Commerce has been her primary source of support. When her small son arrived 12 years ago, she had to choose work that would allow her to spend more time at home taking care of him and helping him with his homework and education. That is why she started to sell clothes at home. She visits the homes of her friends and neighbors to offer different articles of clothing that she buys in one of the most well known commercial centers in Lima, which is in the center of the city. Susana sells at low prices, and that is why she has a lot of customers. Through her work efforts she has been able to buy two “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized cart). She rents them out by the day, which gives her extra income. In the near future, Susana would like to have a clothing store in her house so that she would not have to walk so much. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She is very happy with her supportive group. The members are very punctual, and they are all good friends. The money will be used to buy more clothes in order to increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Vian John

texts.en:
Vian John Q. is from the village of Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old and married with 4 adult children. To make a living, Vian John provides motorcab services in the local community. Vian John has been in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

Vian John joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase equipment and he plans to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase equipment.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Mrs. Virginia V., 58 years old, is married with 3 children. She lives in Sitio Magtalisay, Brgy. Cervantes, Escalante City, Negros Occidental.  Virginia strives hard to help increase her family's income. Her main objective is to save enough so that she and her husband can secure a good future for their children, and also to acquire some productive assets that can be used to help increase the family's income.

When Virginia went into the fish vending business 20 years ago, she knew that if she worked hard enough, she could achieve all her goals. The business earns her PHP 6,000 per month, and after her household expenses, she puts the rest back into the business so that she can slowly but surely expand her operations and income capacity.  

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 for her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon to add to her revolving working capital, because she plans to use the profits to renovate and repair the family home.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Francisca de 27 años de edad, vende ropa y zapatos desde hace tres años en el cual ha logrado tener una buena clientela vende al  crédito de quincena y al contado. Reside en el barrio Waspan Norte en la capital de Managua, junto con su esposo y un hijo de un año, su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada y la apoya con todos los gastos. Ella inicio su negocio con ahorros que su compañero le dio y luego con préstamo que Afodenic dio el cual incremento su inventario. Con este préstamo comprara ropa variada para dama y caballeros y poder elevar las ventas. Espera obtener mejores ganancias y mejorar su vivienda para dar a su hijo una vivienda digna. Agradece Afodenic por la oportunidad del financiamiento ya que obtendrá mejores utilidades.

loans.use: Comprar ropa variada para dama y caballeros

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yacouba S. est marié à une  femme, père de 6 enfants, il est né le 31 Décembre 1974 à Kaï dans la commune rurale de  Loulouni, préfecture de Kadiolo, 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali.  Il vit avec son épouse et ses  enfants à Kaï dans un foyer monogame.
Il est commerçant  d’articles divers de boutique depuis plusieurs années  et fait  en plus, le commerce de céréales depuis 11 ans. Expérimenté en raison des années dans le commerce, Il les mène avec réussite.
Il est à sa deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Le prêt passé a été bien remboursé et il souhaite continuer avec l’institution pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients. 
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, 5 paquets d’articles divers de boutiques(des fournitures d’écoliers) et 1 tonne de céréales (riz et haricot). Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso ville et au marché de Loulouni les jours de foire. Il vend au comptant ou à crédit, en gros et en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Il envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour augmenter le fonds de commerce et l’autre partie sera mise en épargne car il ambitionne  construire une maison à usage d’habitation à Sikasso.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers de boutique et de céréales.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la cuidad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 65 años, madre D. siete hijos, todos mayores D. edad. Anita se dedica a la venta D. menús (comida), este negocio lo realiza en su casa, ella da pensión a unos trabajadores D. construcción civil. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las  Ucayalinas” desD. hace cinco años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue D. 300 soles, que fue utilizado para comprar abarrotes y vender, actividad que ya no realiza.
Actualmente ella necesita un crédito D. 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos e insumos para la elaboración D. sus comidas, ya que ella cobra semanalmente a sus comensales (clientes). La meta D.  Ana María es tener un restaurante bien implementado.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a hardworking woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 65 years old and the mother of seven children, all of whom are adults. Anita sells “menú” (plates of food) for a living. She works out her home and pays a salary to a few to a few civil construction workers. She has been part of the comunal bank “Las Ucayalinas” for five years. Her first loan was for 300 soles with which she bought groceries to sell. She is no longer in that business. Isabel now needs a loan of 1500 soles to buy products and supplies to make her meals, since she charges her clients on a weekly basis. Ana María’s goal is to have a well established restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare meals

loans.name: Moul

texts.en: Moul K., 40, is married with four school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she sells fish and vegetables at the market, earning approximately US $5 per day. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is a middleman, buying cows from the local farmers in the village and selling them to the markets in town, earning an income of US $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. K. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, K. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase cows, fish, and vegetables to expand the current business.

loans.use: To buy cows, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Mariposas Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: Mariposas fue fundado el 22 D. julio del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio  .Se encuentra situado en el B/ 1ro D. Agosto D. la Zona D. La Colorada. El grupo  esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 15 personas, como Presidenta tenemos a la señora: Lucinda, Tesorera: Mary Luz  y como secretaria: Clara. En el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. bijouteria, comida, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi,  venta D. horneados y panaderia, que son actividades que nesecitan creditos rapidos. Las Señoras estan muy contentas D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena. 
La Sra.Lucinda es Presidenta del grupo, es la segunda vez que esta como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento MARIPOSAS. La Sra. nacio en Santa Cruz D. la Sierra. Ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes al credito que distribuye entre sus vecinos del barrio y D. otros barrios cercanos,  atienD. a sus dos hijos, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo es por eso que la han elegido como presidente y las reuniones se realizan en su casa.Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar.			
La Sra. MAry Luz, es socia antigua del Banco D. Emprendimiento MARIPOSAS. Se dedica a la panaderia, cocina y además es promotora D. cosmeticos por catalogo. Todos los dias se levanta a las 3:00 am para hornear el pan que venD. hasta las 7:00 am, luego sigue con sus actividades D. cocina y en su tiemnpo libre visita a sus amigas para ofrecer sus cosmeticos. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la panaderia,  tambien realiza labores D. casa. Ella es muy responsable dentro del grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender es importante para ella. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, las socias del grupo la consideran responsable y cumplida en el grupo. Ella es unas D. las fundadoras del grupo.			
La Sra. Balbina,  es socia del BE MARIPOSAS, se dedica a la venta D. ropa a credito, ropa para mujeres, niños y varones, la misma que distrubuye a sus clientes en diferentes empresas y entre sus conocidos del barrio, se ocupa D. esta actividad desD. las14:00 hasta las 22:00,  ella nacio el 30 D. marzo D. 1977 en la provincia Cordillera D. Santa Cruz, hace 2 años que se dedica a este rubro  su trabajo mayormente es atender los pedidos D. ropa que le hacen. La Sra es fundadora en el grupo  y la  oportunidad que le brinda el Banco D. Emprendimiento Mariposas es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
The Mariposas communal bank was founded on 22 July 2009 by initiative of a group of women who hA. small businesses and want to grow in their business. It is located in the 1ro D. Agosto neighborhood in the La Colorada zone. The group is in its second cycle, maD. up of 15 persons. As group president we hA. Lucinda. Mary Luz is treasurer. Clara is secretary. In the group are some women who sell costume jewelry, prepared meals, cosmetics, mocochinchi (A popular drink in Bolivia maD. form cooked dehydrated peaches), bread and pastry making. These activities require quick financing. The women are very happy to work with Emprender because they learn how to sA. and to be very responsible and respectful as well as sharing with their fellow members and neighbors every two weeks.
