loans.use: To start a new business selling maize flour

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en: Kudirat A. is a 48 year old mother of 4 children and lives in Mushin, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes and drinks to the people in her community and she has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to enable her buy more clothes & drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes & drinks for sale

loans.name: Kidawa

texts.en:
Kidawa is 28 years old and is married with two children, ages 7 and 1 1/2. She and her husband also take care of two other adults. Kidawa owns a small shop, which she opened in 2007. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $140.

Kidawa now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more goods for resale in her store.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her general store

loans.name: Ricardo Rodolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Ricardo F. is 23 years old, lives in the Memorial Sandino district, is an engineer for Sistema and is married. He has alwasy planned to build his house to give better and more comfortable conditions to his family.

Mr. Ricardo hopes that in the future to gain a better standard of living for his family. With this loan, he hopes to build a room and he needs to buy materials for this. He is asking for a loan for a time period of of 9 months, by means of monthly guarantees.

This story has been translated from Spanish to English by Nikita Ramchandani, KIVA Volunteer.

El Señor Ricardo F. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en el Barrio Memorial Sandino, es ingeniero en Sistema y es casado.Entre sus planes ha estado siempre construir construir su casa para darle mayor comodidad y condiciones de vida a su familia.

Don Ricardo espera en un futuro lograr un mejor estatus economico y social para el y su familia , con este credito el espera construir un cuarto y necesita comprar materiales de cosntruccion por lo que solicita un prestamo con un lapso de 9 meses, mediante abonos mensuales

loans.use: To buy construction materials to continue working on his house.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es:
Santos Alexander is a humble man that earns a living in the cattle farming business in the Cinco Pinos municipality of the city of Chinandega. He is the father of a young son, who motivates him to work harder everyday to be able to meet his needs.

It is important to note that this business requires a lot of physical work mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Santos continues to work hard and it has now come to Ceprodel to obtain the loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El caballero Santos Alexander es una persona muy humilde que labora en el negocio de ganadería en el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es padre de un hijo pequeño el cual es el motivo por el cual cada día se esfuerza aun mas para satisfacer sus necesidades.

Es necesario destacar que el negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico por la sencilla razón de que debe de trasladar los animales de una distancia a otra atravesando largos trechos de camino bajo la exposición al sol lo que provoca enfermedades y mucho desgaste físico. A pesar de esto, Santos continua trabajando fuerte y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de novillos para su desarrollo y comercialización en su zona donde se desempeña.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls

loans.name: Madawa P.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Madawa P. S.. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 8. She has four dependents, who live with her because they are orphans and relatives. In 2005, Madawa established her hair salon. Madawa has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy hair dryer and also some cosmetics in bulk. In the future, Madawa plans to be a popular hair designer. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and some cosmetics in bulk.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng S., 27, is a garment factory worker in Kampong Cham, Cambodia, and makes $3 USD each day. She lives with her husband, Noy Noeun, who operates a motortaxi service and can usually make $6.60 USD each day. They have one small child at home and have been looking for ways to increase their income and improve their standard of living.

Heng S. has asked for a loan of $500 USD to invest in her husband’s taxi service and to purchase a new motortaxi to replace their old one. Their old one uses a lot of gas and is constantly in need of repair, which cuts into the income her husband is able to make. She believes that this investment can help the family in the long-term and looks forward to seeing the results.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
After having a disastrous relationship, as she describes it, where her partner beat and mistreated her, she started her life as a merchant, some 18 years ago. This was in spite of the fears she had of starting a business due to her low self esteem.

Ana is part of the Señor del Cautivo II community bank and currently has 3 stores, 2 of which are rented (internet service and cleaning products sales) and the other is a children's footwear store.

Taking advantage of the market day of Huaraz, and this loan of 1,700 Soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will rent two stands and set them up, one selling various toiletry items and the other selling typical foods.

Ana, who is 49 years old and without children, hopes to finish building her house and to open stores in Lima to be able to live on the income in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de tener una relación desastrosa, como lo califica ella ,donde su conviviente la golpeaba y le maltrataba, ella inicio su vida de comerciante hace 18 años, a pesar de los temores que le causaba comenzar un negocio debido a su baja autoestima.

Ana forma parte de Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”, en la actualidad tiene 3 tiendas, dos alquiladas (servicio de internet y venta de productos de limpieza) y la otra para la venta de sus productos de calzado para niños.

Aprovechado la feria de Huaraz, y el préstamo de S/. 1,700 soles, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, alquilará dos stand e implementará, uno para venta de diferentes artículos de tocador y otro para la venta de comidas típicas.

Ana de 49 años y sin hijos espera concluir la construcción de su casa y abrir tiendas en Lima y en su vejes vivir de sus rentas.

loans.use: Purchase of toiletries to sell.  Ingredients for selling food.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.es:
Flavia tiene 34 años D. edad, estudió tercero D. secundaria, es casada, madre D. cuatro hijos, vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca.

Es una D. las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva D. la  Comunidad D. Machacmarca, Distrito D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao-Puno, con su primer préstamo 
D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 03 ovinos para su posterior venta, Doña Flavia manifiesta que desD. los 15 años D. edad empezó a vender gaseosas en la feria D. Pilcuyo, desD. que convive con su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganado vacuno, ovino, los días martes compra D. Huacullani y venD. los días domingos en la feria D. Ilave.  

Con este crédito D. S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas, comprará 01 toro para su posterior venta.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar una casa en la ciudad D. Puno y seguir con su negocio aumentando más ganado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Flavia is 34 and studied through her third year of secondary education. She is married and the mother of 4 children, they live in the Machacmarca community, Pilcuyo District, Collao-Puno Province. With her first loan of $110, she bought 3 sheep for future sale. Doña Flavia has proven herself, since at the age of 15, she started selling soft drinks in the Pilcuyo street market. Since she has been living with her husband, she has supported herself by buying and selling sheep. She buys on Tuesdays in Huacullani, and sells on Sundays in the Ilave street market. With this loan of $575, which she will repay in 4 installments, she will buy a bull for future sale. Her biggest dreams are that her children would become professionals, to buy a house in the city of Puno, and to continue to grow her business by purchasing more livestock for market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (a bull)

loans.name: Azel

texts.en:
Azel Q. is a 38-year-old married man with three children. Azel is a hard-working man who, while continuing to work another job, started his own business as a source of additional income and savings in case of unemployment. He knew many people who purchased cattle, and this motivated him to start his own business eight years ago. Over time, he has increased his cattle sales, and he is proud to say that the business has been running well, but he now needs additional capital to expand his business. 

Therefore, Azel is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase four calves.; He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them in helping to expand his business and helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy E., 47, and her husband, Mr. Seng Sun, 52, live on an island of the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1979, and have four children; three sons and one daughter. The oldest son is a soldier, two are weavers, and the youngest son is in school.

Mrs. Savy has been a silk weaver since 1985, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She also buys them from other villagers to sell in other provinces. Her husband is a school principal. She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To buy silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en:
Elshad H. is a 32-year-old entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs and detergents in his store. His store is very famous in his community, so he has a good clientele. He also works as a policeman in the police department of the city where he lives, but his salary is not enough to cover the basic needs of his family. When he is at work, his wife replaces him in the store.

Today Elshad is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his store's stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Elshad’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. His perseverance and clear vision will be key factors in the success of his small business.

loans.use: Purchase more food inventory

loans.name: Yourn

texts.en: Mrs. Yourn C. was born in 1964 and lives in Doun Vong village in Kandal province. She is a widow with a child who works in a garment factory. Although they work hard, they live in an old house which is in poor condition. In order to improve her life, Mrs. Yourn C. is applying for a loan to buy wood with which to build a new house. She hopes she can provide better conditions to her family with this loan.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Zully

texts.es:
Pertenece al Banco Comunal  “Juntas hasta el final”, que se ubica en AV: bellavista 1247 del distrito de Calleria, tiene 26 años, 1 hijo, su esposo es chofer, como socia lleva 2 años en Manuela Ramos.

Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro algunos sacos de arroz y empezó a venderlo en el mercado, su esposo no tenía trabajo y estaba enfermo, al ver el progreso y esfuerzo  de su esposa el puso de su parte restablecer su  salud, y ahora la apoya con su negocio.

Con este préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 1500.00, compro una tonelada de arroz, y reparte en todos los mercados, su cobranza es al contado y diario.

Esta muy contenta , feliz porque su hogar está muy unido y su negocio crece cada día mas.
texts.en:
Zully is 26 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has been a member of the Community Bank called “Together To The End” for two years. With her first loan of approximately $100 USD, Zully purchased several sacks of rice and began selling it in the market. At the time, her husband was ill and could not work. When he saw the effort Zully made in supporting them, he was better able to focus his efforts in getting well and now he also supports them as well through his business. With this current loan of approximately $475 USD, Zully will purchase a full ton of rice, which she will then sell in all the local markets. She keeps track of her earnings and sales on a daily basis. Zully is very happy these days because she and husband are working together towards their goals and her business grows every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a full ton of rice to sell in all the local markets

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar Y. is a woman who on a daily basis seeks the betterment of her 3 children. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a little girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and it has been a stable source of income until this day.

For more than 11 years, Mutabar together with her husband has been raising sheep and also growing some crops on their land. To continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality, Mutabar wants to borrow money for growing hay and other feed for his sheep on his land. For that she needs to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Let’s show solidarity to this selfless mother who looks for what is best for her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mamou

texts.fr:
Madame Mamou C. a 37 ans mariée, elle réside avec son époux et ses 2 enfants (1 garçon et 1 fille) à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Mamou C. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès au village, s’initia depuis deux ans, à l’activité d’achat et de vente des calebasses et divers dès  son arrivée en ville.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec  elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 3 colis de calebasses. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des paysans dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les revendre  en détail, au comptant et à crédit  à Nièna et dans les zones minières à  une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout de miniers. Il s’agit de l’orpaillage (exploitations minières traditionnelles) dans les placers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Mamou C., age 37, is married and resides with her husband and two children (a boy and a girl) in Banconi, one of the outlying densely-populated districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work in the village unsuccessfully, she got introduced two years ago to buying and selling calebasses (cups and bowls made from a dried gourd) and various other goods as soon she arrived in the city.

Wanting to do better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is on her first individual loan. She plans to use this loan to buy 3 packages of calebasses. She supplies herself from rural producers in the towns near Sikasso and then sells the goods retail, cash or credit accepted, in Nièna and in mining zones. Her customers are generally composed of women and especially miners. This has to do with the washing of gold (a traditional mining process) at sites having alluvial deposits of gold.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to increase her working capital, to help with family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calebasses

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en: Sosefina T. S., 38, is married and has 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days a week. This is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145 USD). SPBD loans are Sosefina’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.Sosefina use her loan to buy tools and chemical for her business also her home improvement.

loans.use: Purchases to buy some tool to use for planting taro &taamu also chemical to killed inset.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es: El señor Orlando José tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Colonia Centro América en la ciudad de Managua de la Iglesia católica 3 c al Sur,  su esposa es ama de casa, y le tiene dos hijos de 4 y 7 años de edad, don Orlando es taxista desde hace ocho años le servi a la comunidad por sus servicios de carreras. El inicio comprando este vehiculo con ahorros  de su trabajo anterior, este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic que ha sido de muchos beneficios para seguir adelante con los objetivos y proyecciones en su vida, con esta solicitud va a comprar planta de batería para renovar el servicio de operaciones, sus planes es poder mantener en buen estado su vehiculo para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes, en un futuro espera cambiar de unidad de vehiculo.
texts.en:
Olando José is 41 years old and lives in the "Central America" suburb in the town of Managua of the Catholic church on the Third South road. His wife is a a homemaker and they have two children aged 4 and 7. Orlando is a taxi driver and for the past eight years he has served the community through his journey services. He started by buying his car with savings from his previous job. This is his third cycle in Afodenic which has been of considerable benefit in allowing him to move forward with his objects and aims in life. With this loan he is going to buy a battery unit in order to improve the services he offers. His plan is to be able to maintain the good state of his car in order to be able to continue to offer a good service to his customers and in the future he hopes to change his car.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a battery unit to improve the services he offers

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana B. tiene 52 años de edad, es Casada de oficios tejedora, “elaboración de cortes típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 telares, habita junto con sus hijos, ella y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 35 años de elaborar cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Primero Palemop, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana B. is 52 years old and is married. She is by trade a weaver "making typical skirts for women". She has a workshop with two looms and lives together with her children. She and her husband both work in the same trade and have two employees working in the same activity. She has 35 years experience making skirts in her home, which is located in Primero Palemop hamlet, in the Vásquez neighbourhood of the department of Totonicapán , Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers is growing, but because of the current economic climate she is not able to increase her capital. It's for this reason that Teresa approached the ASDIR Association in order to ask for a loan, with the intention of purchasing primary materials and in this way be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Artesan: Increase capital

loans.name: Michèle Victorine

texts.fr:
T. Michèle Victorine est née le 23 mars 1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin dans le Département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin. Michèle Victorine est mariée à MOHAMED Kémal. Michèle Victorine est mère de cinq enfants, tous à la charge de son mari et elle. Michèle Victorine est Coiffeuse de profession. Michèle Victorine a son atelier de coiffure dans la zone des Ambassades et mène à côté de l'atelier la vente des cartes de recharge téléphonique dans une petite cabine téléphonique. Michèle Victorine a déjà bénéficié de trois créditsq pour son activité de téléphonie. Michèle Victorine sollicite un quatrième crédit pour renforcer cette activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
T. Michèle Victorine was born on March 23, 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County in southern Benin. She is married to MOHAMED Kémal and is the mother of five children, who are all supported by her and her husband. Michèle Victorine is a hairdresser by profession. She has her own salon in the embassy row area and manages the sale of mobile phone recharge cards in a small phone booth next to her shop. She has already benefited from three loans for her telephone business. She's requesting a fourth loan for it. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone recharge cards wholesale

loans.name: Al Ahli Group

texts.en:
A. Ahli is a group of four women who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon.

Afandiya is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children. She has owned livestock for 40 years and she is also involved in milk production. Afandiya is sucessful in her work because she is experienced. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties since she learned it when she was young. Afandiya decided to set up her business because it is in demand in her region. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock and milk production. This is the first time that Afandiya has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock.

Zeinab is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She has been working in agriculture for eight years and she owns livestock. Zeinab is successful in her work because she enjoys it. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided to set up her business because of her financiA. needs. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Zeinab has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Saada is a 35-year-old married woman with one child. She has been working in agriculture for 20 years and she owns livestock. Saada is successful in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. Saada decided to set up her business because it is in demand in her region and because she likes animals. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Saada has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Chama is a 21-year-old woman. She has been working in agriculture for ten years and she owns livestock. Chama is successful in her work due to the experience she has gained since she was young. Her clients are people from her region. She requested a loan of $300 USD from Kiva partner, A. Majmoua, in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Chama has requested a loan. In the future, she plans on improving her work by expanding her livestock.

About group loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To increase her livestock

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Sanga is a married woman with 8 children.  Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest child is 10.  Those of her children who are still in school, go to private schools.    

Sanga has two businesses.  For her primary business, she sells various small things at a local market in the Lakpazee community of Monrovia, Liberia.  At this market she sells mainly onions, spices, bottles of oil, and salt.  She also has a business doing agriculture.  In that business, she grows rice and fufu.     

This is her second loan, and she will be restocking her market stand.  Right now her table is very bare from the sales she has made, so she will be restocking.

loans.use: To buy onions, pepper, salt, spices, and more oil

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Mely is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mely owns & operates a business venture, fishing and retailing fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from fishing and selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Mely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Mely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for additional working capital. Mely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase kerosene, and as working capital. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Mely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital, as well as the purchase of kerosene and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús R. de 60 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colon del departamento de La Libertad. Jesús se dedica a la panadería, negocio propio que inicio hace doce años con el apoyo de su esposa, la panadería de Jesús posee una buena clientela y ha ido ganado la preferencia de muchos a través de los años y también por la fama que tiene el pan de Jose, el crédito que solicita en esta oportunidad es para destino en capital de trabajo ya que desea comprar materia prima para la elaboración de pan.
texts.en:
Jesús R. is 60 years old and lives in Lourdes Colon in La Libertad District. He operates a bakery, a business he started 12 years ago with the help of his wife. His bakery has a good customer base and has become a favorite of many over the years. Jesús is famous for his bread.

The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy ingredients for making bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem C., age 28, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she has to travel far to a market in the outskirts of Phnom Penh City to sell vegetables, typically earning a gross income of US $42 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate a better source of income for his family. He is engaged in a business as a motor-taxi driver, providing his services to people in the city.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, C. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, C. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to transport her vegetables to sell and generate a better income to raise the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: For motorbike purchase

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda manages a typical village store in the simple village of Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela.  Aside from managing her store, she is also into vending of vegetables. From those businesses she is earning a weekly income of PHP3, 000 that is being revolved in the business to grow. In connection to this she wanted to avail a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP6, 000 as additional business capital for her store and vending of vegetables. 


Esmeralda is already 55 years old, she is married to Leoncio and they are blessed with 3 children namely; Alexander - 37 years old, Bernie - 36 years old, followed by Froilan - 35 years of age, and they also have an adopted child named Evangeline who is now 16 years old, and now a college freshman. Esmeralda hopes to give her adopted child a good education for her to have a better future someday thus, she is hoping to improve her business more.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
Iris tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y padre de sus dos hijos en la casa de sus padres. A ella le gusta realizar las tareas agrícolas, ya que se dedicó a esto desde niña, por tal razón ayuda a su esposo a machetear los arbustos de sus chacras de plátanos. Pero como sus hijos ya están más grandes, sus necesidades se han incrementado, por lo que Iris decidió incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de frutas, con el fin de dinamizar su economía y que no le falte nada a sus hijos. Por ello, dos veces por semana recoge los plátanos de sus chacras y compra naranjas de sus vecinos, para que el jueves (día de feria) muy temprano acuda al mercado de la ciudad. Y luego de una ardua jornada, a eso de las 5 de la tarde, regresa a casa muy contenta con las compras para la semana y su esposo le da el alcance para ayudarla con la carga.
Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP, en sus créditos anteriores ha demostrando puntualidad en sus pagos, además que le gusta asistir a la todas las reuniones de su banco comunal, pues se divierte mucho con sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en el incremento de su capital para la compra de más frutas. También adquirirá fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de plátanos.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes y más frutas para la venta

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 31 years old.  She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom attend school. Rebecca sells porridge in her neighborhood. Almost all Ghanaians enjoy eating porridge for breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains and then boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread or with "kose." Kose is made from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so it is ready to be served with the porridge in about 20 minutes. With a growing customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar, and milk to increase production. She would be grateful for any assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad D. Pucallpa región D. Ucayali, tiene 60 años, madre D. seis hijos mayores D. edad. Rosaura se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, actividad que desarrolla en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo, él es jubilado (cesado,ya no trabaja) del magisterio. Rosaura forma parte del Banco Comunal “Ricardo Palma” desD. hace cinco años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue D. 300 soles, que utilizó en la compra D. gaseosas, ahora ella necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles, que será utilizado para comprar una vitrina mas, para exhibir su mercadería y también para comprar prendas D. vestir. La meta D. Rosaura es  tener una tienda D. artículos D. regalos para toda ocasión.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a hard-working and dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the region of Ucayali, Peru, and is a 60-year-old mother of six, all of whom are grown up. She makes a living selling clothes, an activity she carries out from her home. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a retired teacher. She has been a part of the Ricardo Palmo Community Bank for the past five years. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she used it to purchase soft drinks to sell. Currently she is requesting a loan of 2500 soles (approximately $875), which she plans to use to purchase a display case to show off her merchandise and to also purchase more clothing to sell. Rosaura's goal is to have a store selling gifts for all occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and a display case to show offer her merchandise

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia E. is from the village of Pangabuan Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Verginia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Verginia owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products and dried goods products in the local community. Verginia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Verginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Verginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Verginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to pay for daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en: Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Felista A. from Tukuyu. She is married with three children between the ages of 3 and 7. Felista has been running a tailoring business since 2005, making and selling clothes. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week and currently earns about 110 USD. Felista is requesting a loan in order to buy materials in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of her product. She thanks you for your support! About SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials  in bulk for her business

loans.name: Gotitas Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento GOTITAS trabaja con nuestra Institución desD. el año 2007, este banco se caracteriza porque es antiguo y esta bien consolidado. PATRICIA .- Es una joven participante y ocupa el cargo D. presidenta, trabaja con un punto D. llamadas, con el prestamo a logrado emprender otro negocio que es L. elaboración y venta D. chocolates, D. esta manera a podido colaborar en aumentar los ingresos D. su familia.CARMEN; L. Sra. es tambien una D. las fundadoras D. este grupo y tiene a su cargo L. secretaria, con el prestamo a podido diversificar sus productos en L. venta D. ropa y peluches, tambien a podido compar diferentes productos  para su Salón D. Peinados D. esta forma a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad D. vida.TERESA, L. Sra ocupa el cargo D. tesorera, elL. se dedica al comercio, con el prestamo a podido diversificar y comprar más productos para su tienda y D. esta manera ahorrar y mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. elL. y su númerosa familia
texts.en:
The GOTITAS Entrepreneurs Bank has worked with our institution since 2007. This bank is known for being well established. PATRICIA - is a young member who acts as president. She works at a call center, and with this loan can start another business selling chocolate. In this way, she can increase the income of her family. CARMEN – She is another of the founders of this group and has the position of secretary. With this loan, she can expand her merchandise in clothing and stuffed animal sales. She can also buy different products for her hair salon. In this way, she can improve her earnings and quality of life. TERESA – She has the position of treasurer. She works in commerce. With this loan, she can diversify and buy more products for her store. In this way, she can build her savings and improve quality of life for herself and her large family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Judith Adhiambo

texts.en:
Judith is married to Stephen and they have one child: Sandra. Judith makes dresses for a living and she has done this service for five years. Though she also serves clients who are from within the area where her business is located, she largely relies on orders from other rural areas.

Judith was introduced to KADET by other existing clients and she is going to be servicing her second loan. She has no previous credit history. She intends to use the loan to expand the business by purchasing a sewing machine and increasing her dress-making materials stock. With the extra profits, Judith hopes to expand the business to become a company.

Judith aspires to own a boutique as she believes she is hard-working and focused.

loans.use: The loan will be used to expand the business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, age 39, is a farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She tills a 2-hectare (~ 5-acre) rice field to make a living for her family. She’s the mother of two children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old. She needs additional capital to finance her farm. She joined in Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and requested a loan of 15,000 Php. She will use the loan to purchase farm supplies and improve her rice field.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells frozen food such as chicken, turkey and ice fish in her shop at retail prices. She has been in this business for seven years. She hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase two deep freezers as well as frozen foods for her business. She thank all Kiva lenders.
Deborah is married with three children who are excelling in school. She supports her husband, who is a businessman, in taking care of the family with the profits she makes from her business.

loans.use: To purchase two deep freezers and frozen foods

loans.name: Respe De Romeo Group

texts.en:
The Respe de Romeo Group is excited about receiving their firS.loan from Esperanza. The group has a variety of businesses from selling gas to selling food on the Haitian-Dominican border.  Ghuslene L. is the representative of the group. She is a 33-year-old wife and mother of three children.
Ghuslene is a long-term charcoal maker and seller. Her intereS.in joining Esperanza came from hearing about associates in neighboring towns grateful for the opportunity and increased benefits of having a loan. She says, “There were people who wanted to do business, but needed a little bit of help…Esperanza is helping.” She dreams of being able to grow her business and send her kids to school with greater ease. On behalf of Ghuslene, the Respe de Romeo Group and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and wood

loans.name: Rodito

texts.en:
Rodito S. is from the village of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 35 years old, married and has 2 children. To make a living, he operates his business, selling of dried goods in their community. Rodito has been engaged in his business for over 5 year and earns approximately 8,000.00 PHP.

In 2007, Rodito joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodito is requesting a new loan of 30,000.00 PHP which will be to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle that will be used for his business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rodito from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

 About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Niroshani

texts.en:
Niroshani is a married, 30-year-old woman living with her husband. She has two children, one of whom is 2 and the other is 6 months old.

Niroshani’s mother and sister help her to handle her business, which consists of making bricks which are then sold throughout her local town. She has been doing this activity for one year now.

Her husband has a government job, so she runs this brick-making business independently. She is a hardworking, active, and honest woman. She wants to be a self-sufficient woman some day, as she does not like to depend on other people.

Niroshani is seeking a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help expand her business and to purchase bricks.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase more bricks

loans.name: V.maghuyop's Group

texts.en:
Vilma M. is from the village of Calube. She is 49 years old and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Vilma is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she sells dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and makes approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2005, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Now she is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 7th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs (plantains and palm oil) to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D., 40 years old, is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has two school-aged children.

Helen is involved in rice farming. She says that proper financing is one of the factors in having an abundant harvest. She is happy that she and her husband work hand-in-hand in order to provide for their family.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is happy that the MFI (micro-finance institute) was able to reach her town.

Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her seventh from CEVI.

Helen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 15 dozen hair pieces, 15 boxes of beauty products and 8 dozen hand bags

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida C. is from the town of Poblacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 56 and married with two adult children. To make a living, Adelaida raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Adelaida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to  purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to renovate existing shelter for her livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Adelaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate existing shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus E. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Venus is single and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling a variety of ready-to-wear products in the local community. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Venus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Venus is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Venus from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Nathaniel

texts.en:
Nathaniel is 28 years old and married with one child.  For seven years, he has been selling charcoal and firewood.  He also runs a retail shop.  

He is a member of Tinganga Jikaze group in Faulu Kenya. Being a member of the group, he can be guaranteed a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has requested  a loan of 50,000 KES to buy charcoal and firewood to resell.

He hopes to expand his shop into a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Ana Andrea

texts.es: Andrea tiene 57 años de edad vende en el mercado municipal de San Martín Jilotepeque, todos los días trabaja, se dedica a la venta de comida, y en su casa tiene crianza de cerdos. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar cerdos,  alimento para sus animales y maíz. Su sueño es ampliar su venta de comida y tener un local donde vender, ya que por el momento vende en la plaza del mercado municipal. Agradece a FAPE / KIVA por el apoyo que le estan brindando para poder realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
Andrea is 57 year-old trader working in the municipal market of San Martín Jilotepeque. She sells meals there every day, and at home she breeds pigs. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy pigs, animal feed and maize. She dreams of increasing her meals sales and to have a vending stall, as right now she sells her products in the square of the municipal market. She is thankful to FAPE and KIVA for the support they are providing, as this will help her making her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her activity.

loans.name: Lung

texts.en: Lung L., 47, is widowed and resides with her three children in Kompong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. L. is a farmer and is able to earn an income of USD 2 per day. One of her children is employed at a local construction factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. L. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to finish building her son's house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to buy more plots of farmland.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L. appears in the photograph with her son.

loans.use: finish building her son's house

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a Kiambu-based businessman who sells meat in his butchery. He has been running this business for the past ten years and serves area residents. At 43 years of age, Julius also sells used clothes to earn extra income. He is married and is a father of three ranging between 4 and 20 years of age. He was formerly employed as a butcher and hopes to build his own shop and open another business in five years. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to increase the stock of meat in his butchery. He describes himself as consistent, hardworking and determined.

loans.use: Adding stock of meat

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret T.  is currently in the business of owning a restaurant and selling clothes and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  Margret is 31 years old and is married. Her husband is a carpenter. She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop to sell her clothes.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rukarara Development, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
K. Amiria is a hard working former agriculturalist who has raised capital and started a rice selling business in Kihihi town. The 29 
year old married mother of 4 children has good clientele relationships, which has gotten her business many regular customers.

Her main challenge currently is low stock. Therefore, she plans to buy more stock for resale for her business with this loan. She is very optimistic about expanding her business and improving her family's standard of living in the near future.

Amiria belongs to Rukarara development group, whose members hold each other accountable for paying back loans.

loans.use: Purchase of more stock of rice

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua H. sells 'wakye' (beans and rice cooked together) at Abura.  Ekua has received senior high school education.  She is married and has eight dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua has been selling 'wakye' for ten years. She assists her husband in the payment of the family’s expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more beans, rice and other ingredients to prepare 'wakye' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to help in providing the basic needs of the family.

The picture shows Ekua with her cooked food ready for sale.

loans.use: buy more beans, rice and other ingredients

loans.name: Rosemary's Group

texts.en:
Rosemary O. is from Calabayan Ozamis City. She is 24 years old. Rosemary is the group leader for a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosemary is single and has one child, who is an infant. To make a living, Rosemary owns and operates a  specialized retail store. This is not her only means of generating income.  The main source of income comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Rosemary is just starting this business.

In 2010, Rosemary joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemary is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosemary from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilson Oswaldo

texts.es:
Wilson de 58 años, tiene un puesto de venta de ceviche de concha (hecha con limón, sal, concha, cebolla) un plato marinero muy típico en la playa. Vive en un cantón llamado Playas uno de los lugares turísticos del Ecuador con una diversa dimensión de mariscos.  

Hace 20 años atrás comenzó con el negocio de venta de ceviche de concha para mantener a sus hijos. El trabajo lo realiza con ayuda de sus hijos ya que ellos recorren las playas vendiéndole a los turistas los ceviches de concha mientras que el también trabaja en un puesto de madera vendiendo los ceviches. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 19h00pm vendiendo cada plato de 12 conchas a $ 4.00. 

Para seguir con su negocio él quiere comprar con el préstamo mas conchas a los pescadores para tener más ingresos. En el futuro quiere tener su negocio en otro lugar mas cómodo para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilson, 58 years old, has a food stall where he sells shellfish ceviche (made with lemon, salt, shellfish and onion), a very typical seafood dish, on the beach.  He lives in an area called Playas, one of the tourist attractions in Ecuador, where there is a diverse range of shellfish.  

He began his business selling shellfish ceviche 20 years ago to provide for his children.  His children help him work, walking up and down the beach selling shellfish ceviche to the tourists, while he works in a wooden food stall selling the ceviches.  He works from 7:30am until 7:00pm, selling each plate of 12 shellfish for $4.00. 

To continue with his business, he would like to use the loan to buy more shellfish from the fishermen so he can earn more money.  In the future he would like to have his business in another location more comfortable for his clients.

loans.use: Shellfish

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna I. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish-vending business. She lives in Brgy. Coro, Dalaguete, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions through her own efforts and with the help of her loans from NWTF. By working hard in her business, Myrna is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 11,200 PHP. 

Myrna is now borrowing 29,000 PHP so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan of 29,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Myrna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee tiene 43 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de realizar esta actividad todos los días, pues sus clientes llegan a comprar sus productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella ha tomado experiencia en este tipo de negocio pues es una persona muy trabajadora. Ahora solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima y aprovechar estar festividades.
texts.en: Haydee is 43 years old and owns a small general shop.  She has had this business for over eight years.  She is a very responsible person and enjoys working there every day.  Her clients come to purchase gummy candy, refreshments, bread, detergent, and basic grains.  She has had experience in this type of business and is very hard working.  She is requesting a credit to purchase raw materials and take advantage of the holiday season.

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of home equipment merchandise to sell

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Cheam C., 31, is married and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells food in front of a garment factory, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 44 on food and USD 28 on their other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a sugarcane squeezer to improve her food selling business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: Buy a sugarcane squeezer to improve food selling business

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Successful entrepreneurship cannot be achieved without certain skills and abilities. Just having financial capital and a desire to open up your own business is not enough. A newcomer in the business sphere needs to have an idea that he’s going to fulfill in practice, as well as the ability to survive  strong competition and stay in business by attracting more customers. 

Elmira Y., 27, has acquired good skills for a successful future in entrepreneurship, except the most necessary criteria – capital. Elmira works with technical personnel in two places of employment. She and her husband, who also acquired a job in the technical sphere, are young parents of three kids, the oldest of whom is six years old. Elmira’s husband has always told her that she’s got exceptional managerial skills. Elmira has always been good in managing the family finances and has used all the resources she had with minimum waste. 

Recently the family came up with an idea of starting to resell vegetables in a market in her home town of Tashkumyr. Vegetables and fruits are highly consumed by customers, and almost never lose demand. Elmira hopes that her experience in planning and organizing will help her in business. She expects high profits in the upcoming years and the successful repayment of the loan. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marleni, tiene 2  hijos,  es conviviente  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año, Marleni  es integrante  del grupo “Madres Unidas”, grupo conformado por 12  integrantes. Marleni trabaja vendiendo dulces  desde hace 8 años y a su vez también vende comida en su casa, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado comprar un terreno y así brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería  y seguir vendiéndolos. Sabemos que Marleni   cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Sra. Marleni is in a common law marriage and has two children. She has been working with EDAPROSPO for one year. Marleni is part of the group “Madres Unidas” (United Mothers), which consists of twelve members. She has been selling sweets for eight years and also sells food from her home. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she was able to buy a plot of land so that she could provide her children a better quality of life.

To keep growing, Marleni is requesting a new loan to buy supplies so that she can continue making sales. She will be able to accomplish her goals through work, effort, and the help of the loans from EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria Paulina; La socia tiene 56 años de edad, la socia es separada,  tiene a todos sus hijos independientes, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tortas, también vende cosméticos, la socia antes solía trabajar en el supermercado Mega en la ciudad de Cusco, pero ahora con sus ingresos del banco pudo dedicarse a la elaboración de tortas y las vende de forma independiente, la socia también  se ha inscrito en la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, la socia desea el crédito para poder hacer de este un capital de trabajo y poder invertir en sus negocios y comprar insumos y materiales para la elaboración de tortas y también pedir unas ofertas para guardar hasta que estas salgan de los catálogos y los pueda ofrecer para tener un margen de ganancia.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” community bank. This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cuzco. 

The member is named Maria Paulina. She is 56 years old and separated. All of her children are grown. She makes cakes and sells cosmetics. Previously she worked in the Mega supermarket in the city of Cuzco, but now with her income from the bank she has been able to make and sell cakes independently. She has also signed up to sell cosmetics via catalogue. She is asking for the loan to be able to have some working capital and be able to invest in her businesses and buy ingredients ad materials to make cakes. In addition, she wants to ask for some samples to have until they come out in the catalogues and she can offer offer them and have a profit margin.   

The member is happy wit the loan that has been given to her and is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: To invest in her businesses

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es:
Marilu tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Viven en la ciudad de Morropón en el departamento de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el capital de la región de Lambayeque. 

Desde hace 4 años, Marilu tiene un Bar – Picantería, un establecimiento donde vende comida, piqueos y bebidas como cerveza, chicha y gaseosas. El negocio se encuentra en su propio domicilio. Marilu es muy conocida en la región y cuenta con una clientela establecida.

Desea ampliar su negocio con su crédito y planea comprar más mercadería para responder a la demanda de sus clientes. Con esta inversión, puede lograr mayores ganancias y mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia. También, desea usar una parte de su crédito para comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos menores ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Para realizar sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. Posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Ha tenido otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones en una manera puntual.
texts.en:
Marilu is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Morropón in the Department of Piura, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the Lambayeque Region.

Marilu has had a Bar – Restaurant for the past four years where she sells food, snacks and beverages like beer, chicha (a drink made from purple corn) and soda.

She wants to expand her business with her loan and she plans to buy more merchandise to meet her customers’ demand. With this investment, she will be able to achieve higher earnings and improve her quality of life and that of her family. She also wants to use a part of her loan to purchase school supplies for her young children now that the school year in Peru has begun. In order to reach her goals, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa. She has good personal and professional references from her urban community. She has had other loans and she made her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her restaurant

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 34 years old and married with four children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

Erlinda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Erlinda aspires to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Jane Waruguru

texts.en:
Jane has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 16 years. She is 45 years old and married to John Chege. They have two children.   

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid for her previous loan of KES. 10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and payment for manual labor for tomato farming

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is from the village of Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling firewood and green bananas in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of firewood and bananas. This loan will be the first taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of firewood and bananas

location.town: Buguac, Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro City

loans.name: Hatam

texts.ru:
Hatam yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Horadiz, vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Yemu 47 let. Ranshe Hatam zanimalsya prodajey fruktov i ovoshey. Eto yeqo vtoraya ssuda , pervuyu ssudu ne bilo nikakix problem s yeqo oplatoy.
 Seychas uje qod kak on nachal zanimatysa skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo novoqo biznessa. 

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/114393
texts.en:
Hatam is an Internally Displaced person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in Horadiz together with his family. He is married and has two children. He is 47 years old. In the past Hatam used to sell fruits and vegetables. This is his second loan, and the first loan has been repaid without any problems.
Now it has been a year since he started raising cattle. He needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle to develop his business further.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/114393

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda, age 33, runs a retail shop in Mombasa Kiembeni estate. Her business has been in operation for the last year. She and her husband have one child.
 
Emelda has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. With this loan, she plans to increase her inventory of cooking oil, flour, rice, and sugar. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to help support her family.
 
Her dream is to own a big shop in future.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of cooking oil, flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Yesyes

texts.en:
Yesyes is 32 years old, and she has two children who are ages 9 and 14 years old. They are both in school. She is a widow. 

Yesyes own a bar and a shoe wholesale shop in which she sells  different kinds of beer and shoes respectively. She has done this business for the past three years and her business is going on well. This business has enabled her to pay school fees for her family and expand her business as well. She needs a loan to reinvest in her shoe business, buying more shoes for sale.She plans to re-invest her profits.

loans.use: to buy shoes for sale.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with two children. She is 43 years old and has had a food selling business for almost 10 years. She sells food like peanut butter, good for sandwich spreads, and food flavorings. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP (~$75) a month.

She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as peanuts, sugars and cooking oil, and also plastic jars for packaging. In the future, Visitacion hopes to sell more food products in order to generate more income to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts, sugars and cooking oil, and also plastic jars for packaging.

loans.name: Maïmouna's Group

texts.fr: Mariée, Maïmouna vit avec ses 5 enfants et son mari en location à Zogbo, un quartier populeux de Cotonou la capitale du Bénin. Tous les enfants du couple sont scolarisés et pour les charges relatives à leur scolarité et autres, le couple participe ensemble. Maïmouna une commerçante. Elle vend diverses variétés de céréales, la boisson traditionnelle communément appelée SODABI et les condiments à son domicile. Elle fait des ventes en gros et en détails à ses clients se trouvant dans sa zone commerciale et ses environs. La cliente s'approvisionne dans quelques villages du Bénin, à savoir Adja Azovè, Houègbo, Glo où les coûts des produits sont relativement plus abordables. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité afin de jouir d'une autonomie financière, Maïmouna a sollicité et obtenu le renouvellement de son crédit à FINADEV (elle est à son 2ème crédit). Le revenu généré par ce prêt lui permettra d'être indépendante financièrement et de couvrir certaines charges familiales. Elle souhaiterait s'acheter une parcelle et construire une maison, pour le bonheur de toute sa famille Maïmouna, chef du groupe, en tenue traditionnelle communément appelée Boba, de couleur belge fleurie et positionnée à droite sur la photo, s'est associée à Mme Jacqueline A, elle aussi commerçante à Cotonou. Les deux forment un groupe solidaire très appréciable.
texts.en: A married woman, Maïmouna rents a place with her five children and husband in Zogbo, a populous district of Cotonou, the capital of Benin. The couple’s children are all in school. As for the cost of schooling and other costs, the couple covers them jointly. Maïmouna is a merchant. She sells a variety of grains, the traditional drink commonly called sodabi, and some condiments out of her home. She makes her sales retail and wholesale to customers found in her commercial district and nearby.
