Our client stocks up in a few villages in Benin, namely Adja Azovè, Houègbo, and Glo where the cost of goods is relatively affordable. To increase the size of her business in order to enjoy some financial autonomy, she has requested and obtained the renewal of her loan at FINADEV (she is on her second loan). The revenues generated by this loan will enable her to be financially independent and to cover certain family expenses. She would like to buy a plot of land and build a house for the sake of her entire family. Maïmouna is the head of the group. In the photo, she is at the right and wearing traditional clothing called a boba with beige flowers. She is joined by Ms. Jacqueline A, who is also a merchant in Cotonou. The two comprise an appreciable solidarity group.

loans.use: to buy fifteen 100-kg sacks of grains, two containers of sodabi, and also three baskets of tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en: Sreymao, 27 years old, is a weaver. Her husband is a worker. Their income is $9 per day. She has one child who one year old.  Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $6 on electricity, $25 on transportation, and $25 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a cow for feeding to get its baby to sell. Before, she was a farmer but she uses her free time from farming to weave to makes skirts to sell. Now she only weaves at home because she has to take care of her children.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is 49 years old, married and with two children aged  8 and 19.  He runs a retail shop where he sells cereals so as to earn a living for his family.  He uses his bicycle whenever he goes to get his business stock.  

Cleophas joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial resources easily.  He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

Cleophas hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Illimo que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Magaly se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puedan ofrecer a sus clientes y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales como aves de corral y alimento balanceado para los mismos, una vez que se engorden los vende a los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un mejor precio por ellos y así pueda tener más ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Magaly es una persona trabajadora y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Magaly is 28 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. They receive services such as running water and electricity. Magaly resides in the rural section of the District of Illimo, which is part of the Department of Lambayeque. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture and livestock breeding.

Magaly has been raising and selling pigs for a few years. The animals are kept in a pen behind her house and fed a diet of balanced feed. Once the animals have reached optimal growth, she offers them for sale to her customers. With the income she earns, Magaly is able to cover her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to buy more animals, such as chickens, and the appropriate balanced feed. As soon as the animals are fattened, Magaly will sell them at different markets in the area in hopes of obtaining the best price. This will allow her to obtain more income so that she can have a better quality of life. Magaly is a hardworking and responsible person. Her only wish is for her family to move forward.

loans.use: to buy more animals and the appropriate feed.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a 44 year old business man. He is married and blessed with four children who are still in school. For the last year he has been managing a retail shop to earn a living. He is also employed. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar and cooking fat. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save part of his income.

loans.use: To buy sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete renovations to his business facility

loans.name: Mahbuba's Group

texts.en:
Mahbuba is the leader of this group. She is 44 years old and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is raising two daughters, both of whom study at school. Four years ago, Mahbuba used an initial investment of 30,000 KGS to start a business selling spare parts. She has achieved good results in the past four years and has been able to build a small store and increase her business sales. She currently earns 8,000 KGS profit each month. 

Mahbuba is requesting a loan to purchase more spare parts and improve the assortment of goods that she sells. In the future, she plans to purchase a container.


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man, working in agriculture for the past six years. Ali is a hard worker; he loves his business and works hard to improve it. Ali farms other people's fields. He fertilizes them and works hard to make them productive. He sells the crops in wholesale markets after he pays what’s requested from the owners of the land. Most people who own land find it hard to harvest and plant their own fields, which makes Ali's services in high demand.
He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy the necessary fertilizers and agricultural chemicals for his business. He prefers to buy these supplies in large quantities, because that brings down the price. 
Ali hopes to own his own land in the future, because then he would be able to keep more of the profits and not pay the landowner.

loans.use: To buy the necessary fertilizers and agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
Pheap is 42 years old and has 5 children. Her children are still in school.

She is a farmer, and she feeds cattle to help prepare her land and for plowing purposes. She has been farming on her farmland for 12 years.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She requested a loan to buy a water pump and fertilizers for her farmland. With the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase and improve the quality of her crop yield in order to sell her crops for a good price, which would enable her to earn more income to feed her family, to save for the future, and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump and fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Baowendpinda Group

texts.fr:
Mme Sanata est la responsable du groupe BAOWENDPINDA. Elle a levé la main sur la photo.  Elle est marié et mère d’un enfant. Il a 12ans et va à l’école. Elle a une personne à sa charge.

Mme est tisseuse depuis 5ans et vend parallèlement des mangues à la période des mangues. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de kouritenga.Ses clients les hommes et femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter une  balle de fils de tisse et 03kg de teinture.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle économise et subvient à ses petits besoins. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique de pagnes tissés et prendre soin de son enfant  pour un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Sanata is the leader of the Baowendpinda group. She has her hand raised in the photo. She is married and the mother of one boy, who is 12 and goes to school. She has one dependent. 

Sanata has been a weaver for the past 5 years, and also sells mangoes when they are in season. She obtains her supplies at the Kouritenga market, and her customers are male and female. Sanata wants to buy a bale of thread for weaving, and 03kg of dye. 

With her profits, she adds to her savings and and covers her basic needs. She plans to open a large shop of woven cloth (pagnes) and to take care of her child to give him a better future.

loans.use: to buy one bale of thread for weaving and 03kg of dye

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a married man with four children living in Hioma, Uganda. He deals in buying and selling beans and groundnuts. He has been doing this business for 12 years. The main challenges he faces are fluctuating prices and inflation. His business goal is to expand his business and be able to save more for the future. His personal goals are to improve his standard of living and educate his children. William needs a loan to buy groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rowelyn

texts.en:
Rowelyn is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Rowelyn has run a shop for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Rowelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia, por su necesidad de aumentar el servicio que presta, solicita nuevamente un préstamo para el pago de un mecánico en la compra de repuestos para su molino, ya que por el momento presenta desperfectos, esto mejora su capacidad de respuesta clientes.
Ella tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, logrando mejorar y pagando puntualmente el préstamo.
texts.en:
Because she needs to produce more, Antonia is asking for a new loan to pay a repairman and to buy parts for her mill, since at the moment it is malfunctioning.  This will improve her ability to supply her customers.

She had good results from her previous loan as she was able to improve things and make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy parts for her mill

loans.name: Egamberdi

texts.ru: Эгамберди проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его сын работает строителем. Сам Эгамберды выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Egamberdi lives in the Yavan district.  He is 41 years old, married and has three children.  His son is a construction worker.  Egamberdi grows vegetables for sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a 44 year-old mixed crop farmer.  She is a single mother of three children aged 15,13 and 10 years respectively. She has been in the farming business for the past two years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with Kiva partner KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Sabina will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover expenses for setting up a speech therapy practice

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: Nigora was born in 1977 year. She has four children. Her husband works in farm. She was start working 15 years ago in farming sphere. Every year she gets a good income. For the next year she wants to enlarge her business and to get a good harvest. She wants to buy seeds, fertilizer and other products for new sowing. She needs to money. She is asking for a loan of 8000 with this aim. She hopes with your help and mercy she can buy seeds fertilizer and necessary things for farming and will get a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer for new sowing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start a milk shop business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old and married with 5 children. She completed basic education many years ago and could not benefit from any vocational training. She therefore decided to venture into second-hand clothes sales early last year. She treks with her 'goods' in the community and the villages nearby. She took the KRABAN 'TEACH' learning sessions last October.

She is willing to take a KIVA loan to buy the used clothes directly from suppliers who bring them from Accra for sale on weekends.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
María de Jesús is married and 38 years old. She has two children, who are studying. Her husband is employeed, but his income is not sufficient, so she decided to help him with the home expenses. María knows how to mae piñatas, which are used a lot at Mexican parties, and started out selling them to her neighbors four years ago. Her husband and their children help her with making them and she doesn't have any additional employees. Currently, she's selling her piñatas to merchants at the Juárez market, which is well-known in her city.

María de Jesús is requesting a loan in the amount of US$150 to be able to buy raw material, since she has several requests to fill and needs cash to be able to do that. She is offering to pay this loan in a period of 3 to 6 months and her vision is to have enough capital to set up a place where she can sell her piñatas and sweets. She and her family thank you for your support so they can achieve their dream and progress as a family.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

María de Jesús esta casada y tiene 38 años de edad, ella tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian, su esposo es empleado, pero no es suficiente su ingreso ya que están pagando su casa por eso es que ella decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar. María tenía el conocimiento de la elaboración de piñatas, que son muy utilizadas en las fiestas mexicanas y en un inicio comenzó vendiéndolas con sus vecinos hace ya cuatro años atrás. Su esposo y sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración de las mismas y no tiene empleados adicionales. Actualmente ella vende sus piñatas a locatarios del mercado Juárez, que es muy conocido en su ciudad.

María de Jesús esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$ 150 para poder comprar materia prima ya que tiene varios pedidos por surtir y necesita efectivo para poder cumplir con los mismos, ella ofrece pagar este préstamo en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses y su ilusión es tener suficiente capital para poner un local donde pueda vender sus piñatas y dulces. Ella y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das y así poder lograr su sueño y salir adelante con su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is 54 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 6 children.  Mrs. Keo S. works by selling vegetables, and can earn about $3/day.  Her husband is a driver at a private company, while her eldest son is a mechanic.  This loan will be used to provide her son with tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en: Eneng is 20 years old and is married. She has no children yet from her marriage, but she lives with her big families. She has been mining gold traditionally since she became a member of MBK, and usually earns $3 per day. She needs a $50 loan to expand her business and hopes to earn more, because it is their livelihood.  She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is the mother of eight children, some of whom are now grown and have children of their own. Recently, her life has been difficult because thieves broke into her home and stole many valuable items. She also suffered from an illness that required her to have surgery. These difficulties mean that she no longer has sufficient money to meet the needs of her family. She is determined to overcome these problems with a loan that she can use to buy firewood and food items to sell to the people of her village. She will use the income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees and buy pots and plates that she can use at home.

loans.use: To buy firewood, oil, salt and other items

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Ms Tâm is 39 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Everyday she makes "chè" (a typical vietnamese sweet dessert/snack which is made of mainly coconut cream, tapioca bubble & beans ..yummy) and sells it in front of her house. Her husband held all kind of jobs but now he's home helping her running the "chè" stand. This is their main family income. They wish to borrow 2.006.000VND (~125 USD) to stock up the ingredients. They will set aside savings to repay the loan.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tâm năm nay 39 tuổi, chị đã lập gia đình và có hai đứa con. Hàng ngày, chị vẫn nấu chè và bán tại nhà. Chồng chị trước đây cũng làm nhiều nghề nhưng bây giờ anh ở nhà phụ chị bán hàng. Nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị từ việc bán chè. Anh, chị muốn vay với số tiền 2.006.000VND mua thêm nguyên liệu để nấu chè. Lãi từ việc thu nhập này anh, chị sẽ trích một phần hoàn vốn và đóng tiền học cho con.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make dessert ("chè")

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad owns a sawmill in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. He is a 38 year-old father of two children.

This is the second time Ahmad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs to carry out the maintenance of his business' equipments in order to stay afloat in the manufacturing industry. Ahmad is known to be a very competent and hard-working man.

loans.use: For the maintenance of his business'' equipments

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Mrs. Edith belongs to the community bank Mujeres Solidarias, located on Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo # 507, district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old, mother of 3 grown children, married and her husband is a merchant. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 Soles (USD$100) she invested is a small grocery store.

She currently is still working at the grocery store, getting up early in the morning to take care of the business and her domestic chores.

With the loan of 1300 Soles (USD $450), which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy a sack of sugar, one sack of rice, a case of oil, milk, notebooks, soft drinks, gelatins and others.

Edith tells us that she feels very well, her business grows bigger every day and now she will be able to remodel her home and buy some things that she needs. She is also very grateful for all the support from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Edith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Solidarias, ubicado en el Jr. Cesar Calvo de Araujo Nº 507, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la pequeña bodega con la cual ya contaba.

En la actualidad continúa con la bodega, se levanta muy temprano para atenderla y simultáneamente comparte las tareas domesticas.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,300 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de aceite, leche, cuadernos, gaseosas, gelatinas, entro otros.

Edith nos dice que se siente muy bien, su negocio crece cada día mas y ahora podrá remodelar su casa y comprarse algunas cosas que le hacían falta, además está muy agradecida al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries (sugar, rice oil, milk, etc)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothing and jewelry in bulk for her store.

loans.name: Thị Liễu

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thị Liễu is 66 years old. She's requesting a loan of 2.006.000 VND to buy pigs to raise. She and her husband are hard working people. Her husband makes bricks and his income is steady. Mrs Liễu likes SEDA because it gives her a chance to increase her family income and make some savings.

Translated form Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Bác N. Thị Liễu (MS: 06020013), năm nay 66 tuổi, vay 2.006.000 VND mua lợn về nuôi. Bản thân bác và bác trai rất chịu khó. Hai bác làm lò đốt gạch có thu nhập thường xuyên nên bác thấy tham gia chương trình là biện pháp tiết kiệm tốt và tạo thêm công việc cho gia đình.

loans.use: buy pigs

loans.name: Yda Maria

texts.es:
Yda is a member of the Community Bank “Renacer.” Yda is married, 32 years old with two children, and together with husband and the help of employees, she makes artisanal items made from the stone of Huamanga (alabaster), such as Nativity scenes. Their products are sold by distributors in the city of Lima.

Yda also has a store selling headstones in front of the general cemetery in the city of Ayachuco. The headstones are made by her husband in different materials such as marble, most of which are brought from the city of Lima.

Yda needs a loan of 2500 soles (US $ 925), money that will be invested to buy marble and stone from Huamanga. The dreams of Yda are to buy more technical machines, to better her businesses and to offer a good education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Yda es socia del Banco Comunal Renacer.

Yda es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Yda junto a su esposo y con ayuda de empleados realizan artesanías, tallados en piedra de Huamanga (alabastro) como nacimientos, sus productos lo envían a intermediarios en la ciudad de Lima.

Además Yda tiene una tienda de lapYdas al frente del cementerio general de la ciudad de Ayacucho, las lapYdas son elaboradas por su esposo en distintos materiales como mármol, mayólicas que son traídas de la ciudad de Lima.

Yda necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de mármol y piedra de Huamanga.

Los sueños de Yda son comprar maquinarias más tecnificadas, mejorar sus negocios y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Yda needs a loan of 2500 soles (US $ 925), money that will be used to purchase marble and stone from Huamanga.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of clothing to restock a small business.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Suy P., 48, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia with her husband, Chea Ionh. They have four children. She works on her farm land each day and makes less than $1 USD. The family is also aided by the support of three of the children. Two of the children are tailors and one works in a local organization. Together, they are able to provide $150 USD each month for their parents.

Suy P. has asked for a loan of $1000 USD to make an investment in her childrens' tailoring business. She would like to purchase more cloth for their business, so that they can make more clothes. This investment will allow her children to expand their current business. She looks forward to seeing the family’s standard of living improved.

loans.use: Purchase more cloth

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Seven years ago, Reynalda's daughter wanted to study cosmetology, when she was only 13. Reynalda took her to her classes every day, and this is how both mother and daughter learned this skill.

Six years ago, Reynalda decided to start a small salon in her home. She works every day, and her neighbors and friends are familiar with her work. Reynalda also sells nutritional products called Omnilife. She offers them in a display case located in her salon.

She has used the loans she has received to furnish her salon and to purchase supplies for her work.

Reynalda also has plans to sell candy in a cart outside of her house. She would like to have another salon.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 7 años, la hija de Reynalda quiso estudiar cosmetología teniendo tan solo 13 años. Por ello, Reynalda la llevaba todos los días a sus clases. Fue así que tanto la hija como la madre aprendieron este oficio.

De esta manera, hace 6 años, Reynalda decidió instalar una peluquería en su casa. Ella trabaja todo el día y ya sus vecinos y amigos la conocen. Asimismo, Reynalda vende productos nutricionales Onmilife. Ella los ofrece en una vitrina colocada en su peluquería.

Los préstamos recibidos los ha utilizado en amoblar su peluquería y para comprar sus materiales de trabajo.

Reynalda también tiene planes de vender golosinas en una carreta afuera de su casa. A ella le gustaría tener otra peluquería.

loans.use: To furnish her salon and to purchase supplies for her work

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el AA.HH Portillo, Jr. Ricardo Flores Mz.J Lt.36, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Gloria tiene 42 años de edad, 4 hijos y su esposo es chofer. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad Gloria cuenta con una bodega y 2 motokar, y además recibe el apoyo de sus hijos que la ayudan en la atención en la bodega y uno de ellos maneja la motokar.

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,500, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 paquete de fideos, 1 galón de aceite, golosinas, 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, pasamanerías y otros.

Gloria es una mujer que día a día trabaja para poder brindarle algo mejor a sus hijos y sobre todo una buena educación y que gracias al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos está consiguiendo ciertos objetivos.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the Indo American Community Bank, located in AA.HH Portillo, Jr. Ricardo Flores Mz.J Lt.36, Yarinacocha district, department of Ucayali. Gloria is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband is a driver. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in the sale of food. At present, Gloria has a cellar and two motorcars. She also receives support from her children who help in looking after the cellar, and one of her children drives the motorcar. With a loan of $850, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 1 package of noodles, 1 gallon of oil, sweets, 1 sack of rice, 1 bag of sugar, and other items. Gloria is a woman who works every day to be able to offer something better for her children and, above all, a good education. She gives thanks to the communal bank of Manuela Ramos to help her achieve certain goals.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of groceries (noodles, oil, rice, sugar, etc.) and sweets

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en: Alaga H. is 31 years old. He lives with his parents who are now retired, and his business in the only source of income for the family. Alaga sells foodstuffs, including cookies, candy, condensed milk, tea, and canned mayonnaise, in a store that he rents. Altogether, he has been in this business for five years. He is very polite, and his store is very popular in the local community. Currently, Alaga needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase a larger variety of additional foodstuffs for sale. He hopes to thereby increase his sales, to earn more, and to better meet the needs of his family. Alaga thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchase of additional food items for sale

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry S., born in 1962 and a resdent of Boeng Village in Kandal Province, is a grocer currently facing the problem of low working capital. In order to solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy grocery goods to replenish her inventory. She hopes to thereby increase income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Ry is the mother of a child employed in a garment factory while her husband, Mr. Doung Oul, presented on the right in the photo, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher A. is a businessman. He has run a shop for 4 years at Vingunguti ward. He sells a variety of items to customers. He purchases the commodities from wholesale shops at Kariakoo shopping center. He manages to meet the daily family needs from the business. He requests a loan of Tshs1200,000 to expand the business.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Mei

texts.en:
Mr. Mei S. lives in the village of Krodas Khor in Kampong Cham province. He is 55 years old and the father of three children: two are palm juice collectors and the third is a farmer.

Mr. Mei S. is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 3-hectare field. His wife, Mrs. Muong Ba, helps him on the plantation. He now faces a problem: his field is infertile, which leads a poor crop. To deal with this problem, Mr. Mei S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the field and make it more productive. He is shown with his wife in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make his field more productive

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is married. She has received schooling through senior high. Esther sells groceries such as biscuits, canned products, and others at a place popularly known as the Dutch Cemetery in Elmina, which she has done since 1995. Her husband is a policeman.

Esther uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Esther will use the loan to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to add to her husband's savings to acquire a piece of land to build their family house.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to meet the increase in demand

loans.name: Matalena

texts.en:
Matalena L., 37, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and the public 2 days per week.

Matalena has 3 previous loans with Kiva partner SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 420 Tala (~175 USD). SPBD loans are Matalena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. With her loan, Matalena will purchase chemicals, pesticides and equipment needed for running and maintaining her plantation business. Part of the loan will also be used to pay her children's school fees

loans.use: Buy chemicals, pesticides and equipment for her plantation

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Mr. Dina S., 38, and his wife, Mrs. Saret Vor, 34, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1998 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and another one is a baby. Besides his children he also has his parents living with him.

Dina has been driving a motor taxi (tuk tuk) for four years, which he drives in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Saret Vor has been selling gasoline for seven years. She buys it from Phnom Penh for resale in her village.

Dina’s motorbike and a passenger trailer were broken and he spent a lot of money to repair it. Moreover, it is difficult for him to earn income to support his family. So Dina is applying for a loan of $700 to make the replacement.

loans.use: To replace a motorbike and a passenger trailer (tuk tuk)

loans.name: Lote

texts.en: Lote, 34, is married with one child.  She has many years of experience in the pork bun business. She sells to the villagers and public five days per week. She has had one previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Lote’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Teresa de Calcuta.
Maria estudio repostería, le gusta la cocina, primero empezó vendiendo productos  de belleza por catalogo, después empezó alquilando dvd, después puso una bodega, después  se puso a vender chicharrones, desde entonces ha ido juntando un capital  y puso un restaurante, ella trabaja con toda su familia, diario vende ochenta menús.    
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, va a comprar sillas, mesas, y  va ha pintar su restaurante.   
Desde que esta en Finca, los prestamos le han ayudado para invertir en el negocio, aprendió   ahorra,  a  esforzarse para lograr lo que quiere.
El sueño de Maria es que su negocio crezca y ampliarlo aun más.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Teresa de Calcuta Community Bank. She studied baking and likes to cook. She has had a variety of businesses, including selling beauty products from catalogs, renting dvds, running a grocery store, and selling pork rinds. Finally, she got enough capital together to open a restaurant. Her family helps her work in the restaurant and they sell eighty meals per day.

Maria is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase chairs and tables, and to have her restaurant painted.

FINCA has helped her invest in her business, learn to save, and motivated her to reach her goals.

Maria's dream is that her business will grow and expand even more.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables, and to have her restaurant painted.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine T., a local entrepreneur in Makeni City. Josephine sells rice, flour, sugar, drinks, cold water, etc. She wants a loan in order to strengthen her business. With a loan, she will be able to travel to as far as neighboring Guinea to buy goods at a cheaper rate and make a better profit. 

Josphine is twenty-six years of age, married to a lecturer, and the two of them have one child together. Josephine was born in Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. 

This is the third loan Josephine is accessing from Kiva through SMT. The previous loans helped her a lot in feeding the family and paying school fees for her junior sisters and brothers. With this loan, Josephine will feel comfortable and happy as it will promote both her business and her self esteem, she told me.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 32 años, es una madre alegre y dinámica en cada uno de sus trabajos, vive con su pareja y padre de sus hijos en su casa propia. Fue campesina desde niña, por ello que le tiene un gran cariño a cada uno de sus cultivos, los cuales orgullosamente muestra, y para la foto sostiene los bulbitos secos de la flor llamada gladiolo. Generalmente se dedica al cultivo de flores porque le generan mayores ingresos, con el apoyo de su esposo trabaja muy duro diariamente para lograr cosechar en grandes cantidad y de buen tamaño para que tenga un mejor precio en el mercado. Sus labores en el campo son muy duras y pesadas; pero ello no le ha quitado la alegría, y siempre tiene una sonrisa que brindar. Para el futuro, Maribel se proyecta a sembrar en mayores cantidades, aunque su dificultad mayor es el costo elevado de los fertilizantes, ya que sin ellos sus productos no se desarrollan bien. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, sus compañeros del banco comunal ya están en el 5to crédito debido a que ella se incorporó en el 2do ciclo de este grupo y está muy contenta con el trabajo organizado de todos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, y de ese modo abonar la chacra de papas y de flores que sembrará en el transcurso de estos días.
texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years old, and is a mother who approaches all of her work happily and dynamically. She lives with her husband and children in their own house. She has been a farmer since she was a child, and that is why she is very fond of all of her crops, which she proudly shows; in the photo she is holding the dried bulbs of the gladiolus flower. Maribel generally makes a living growing flowers, since they generate the most income. With her husband’s help she works very hard each day looking after their great quantity of large-sized crops, which will fetch a better price at the market. Her work in the field is very hard and tiring, but it continues to be enjoyable, and she always has a smile when she works. In the future Maribel is planning to plant larger amounts of crops, though the biggest problem is the high cost of fertilizer, since without it her crops will not grow well. This is her 4th loan with Kiva partner MFP, though her colleagues at the communal bank are already in their 5th loan cycle because she joined the group during its 2nd loan cycle; she is very pleased with everyone’s work. The money that Maribel is requesting is for purchasing chemical fertilizer. She will use it to fertilize the field where she grows potatoes and flowers, which she will plant in the coming days.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin trabaja como transportista en el trufi 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa tiene su movilidad propia, la cual es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos; la esposa se encuentra trabajando en la Republica de Argentina como costurera..

Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la Zona Villa Alpacoma de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para comprar un motor más nuevo para movilidad.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite la aprobación del   préstamo solicitado por el prestatario.
texts.en:
Edwin works as a driver in the “trufi” (a taxi with a fixed route) 88 in the Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa. He has his own car, which is his primary source of income to support his three children. His wife is working as a seamstress in the Republic of Argentina. He lives in his parents’ house, which is in the Villa Alpacoma zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy a newer motor for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a newer motor for his taxi

loans.name: Daniel Kipchirchir

texts.en: Daniel is twenty nine years old and married with one child. He operates a taxi in Eldoret town. Most of his customers hire him for his services both within Eldoret town and in its outskirts. He has been in the taxi business for two years. Daniel is intending to expand his business to serve customers outside Eldoret town. He also intends to graduate to transporting farm produce from the rural sector to urban places. Finally, he hopes to sponsor his wife to go back to college and further her studies in food science at Egerton University. Daniel believes that with this loan he will be able to increase his income thereby contributing to improvement of his family status. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy four new tyres for his taxi and to pay for its maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing additional stocks of "Vitenge" in bulk

loans.name: Kari

texts.en:
Kari is 25 years old and is married with no children. Her husband is a teacher. Kari dedicates herself to the sale of Ebel beauty products as well as clothing and shoes.

Kari has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for 14 months and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras." Kari invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in beauty products for sale. Her business has grown since that time; she now invests not only in beauty products but also in clothing and shoes for sale. Additionally, Kari purchases materials to make hand-sewn beaded sandals for sale. Kari plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to invest in clothing (pants, blouses, etc.) and shoes for sale.

Kari's goal is to eventually have her own pawnshop.

loans.use: Clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita J. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Esterlita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and for her children's school allowances.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds to raise

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en: Reynaldo is already 42 years old. He is married to Melinda M.. The couple is thankful because they are already blessed with one child named Rea who is now 23 years old.  She did not able to finish college due to financial difficulties and early marriage. Though her daughter got married early, still Reyanldo and his wife is doing their best in order to sustain the needs of their grandson. Reynaldo aims to fulfill his family’s satisfaction by patiently maintaining his motorcycle transport with a daily route from their village to highway junction. He wanted also to borrow loan from KIVA lenders that is amounting to PHP9, 000 for the repair and maintenance of his motor vehicle used in transportation business. Reynaldo shares that the loan if granted will be of great help to his family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Mrs.Roselyn C. is 41 years of age married to Ponciano C..She has five children and most of all are in school. Roselyn wanted to start her own business so she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. She was able to use her first cycle for her vulcanizing shop and her husband manages it. She made a plan to retail gasoline and to sell dried fish. Now she is happy because she enjoyed her business and her husband too, that's why she is thankful to the Paglaum Multi- Purpose Cooperative and to the staff because of the services and benefits that she can avail like insurance and savings deposits.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her retail and dried fish vending

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo O. is 57 years old and has been married for thirty-five years to Guillerma Lopez, who is 54 years old. They have six children, three of whom live in the house - the others have their own homes. The ones who are 32, 19, and 15 live with them. Their child who is 32 was paralyzed eleven years ago when he was playing soccer.

For 35 years, Ricardo was an employee of a private business, and at the same time he had a carpentry businesses for six months. He decided to start his own business with a little of his savings from his pervious work.

He wants to use the loan to buy wood and nails. He has various orders for furniture for the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails

loans.name: Estrellas Group

texts.es:
la sra. MIRNA YOLANDA L. D. su principal actividad es la pulpería, misma que opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería "ALEXANDER" ella vive en unión libre y es madre de 4 hijos los cuales estan en edades de 10 años a 5 años, dos de ellos estan cursando la primaria y uno en preparatoria.
su compañero de hogar es agricultor, Siembra de granos básicos y su especialidad es la siembra de maíz y frijoles.- Mirna establecio este negocio ya que solo se dedicaba al cuidado de sus hijos y la situación economica para ellos no era tan favorable ya que su compañero de hogar era el responsable en un 100% con los gastos del hogar.- ahora con su negocio la situación a mejorado en gran manera ya que ella aporta para comida y cubre algunos gastos dentro del hogar en lo poco que  puede.
el sr. SANTOS ISIDRO V. se dedica a la venta y compra de cerdos en pie tambien se dedica a la agricultura siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijoles).
don santos sale a comprar los cerdos fuera de la aldea de Sta. Maria, y los trae en manada hasta el lugar donde el vive, y a los dos dias llega un comprador a quien les vende los animales.
el vive en union libre y no tienen hijos, y solo depende de ellos un hermano de su 
compañera de hogar por motivos de enfermedad vive con ellos.
Don santos, es una persona bien reconocida en la aldea de Sta. Maria, por el tipo de negocio que tiene ademas es una persona con mas de 30 años de residir en esta aldea.
el sr. JOSE FERMIN B. P. se dedica al comercio, su principal actividad es la venta de plasticos, sandalias de hule, frutas y verduras; anteriormente el vivia en la capital
de este país, pero por problemas maritales, se separo de su esposa y se vino a vivir a la 
tierra de donde es él, haciendose responsable de la crianza de 2 de sus tres hijos.
don josé, es una persona que lucha solo para poder educar a sus hijos mismos que en estos
momentos estan cursando la educacion primaria.
el Sr. B., compra los productos plasticos y sandalias en la capital, y luego sale a vender a comunidades y zonas cafetaleras cercanas a Sta. María. posee un carro y cuado sale a vender a las zonas cafetaleras el compra platanos y bananos y se va venderlos a la capital de donde saca mejores ganacias ya que hace 2 negocios en un solo viaje.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirna Yolanda L. D. has a pulpería (a small general store in her home) called "ALEXANDER". She lives with her partner and is the mother of 4 children ages 10 to 5 years old, two of whom are in elementary school and one who is in middle school. Her companion is a farmer who plants basic grains. His specialty is growing corn and beans. Mirna established this business on her own because she was only taking care of children and their economic situation was not very good since her partner was 100 percent responsible for the household expenses. Now, with her business, their situation has improved a lot and she contributes for food and covers some of the bills when she can. Mr. Santos Isidro V. buys and sells pigs. He is also a farmer who grows basic grains like corn and beans. Mr. Santos leaves the town of Sta. Maria to buy his pigs and then brings them back to his home in a herd. A few days later a buyer comes and he sells the animals. Mr. Santos lives with his partner and doesn’t have any children. He only has a brother-in-law who relies on them because he lives with them due to illness. Mr. Santos is a person who is well known in Sta. Maria because of his business and also because he’s lived in this town for more than 30 years. Mr. JOSE FERMIN B. P. is in sales. He mostly sells plastics, rubber sandals, fruits and vegetables. He used to live in the capital, but because of marital problems he separated from his wife and came to live on the land he is from to raise two of his three children. Mr. José, is a man who struggles so he can educate his children who are in elementary school right now. Mr. B. buys plastic products and sandals in the capital and then sells them in communities and by coffee plantations near Sta. María. He has a car, so when he sells in coffee plantation areas he buys plantains and bananas and then sells them in the capital where he can get better prices since he’s doing two businesses in only one trip. All of these people need a loan so they can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sugar, TP, rice, lard, soap, pasta, milk, flour, eggs, coffee, cookies, bread, pigs, plastic utencil, fruits and veggies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca S. is from the village of Baybay, Panalsalan. She is 45 years old, is married, and has seven adult children. Francisca owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Francisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maritza Guadalupe

texts.es: Maritza Guadalupe de 44 años es soltera, madre 3 hijos, el mayor de 21 años que trabaja y le ayuda, uno de 16 años cursando el 5to año de secundaria y el menor de 6 añitos en 1er grado de primaria, labora para el MINED de Acoyapa desde hace 14 años desempeñandose como maestra de primaria en la Escuela Puertas Rojas en una comarca de Acoyapa, todos los dias se le levanta muy temprano para salir en bicicleta a la escuelita en donde imparte el pan de la enseñanza a los niños de esa comunidad; esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su casa, levantando la pared de enfrente que se encuentra en mal estado y comprar la puerta y ventanas, y de esta manera darle mas seguridad a su vivienda.  Expresa que con los creditos que AFODENIC le ha brindado a logrado mejorar su casa aunque hasta ahora espera ser beneficiada con el fondo kiva.  Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos estudien y tengan una carrera universitaria que les permita tener un mejor nivel de vida y seguir mejorando su casa que es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Guadalupe, 44, is single and the mother of three children: the eldest, 21, who works and helps out with household expenses, one who is 16 and in the 11th grade, and the youngest, who is six, and in the first grade. For the last 14 years she has been an employee of the Ministry of Education as an elementary school teacher at the Puertas Rojas School in Acoyapa. She must get up very early every day to ride her bicycle to work at the little school where she teaches the children of the area. She is asking for her 8th loan to improve her house by building a front wall to replace the damaged one there now as well as to buy the door and windows. She hopes, thereby, to provide better security to her home. She says that the loans that AFODENIC has provided have allowed her to have a better house and now she hopes to be a beneficiary of Kiva Fund. Her greatest wish is that her children study and have a university career that will allow them to have a better quality of life and to continue improving her house, which is the asset she means to leave her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Candido Humberto

texts.es: El Señor Candido 	Cisneros de 51 años edad, tiene tres hijos menores de edad y a su responsabilidad. Tiene su propio negocio que es la elaboración de colchones, almohadas. En su negocio los productos son fabricados y vendidos. Desde hace catorce años lo tiene, se le ha presentado dificultades como es la ventas bajas por la situación económica de sus cliente que ha disminuidos cumpliéndole a trazadamente los pagos. Tiene como planes a corto plazo las mejoras de una mini bodega en su casa para almacenar materiales. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de materia prima como: telas, tiras, esponja e hilo de nailon. Don Candido tiene  dos ayudantes lo cual es una forma de contribuir a la sociedad y disminuir el desempleo en el país.  Mediante la institución no solo se benéfica el cliente sino también otras personas. Obteniendo seguridad laboral. Muy contento por confianza y la oportunidad que la institución ha dado para incrementar la venta de colchones ya que gracias a la inversión del financiamiento a logrado el equilibrio de su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Sr. Candido Cisneros is 51 years old and has three dependent children who are his responsibility. He has his own business in which he manufactures and sells mattresses and pillows. His business has been in operation for 14 years, but he is currently experiencing difficulties as a result of low sales. The financial situation of his clients has caused them to reduce their payments.

Candido plans short-term improvements, such as establishing a mini-warehouse in his home for storing materials. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy raw materials such as fabrics, straps, sponges, and nylon. Don Candido has two assistants, so he is contributing to society and helping to reduce unemployment in the country. He is not the only person who benefited from the help of the Institution, but other people as well by providing them job security. Candido is very happy to have this opportunity and for the confidence placed in him by the Institution to increase his mattress sales. He is thankful for this financial investment to help him stabilize his small business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for manufacturing mattresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase and resale of hair extensions

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino, trabaja de día como chofer asalariado y de noche trabaja como chofer de bus en su movilidad propia.
.
Vive en la zona de Llojeta  de la Ciudad de La Paz, en anticrético.

El crédito que solicita será destinado para arreglo de su movilizad (compra de motor y costo de mano de obra del mecánico). 

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Marcelino works as a salaried driver during the day. At night he works as a bus driver in his own vehicle. He lives in the Llojeta area of the city of La Paz. He lives in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). The loan he is asking for is to fix his vehicle (buy a motor and pay for mechanic’s labor). It is the second time that he has asked Impro for a loan. His history qualifies him for this loan. In other words, he has had a good payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motor for his bus and pay for mechanic’s labor

loans.name: Marilyn's Group

texts.en: Marilyn S. is from the village of Dipacamo, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 43 years old. Marilyn is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Marilyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn provides manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Tulia

texts.es:
Tulia es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Tulia es casada, tiene 50 años y 8 hijos, Tulia venD. ropa variada en la feria D. San Juan actividad que realiza los días domingos, además Tulia venD. la ropa a pedido a amigos y conocidos.
Tulia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. ropa variada.
Los sueños D. Tulia son mejorar su negocio y abrir una tienda D. ropa.
texts.en:
Tulia is a member of the communal bank called Florecer. She is 50 years old, and married with 8 children. Every Sunday, Tulia sells clothing in the central market of San Juan. She also sells clothing by request to friends and acquaintances. Tulia will use the loan to purchase a wiD. variety of clothing she can sell. Her dream is to continue to grow her business and one day be able to open her own clothing shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a wide variety of clothing which she resells in the central market, as well as to friends and acquaintances.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: A. Victoire est née vers 1978.  Il y a 12 ans que Victoire s’est installée à Adogleta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à BANKOLE Gafari, un commerçant, Victoire est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Victoire a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Victoire est une couturière.   Victoire exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Victoire achète les materiels dont elle a besoin.  Victoire a déjà obtenu deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Victoire A. was born circa 1978. Twelve years ago, she moved to Adogleta in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Gafari BANKOLE, a storekeeper, and the mother of two school-attending children. Victoire lives together with her husband and her children. The couple provides for the family expenses together. Victoire attended school up to secondary level. To provide for herself, she's been a seamstress for eight years. She gets the supplies she needs in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. She's now seeking a third loan in order to bolster her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poplin and sewing thread

loans.name: Rwobusisi Bakyara Tukorerehamwe Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
B. Godfrey is the leader of his lending group and he appears in the photo with his lending group in Rukungiri. He is 40 years old and married with three children aged 13, 8 and 6 years. He also takes care of his siblings.

Godfrey has operated a retail grocery shop in Nyamayenje trading centre for sixteen years and the experience he has gained enables him to offer the best to his customers. He has a hope that, in future, he will be able to turn the shop into a wholesale business and have a happy family.

Godfrey needs a loan to be able to buy more items for his shop. These same loans have enabled him to save and, in the end, he has been able to buy a motorcycle that is bringing in more income as he employs someone to manage it.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Padmakumari

texts.en:
Padmakumari is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Her elder daughter is studying now, while the other one is a still a young child. Her husband is a fisherman.

Padmakumari has a small tailoring and clothes-selling business. One of her specialties is creating small mosquito nets. She started her business two years ago. Her business is a small one, but it is very attractive, and there is a very strong demand for her mosquito nets. She increases her business scale step by step, and is a very honest businesswoman.

Padmakumari is looking for some additional financial support to expand her business, so she has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka.

Her future ambition is to renovate her own house with the increased income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es: Ana Ruth M. D. S. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento D. Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo quien en la actualidad no posee empleo, pero ha dado en alquiler un terreno D. su propiedad. Ana Ruth posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos alimenticios y D. primera necesidad para el hogar,  su negocio está ubicado en su casa D. habitación, lugar en el cual comercializa este tipo D. productos desD. hace 6 años, tiempo durante el cual ha logrado obtener muchos clientes fijos, los cuales compran en su negocio a diario. Ana solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la tienda, aumentando la cantidad D. productos que posee y D. esta manera satisfacer todas las necesidades D. sus clientes. Para Ana mejorar su negocio es D. mucha importancia, ya que es gracias a este D. donD. obtienen la mayor parte D. ingresos para sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Ruth M. D. S. is 45 years old and resides in the town of Jiquilisco, which is located in the Department of Usulután. She lives with her husband, who is currently not employed but receives rent from a piece of land that is part of their property. Ana Ruth has a store in her home where she sells food products and basic household necessities. She has been selling these types of products for six years. During this time, she has gained several established customers who shop at her business on a daily basis.

Ana is requesting a loan so that she can have the necessary funds to invest in her store. She will increase the quantity of products she has in stock so that she can satisfy the needs of her customers. Improving her business is of great importance to Ana since it generates a large part of the income needed to sustain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Los Propios Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimieto LOS PROPIOS esta conformado 8 integrantes, seis mujeres y dos varones todos los socios  viven en la misma zona del Torno y Santa Rita en los siguientes barrios ,Bolivia y Paraiso todos los socios cuentan con negocio propio hace varios  años en la comundad de el Torno.

La presidenta es la Sra. SAIDA, esta casada y tiene dos hijitas pequeñas, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, la sra. Saida es un apersona trabajadora y responsable y solidaria con sus compañeras por eso la eligieron como representante del banco, con el dinero del credito la Sra. comprara cosmeticos que se  encuentran en promocion, las revistas sacan productos en promocion que se encuentran mas baratos que el precio original y siguiente publicacion ese producto que estaba mas barato, en la nueva publicacion esta mas caro, y asi ella obtiene una ganancia extra.   

Todas las socias de este banco de emprendimiento en su gran mayoria son padres de familia y son personas muy luchadoras ellos tienen el sueño de que sus negocios engrandesca y ser muy exitosos para cumplir sus sueños de comprarse sus casitas , vehiculo, terreno, ect, ellos se encuentran agradecidos con la institucion por brindarles la confianza en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The “Los Propios” Entrepreneurial bank is made up of eight members; two women and two gentlemen. All of them live in the same zone of the Bolivia and Paraiso neighborhoods of El Torno and Santa Rita. They each have had their own businesses for a number of years in El Torno. Saida is the president. She is married and has two young daughters. She sells cosmetics through a catalog. Saida is hard working and responsible and shows solidarity with her fellow members. This is why they elected her as a representative. She will use the money from this loan to buy cosmetics, which are currently being offered at a reduced price and be able sell them at a greater profit. All of the group’s members have families and businesses. They all hope to be able to buy homes, vehicles, land, etc. in the future. They are grateful to the institution for the trust they have placed in them by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Tièssiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont mariées toutes dans des familles monogames avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Hamdallaye de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, mariage et d’activités  dans le marché Château de Ségou. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce et de diversifier les marchandises à vendre, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 7ème   prêt solidaire.
Madame Assétou Keïta, qui est un des membres, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 500 kg de pomme de terre et 10 sacs d’igname. Elle se ravitaille en ces tubercules à Koutiala et effectue sa vente à domicile, au marché Château et en ambulant dans les quartiers de Ségou à crédit ou au comptant à une clientèle mixte. 
A l’instar des autres membres du groupe, Madame Assétou Keïta compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 56 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvestir dans l’activité et épauler leurs maris dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The women in the Tièssiri group are all married in monogamous families with a median age of 39 and five children. They all live in the Hamdallaye quarter of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighbors, marriage, and working at the Chateau market of Segou. With the intention of increasing their commercial funds and diversifying the products they sell, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their seventh group loan. Mrs. Assétou K., who is one of the members, counts on using the loan to buy 500 kg of potatoes and 10 bags of yams. She stocks up on tubers in Koutiala and sells from home, at the Chateau market, and moving throughout the quarters of Ségou. Sales are done in cash and credit to a mixed clientele. Following the example of the other group members, Mrs. Assétou K. counts on making a monthly, median profit of 56,000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and help her husband to support the family.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tubers (potatoes and yams)

loans.name: Jenny Guadalupe

texts.es: Jenny Guadalupe A. de 21 años de edad, es una joven la cual se destaca por ser muy responsable tanto como madre como mujer de hogar. Vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja como comerciante y junto a su pequeño hijo de 2 años de edad. Jenny posee una venta de sandalias la cual esta ubicada en el mercado regional de La Libertad, en donde desde hace 3 años se dedica a este oficio, pero debido a la creciente competencia en el mercado, Jenny ha tratado de ir invirtiendo en la venta de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, papel higiénico y otros más, lo cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias. Es por esta razón que Jenny solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más sandalias, y así mismo comprar fardos de papel higiénico, granos básicos, aceite, salsas y consomés por mayor y así mismo surtir el negocio con otros productos más, todo esto lo hace con el enorme deseo de mejorar sus ganancias y de esta forma crecer como comerciante y así mismo mejorar la economía de su hogar y poder brindarle todo lo mejor y lo más necesario a su pequeño hijo, lo cual es lo primordial en su vida.
texts.en:
Jenny Guadalupe A. is 21 years old. She is a young woman standing out both as a very good mother and as a very good housewife. She lives with her husband, who is a trader, and her 2-year-old son. Jenny owns a sandals shop located in the La Libertad (Freedom) regional market, and she has been working in this business for the past 3 years. Owing to the growing competition in the market, however, Jenny has tried to invest in the sale of basic groceries such as: rice, beans, oil, toilet paper and so on, in order to earn more money. For this reason Jenny is requesting a loan: she will use it to buy more sandals as well as wholesale bundles of toilet paper, basic grains, oil, dressings, sauce and consommés, thus supplying her shop with more products. In doing so, her wish is to improve her income, to grow as a trader and improve the economy of her family and offer the best and most necessary commodities to her young son, the most important thing of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sandals and basic groceries

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn L. is from the village of Kitingting, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Arlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Safia Begum's Group

texts.en:
Safia begum is the resident of the city of Lahore in Pakistan where her husband sells vegetables from his shop to earn a living for his family. She has four children and none of them could get an education due to financial constraints. 

Safia begum does cloth stitching work to financially support her husband. She takes orders from different areas and fulfills them to earn money. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband in his vegetable selling business. With the loan, he will buy seasonal vegetables for his shop and increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin C. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal East, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 28 years old. Marvin is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Marvin owns & operates a business cultivating coconut trees & harvesting its fruit for sale. Marvin has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase the crop yield. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marvin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Katiuska

texts.es: Katiuska, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propio techo a base de madera. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, Katiuska no se amilanó ante las adversidades que se les presentaba en el camino, es mas sacó a relucir las fuerzas necesarias, con el objetivo de que pueda crear su propio negocio, específicamente en la actividad agrícola. Hoy  produce y comercializa cacao de manera considerable hacia sus compradores más potenciales, desde luego que está percibiendo buenos ingresos económicos, debido a la oportuna entrega que realiza con cada uno de sus clientes. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de cosecha y cultivo tiene a cargo de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción de su producto de cacao y luego venderlos en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Su plan a futuro es expandirse en otras zonas, para ello buscará nuevos terrenos de cultivo en otras zonas estratégicas con la finalidad de que pueda minimizar costo y tiempo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos. Además está contenta con su banco comunal, ya que le resulta muy beneficioso. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Katiuska is 32 years old. She lives with her spouse and they have three schoolage children together. They live together in the community of Santa Rosa, where they have their own house made of wood. Despite not having finished primary school, Katiuska was undaunted by the adversity in her path. She summoned the necessary strength to start her own business, specifically in agriculture. Today she produces and sells considerable amounts of cacao to her biggest customers. This brings her good income, due to the timely delivery to each of her customers. Normally, she works with her spouse, but at harvest and planting time she hires farmhands so that it is easier to extract the cacao product and then sell it in the stockpiling centers of her community. Her plan for the future is to expand to other areas. For this she will look for new cropland in strategic areas with the purpose of minimizing time and cost. This is her first loan with MFP. She is committed to making the payments according to schedule. She is also happy with her communal bank, since it has been very beneficial. With the loan that she is asking for, she plans oninvesting in giving her cacao plantings suitable maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her cacao plantings

loans.name: Mairo Mbili Group C-Jinja

texts.en: 42-year-old K. Fred has been a hard-working taxi driver for the last 15 years. This has been his main source of income since then. He was at first a fuel pump attendant. His close friend introduced him to this business. In a week, he makes 40,000 shillings. Proceeds from this loan he says will help him pay his three children’s school fees more often.

loans.use: paying children's school fees

loans.name: Piedra Preciosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Piedra Preciosa lo conforman Ana Mercedes Sandobal de 49 años desde 2004 instalo inicio con la venta de chiverías luego con los prestamos fue invirtiendo en otros productos hasta tener una pequeña venta completa. Esta señora tiene la meta convertir su modesta venta en una miscelánea.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Yesenia C.  quien vende comida hace 5 años y Magda F. vende leña hace 7 años.
texts.en:
