The group Piedra Preciosa (Precious Stone) was formed by Ana Mercedes Sandobal, who is 49 years old. Since 2004, she has worked selling snacks. Later, with loans, she invested in other products until she had a complete small shop. This lady has a goal to convert her modest store into a small general store. The other members of the group are Yesina C., who has spent 5 years selling food, and Magda F. who has sold wood for 7 years.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, meat, cleaning products, etc.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Marmashen.  She is married and the proud mother of two daughters (twenty-eight years old and twenty-one years old) and a twenty-nine-year-old son.  Ruzanna supports her daughter’s family, who lives in the town of Artik, with agricultural produce. 

 Ruzanna has been engaged in vegetable growing and raising animals for over 18 years.  She considers herself a hard worker and is proud to be a farmer.  Ruzanna would like a loan to purchase additional animals and seeds and feed.  She is expecting the family income to increase by up to 20% with the business investment.  By growing her business she expects to fully support her family and be able to stay in Marmashen.  Ruzanna is fond of her village which has an ancient monastery complex of five churches built in the 10th century.

loans.use: purchase animals, seed and feed

loans.name: Kawama Omunaku Group-Jinja

texts.en: The parable about talents teaches that most people lack the confidence to do something because they are afraid of failure. There are many such people in Uganda but 32-year-old N. Safina is an exception as she has always had self-confidence and belief in herself. These attributes have worked for her in her two reliable means of subsistence: a hotel and a fresh food sales business in Bugembe-Jinja. She credits her husband for encouraging her, even while she was a housewife. In a month, her profits total up to 200,000 UGX and with this loan she is looking at purchasing more fresh foods for her hotel. She belongs to the Kawama Omunaku group-Jinja.

loans.use: to purchase fresh foods for her hotel

loans.name: Ana Nyame Inkom

texts.en:
Ana Nyame Inkom D. produces palm oil at Abura. She is married and lives together with her nine dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the welfare of the home. The loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to prepare oil for sale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

In this picture Ana is getting her palm fruit ready for oil-making.

loans.use: buy more palm fruit to prepare oil for sale

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny C. is from Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Jenny is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling personal products such as clothes, shoes, perfumes and watches in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jenny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Jenny is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To help support his growing landscape business

loans.name: Semuti Development Group B-Mityana

texts.en: Edward S. is 54 years old, married, and has six children.  He has been in the retail business in Maanyi-Mityana for 20 years. He began with 400,000 shillings as capital and painstakingly made headway in earning profits through hard work, perseverance, and determination. Before he ventured into this business, Edward was a shopkeeper.  His dream is to expand his business into wholesale.  Edward earns a profit of 150,000 shillings a week. He sells produce on the side. With this loan, Edward plans to purchase general merchandise stock for resale. He belongs to the Semuti Development group.

loans.use: To purchase retail general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia D. banco comunal Las almendras, D. Distrito D. Calleria y Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 58 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 7 hijos, su primer préstamo en Manuela Ramos  fue D. S/.300.00, con ese dinero comenzó su negocio.
Nora trabaja haciendo los deliciosos tamales, rellenos, manteca, chicharrones, chorizos (cómidas típicas) y los venD. todas las mañanas en un mercado cerca a su casa, termina temprano y le da tiempo para ir a preparar  el almuerzo y hacer otras actividades D. su hogar.
Con éste préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00 soles comprará: 5 sacos D. maíz, 1 bolsa D. cal, 3 kilos D. aceitunas, un paquete D. sal 3 kilos D. maní, 3 casilleros D. huevo,  condimentos, soga para amarrar sus tamalitos.
Gracias a Manuela Ramos la señora Nora todavía pueD. pagar los estudios D. su último hijo que está en la universidad.
texts.en: Nora is a member of Las Almendras (The Almonds) community bank in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali, Peru. She is 58 years old, married and has seven children. Her first loan with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos was for 300 soles, and she used this money to start her business. Nora works making delicious tamales and other regional dishes that she sells every morning at a market near her home. She finishes early in the day, which gives her time to prepare lunch and do other chores in her home. With this loan of 1,200 soles, she plans to purchase 5 sacks of corn, a bag of lime, 3 kilos of olives, a package of salt, 3 kilos of peanuts, 3 cartons of eggs, condiments and ropes to tie up her tamales. Thanks to Manuela Ramos, Nora can still pay for her youngest child's college education.

loans.use: Purchase 5 sacks of corn, 1 bag of lime, 3 kilos of olives, one package of salt, 3 kilos of peanuts, 3 cartons of eggs, condiments, and rope to tie up her tamales.

loans.name: Kafokatoala Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Kafokatoala, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fantobougou, sous préfecture de Fana, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font de la restauration et le commerce des céréales.
Ces femmes du groupe Kafokatoala sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des tubercules et du haricot.
KOROTOUMOU D. du groupe Kafokatoala compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des tubercules. Elle s’approvisionne avec les femmes du marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of Kafokatoala Group are all married. On average, they are 31 years old and have three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Fantobougou, subprefecture of Fana, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship and neighborhood.

They work in catering and sell cereals. This is their third solidarity loan which they will use to buy food condiments, tubers and beans.

Korotoumou D., a member of Kafokatoala Group, wants to use her share of the loan to buy tubers at the market in Fana. She retails them at the same market in Fana, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

She expects to make an average profit of 15,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay for daily household expenses. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy tubers

loans.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda V. M. de 57 años de edad, es  una señora muy responsable y dedicada, quien reside en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive junto a su madre y dos hijos. Imelda es una madre responsable y muy humilde, la cual debe trabajar muy duro por darle todo lo necesario a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de periódicos,  agua embotellada, jugos y sodas, su negocio esta ubicado en la terminal de occidente, en donde es un lugar muy transitado por personas que se dirigen del occidente hacia la capital del país o viceversa. Así mismo cada mediodía, Imelda se encarga de elaborar y comercializar tortillas. Imelda es una señora digna de admirar, por su enorme esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más diarios, agua, jugos, y así mismo materia prima para elaborar tortillas.
texts.en:
Imelda Vasquez M. is 57 y ears old and she is a very responsible and dedicated woman. She lives in the department of San Salvador, together with her mother and her two children. Imelda is a very responsible and humble mother who must work very hard to provide her family with all that they need. 

She sells newspapers, bottled water, juices, and soft drinks. Her business is located in Terminal Occidente which is very well traveled by individuals who travel to and from the west region of the country. Every lunch hour Imelda also makes tortillas. Imelda is someone worthy of admiration for her great efforts to provide for her family. She requests a loan form Integral (Kiva Field Partner), to have enough funds to purchase newspapers, water, juices, and ingredients she needs to make tortillas.

loans.use: To purchase newspapers for resale and corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Чумаев Рахматулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Полученный урожай вывозит на рынок. Таким образом он зарабатывает на жизнь. Целью кредита является закуп семян и топлива для трактора.
texts.en: Rahmatullo J. lives in the Vahdat Region. 36 years of age. Married, with four children. He has been growing produce for over five years. He has a land plot where he grows vegetables. He sells his produce at the market. This is how he earns a living. The purpose of this loan is purchasing seeds and fuel for his tractor.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fuel

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es:
La Sra. Eliza pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin. Está Casada, tiene 47 y es madre de 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Eliza se dedica al Servicio de Alquiler de cuartos, su primer crédito de S/. 300.00  Nuevos Soles lo utilizó realizando mejoras y acondicionamiento en las habitaciones que alquila, para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con lo que ejerce.

Con este crédito  de S/ 800.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará materiales como: bolsas de cementos, ambientadores, pinturas, esmaltes, mesas y sillas. 

Se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con su actividad. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con ella y otras mujeres que necesitan de un préstamo.  Su meta es implementar mejor su negocio para mejorar la calidad de sus servicios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eliza is a member of the "Las Aguerridas II" communal bank which is located in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martin.  She is 47 years old, married and the mother of two minor children.

Eliza has a room renting service.  She took out a first loan in the amount of 300 PEN which she used to renovate the rooms she rents in order to provide good service to customers.  She is still in the same busienss and very happy with her work.

She plans to use the new 800 PEN loan to buy material such as cement, air freshener, paint, enamel, tables and chairs.  She is very excited about pursuing this activity.  She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for supporting her and other women in need of a loan.  

Her goal is to do all she can to improve her business in order to provide the best service possible.

loans.use: To buy material such as cement, air freshener, paint, enamel, tables and chairs

loans.name: Pa

texts.en: Mrs. Pa is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells some of her rice yield and the rest is used to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Vanny Sen, is a construction worker and fisherman. Both try to work hard, but they can earn only a meager income. Mrs. Pa is applying for a loan to buy a cow to raise to start a new business. She is the mother of a child who is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is a married woman who lives in the island of Palawan. She earns her living by operating a palm oil farm and a sand & gravel quarry. Her husband Renato, who is 47 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 28 and 29 years old. 

Armelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Armelita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500 to fund her palm oil farming operation so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Armelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To fund her palm oil farming

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene con 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia con sus hijos la parte rural del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región de Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región de Lambayeque. Se dedica a la venta de frutas y jugos todos los días en su propio domicilio. Tiene más de 3 años de experiencia en este negocio. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Sus ventas diarias son muy buenas pues su negocio está ubicado frente al paradero de carros y motos en el caserío. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más frutas para tener en stock y también para la compra de mesas y sillas para sus clientes. Mercedes es muy trabajadora y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo su negocio para poder ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 38 years old and a single mother of two children. She lives in her own home with her children in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, an agricultural area situated in Piura Province, which is more than four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Mercedes sells fruits and juices from her home. She has more than three years of experience with this business. Mercedes is well-known in the area and has an established customer base. Her daily sales are good since her business is located in front of a taxi stand that is frequented by many cars and motorcycles from the village.

Mercedes wants to invest her loan in the purchase of more fruits to keep in stock. She will also buy tables and chairs for her customers. Mercedes is hardworking and responsible. The people who know her have great respect and affection for her. Her greatest wish is to continue growing her business so that she can offer a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, tables, and chairs.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette M. N. is thirty five years old.  She is married to a businessman and they have two children, aged ten years old and nine months old. Her business is located in Gikomba, a very busy market in Nairobi, the capital city of Kenya. She has been selling second-hand clothes to the local people for the last eleven years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is fluctuating market prices.  Bernadette works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to expand her business. 

Bernadette hopes to have many stalls for selling clothes in the future. She describes herself as honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to resell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a firewood business for the past one year, selling from door-to-door, in a shop and from home. Her potential customers are her neighbors. She also operates a food-selling business, cooking chapati (flat bread) and beans. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes difficult to get firewood for sale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 10 bundles of firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bundles of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a housewife. She spends most of her time staying at home and carrying out her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are rickshaw drivers. 

Razia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her elder son. His rickshaw is out of order these days and needs immediate repair work; otherwise, its engine will be seized and he will lose a valuable asset. He uses his rickshaw to provide pick-up and drop-off services to different school children which earns him a good income every month. Razia is confident that after the repair work, her son will be able to run his business smoothly again and increase his profits. He has been operating his business for the past eight years and Razia is confident that a loan investment will help him improve his business condition. 

Razia is a new loan user and this is her first application to Asasah.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is married. Her husband operates a grocery store business. In his store, he sells daily use items like sugar, spices and cooking oil, etc. He is very good in dealing and offers competitive prices to his customers. 

Razia is very supportive by nature. She operates a sewing  business  making clothes for her neighborhood clients to financially help her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk to be able to fulfill the demand of his customers and increase his sales. He is very experienced in his business and Razia is confident that by investing the loan in his business, her husband will be able to improve his business condition and also increase his profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 51-year-old married woman with three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have had a business making pallets since 2000. It is running smoothly and she would like to take a loan to expand production and buy materials in bulk to increase the profitability of her business. 

She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy in bulk materials to make pallets

loans.name: Vodu

texts.fr: Agée de 56ans, Vodu est revendeuse  ambulante de pagnes. Elle a démarré en 1995 en s’approvisionnant chez des grossistes au grand marché de Lomé. Elle veut ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et surtout avoir une boutique pour mieux s’installer. Son mari est coiffeur.
texts.en:
At 56 years of age, Vodu is a street vendor of 'pagnes'. She started in 1995 by getting her supplies from the Grand Market in Lomé.
She wants this loan to strengthen her business, and in particular to get a shop for a better set up. Her husband is a hairdresser.

loans.use: to buy 'pagnes' (traditional West-African cloth).

loans.name: Chanthoeurn

texts.en:
Chanthoeurn (pictured here) is 26 years old and her husband, Piset is also 26 years old.  They have been married since 2009 and just had a baby. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Chanthoeurn and her husband are garment workers.  She is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Karol Lizet

texts.es:
Karol  tiene 23 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora que vive en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, en una casa propia. La casa de Karol no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, solo tiene luz.

Karol se dedica a la venta de ropa, la cual realiza recorriendo las comunidades pequeñas que se encuentran alrededor de la suya. Sus ventas las realiza a clientes conocidos. 

Además, Karol tiene  un segundo  negocio de venta de cerveza, que realiza los fines de semana. Karol cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres en ambas actividades y tiene muchos deseos de seguir superándose.

Karol solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar ropa  para sus ventas. También invertirá en su otro negocio, comprando cerveza para abastecerlo.
 
Ella estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el préstamo pues le sería de gran utilidad.
texts.en:
Karol, 23, is a young entrepreneur living in the rural part of Tambogrande-Piura in her own house.  Karol’s house does not have all basic utilities; it only has electricity.

Karol sells clothes going throughout the small communities that are located around hers.  She sells to customers that are well-known to her.

Karol has a second business: beer sales that take place on weekends.  Karol’s parents help her out with both activities and she has a strong desire to continue improving.

Karol is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1200 new sol loan to buy clothes to sell.  She will also invest in her other business buying beer to stock it.

She is very grateful for having this loan granted to her because it will be of great use to her.

loans.use: to buy clothes and beer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, 53, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Bernardino, an employee, and a mother to her three children who are all working. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elizabeth maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers count on as their income. Elizabeth's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php1250 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 22,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elizabeth dreams of expanding her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jose Naun

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 2 años de edad, es agricultor, lleva 15 años en esta actividad, lo aprendió de su padre, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades.
Por el momento necesita un préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas, para aplicarlos al cultivo, esto le ayudara mucho, pues fortalecerá la planta y con la posibilidad de obtener una buena cosecha.
Él quiere ver que sus hijos crezcan y se puedan defender ya sea con un oficio o estudio, para sobrevivir con sus propias vidas, cada día trabaja con el mejor anhelo, para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, aged 14 and 2.  He works in farming, which he has been doing for 15 years, and which learned from his father.  He works from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. daily, and so far he hasn't faced any difficulties.

He needs a loan currently to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to the crops.  This will help him greatly, as it will strengthen the plants and provide the possibility for a good harvest.

He wants to see his sons grow up, and be able to keep themselves in an office or a studio and be self-sufficient.  He works every day with a strong desire to provide for his household.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides to apply to his crops.

loans.name: José Noé

texts.es: José Noé tiene 57 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos. Está ubicado en la comarca los zarzales. Tiene más de quince años de tener este negocio. Lo inicio por sus padres ya que ellos le enseñaron este medio d vida para que José aprendiera a mantener a su familia ya que él tiene siete hijos pero actualmente todos trabajan d manera independiente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra d cerdos. El sueña mantener este negocio que le proporciona en pan de cada día.
texts.en:
José Noé is 57 years old; his business is buying and selling pigs.  He lives in the "Los Zarzales" region.  He has been working in this business for more than 15 years.  It was started by his parents, who taught him this means of living so that José could learn to keep his family  He has seven children, but currently they all work independently.  

The goal of the loan is to buy pigs.

He dreams of keeping this business going, as it provides his daily bread.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, Bintiali has operated a tailoring business, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. She also operates a secondhand clothes selling business which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Bintiali dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' needs and improve her standard of living. 

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, Bintiali wants to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes, cloth materials and needles. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes, cloth materials and needles.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en: Sawsan is a 34-year-old lady who got married at the age of 19. She gave birth to two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a humble employee who receives an average salary at one of the Jordanian companies. Getting married at a young age and having children did not allow her to start her own business until recently, when she have decided to turn her artistic talent and vision into something physicA. by embroidering clothes such as Abaya and covers using different kinds and colors of beads. Now Sawsan has applied for a loan in order to expand her business and add new types of accessories on the clothes so she can one day have her own exhibition.

loans.use: to add new types of accessories on clothes.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 25 year-old young man. He is married and has one son and one daughter. He has a barber shop and wants to purchase a new barber kit and some barber products such as hair products and shaving products, etc., in order to improve his work. He has some money but it is not enough to purchase the supplies so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. When Alaa gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase new barber kit and other essential products to improve his work. This will increase his income and enable him to provide better life conditions to the family. Alaa' is photographed in his barber shop.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for a new barber kit and some barber products.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Virgincita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has had a sari-sari store for more than five years. Virgincita sells items like vinegar, canned goods and detergent to the people in her community. Virgincita works hard to support her family. She has requested a loan to buy more items like canned goods and soap. Victoria hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods and soap.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with 5 school going children.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Nyamvula has operated a cereal selling business for the past 15 years; in addition she also runs a grocery.  Her potential clients are the local villagers. She faces a major challenge of drought; there is no harvest during this time.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more cereal for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access fund to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for resale.

loans.name: Kontye

texts.en:
Kontye used her first loan to buy sheep and goats for rearing and selling. She succeeded in selling them, and it was very profitable.
She repaid the loan well and in good time. She plans to use this loan to buy more sheep and goats, as well as cattle, for rearing and selling.

In the future, Kontye hopes to sell livestock to huge, renowned commercial slaughter houses in Nairobi and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats to rear and then sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his five siblings and parents. Ali’s family members joined forces and they are more than happy for being such a supportive, helpful and collaborative family just to be able to cover the heavy costs of life and pay their two school-aged childrens’ fees. 

Ali has ten years’ experience in the agriculture field and started his own business as a farmer in 2005. He takes good care of his land and he’s sure that it will return on him with excellent and natural fruits and vegetables. 

Today, he’s looking to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new agriculture supplies for his tractor. In the future, he plans to buy new land and expand his cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase new agriculture supplies for his tractor.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger is 58 years old and blessed with five children. He is a farmer who provides for his children through his farming business. Because of the difficulty of earning money in this occupation, his children weren’t able to finish their tertiary education. But still he hopes to save in order for them to be able to continue their schooling.

For this reason, he is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide. With his perseverance and hard work, he is sure to yield better crops this harvesting season and save for his children's education. He hopes that, before he leaves this world, he is able to see his children succeed.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Jose Ramiro

texts.es: José, necesitan mejorar su vivienda, por eso solicita préstamo e invertirlo en ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, pago de mano de obra, con lo cual espera que hacer una reparaciones y construir un nuevo cuarto. El ha tenido una buena experiencia con el préstamo anterior, realizando sus cultivos y garantizando de su familia el sustento con la producción de maíz y frijol.
texts.en: José needs to improve his home, so he is requesting a loan to invest in bricks, cement, sand, iron, and labor so that he can make repairs and build a new room.  He had good experience with his previous loan.  With the production of his corn and bean crops, José was able to guarantee the sustenance of his family.

loans.use: to pay for bricks, cement, sand, iron, and labor.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Pauline  fait le commerce des habits en détail. Elle a 41 ans et elle est veuve et a 2 enfants de 13 à 17 ans, qui vont tous à l’école. Elle a une autre personne en charge. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour augmenter le capital de son commerce des habits.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de diversifier les sortes des habits qu’elle vend. Elle veut devenir grossiste dans le futur.
 Avec les profits, elle va payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants et construire une maison.
texts.en: Pauline is a clothing retailer.  She is 41 years old and a widow. She has two children ages 13 and 17 who both attend school. She also has one other dependent.  She completed 6 years of primary education. This is her second loan with ACB.  She will use her loan to increase the working capital of her clothing business.  Her strategy for growing her business is to diversify the kinds of clothes she sells. She wants to become a wholesaler in the future. With the profits, she will pay her children's school fees and build a house.

loans.use: to increase the working capital of her clothing business.

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad is a 45-year-old married woman from Al Nasser, Amman, Jordan and a mother of four children. 

Nihad is trading in clothes and many other things, she is requesting a loan of 400 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more clothes for trading purposes. She is looking to increase her capital and open her own shop. 

An aspiration of Nihad is to help her daughters by financing their education at university.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trading purposes

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 31-year-old man from Kisumu City, Western Kenya. He is married to Elizabeth and they have four children aged between 3 and 10. For the last 10 years, Michael has operated a business selling music and movie compact discs (CDs) in Kisumu, making a monthly income of KES 20,000. He is taking out his first loan, which he will use to buy movies, blank compact discs and many other accessories. Michael will use the profits to open a business for his wife. His dream is to expand and have a big music store.

loans.use: To buy movie and music CDs for sale.

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele aged 52 years. He is married with 2 children aged between 9 and 16 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 8 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to improve his standards of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, who is in mid 30's is single with three schooling children. She has been running a Grocery store and a restaurant for 7 years now. She works from 8 am day to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.     This will be Juma’ 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock for her restaurant and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. 
She used the profit to repay her loan, to pay school fees and to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy the out of stock cooking materials for her restaurant and to restore the out of stock items for the grocery. She dreams of opening a new restaurant at the city centre.
Juma,will be accountable for paying all her loan.

loans.use: to buy the out of stock cooking materials for her restaurant and to restore the out of stock items for the grocery

loans.name: Efe

texts.en: Amo Farms located at Effiakuma North, close to Coco Villa is run by Madam Efe A.. It used to be a farm with a maximum of 600 birds at a time. It is no longer so due to financial difficulties and needs capital to bring in new birds. She is therefore seeking a loan of $800.00 from kiva to re-stock her farm with birds and for effective management.

loans.use: re-stocking capital

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
This young man is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region.  He settled in the Khirdalan settlement and is now married.

Eldaniz is a 28-year-old man who started his business 5 years ago.
Now he needs a loan of $700 to buy womens scarves and children's blouses. 
He plans to expand his business and increase the number of clients he has.

loans.use: to buy womens scarves for and childrens blouses

loans.name: Luz Angélica

texts.en:
Luz Angélica is 30 years old, single, and started her own business by selling cosmetics two years ago to increase her and her family’s quality of life. She began selling to her girl friends and family. She now represents these products and holds demonstrations in beauty salons which has enabled her to increase her sales.

In order to offer a good service and supply her clients’ orders, Luz asks for a $200 dollar loan that she will use in the purchase of merchandise. She offers to return this amount in 3 to 6 months. Be a part of Luz’s achievements. She needs your help at this time and thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish to English by Patricia Yáñez, Kiva Volunteer.

Luz Angélica tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y desde hace dos años inició su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia comenzó vendiendo entre sus familiares y amigas, ahora es promotora de estos productos y hace demostraciones de sus productos en salones de belleza, donde ha logrado incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder ofrecer un buen servicio y surtir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, Luz solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Luz, ella necesita de tu ayuda en estos momentos y agradece mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of Merchandise
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Chun

texts.en: Mrs. Chun S. is a 47 year old widow living in Phnom Penh with her only child. She rents out rooms in her home, and her daughter helps support her by working at a garment factory. This loan will be used to repair her home so she can continue to rent out rooms.

loans.use: Chun would like to repair her house so she can rent out a room

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: I was born and raised in Multan, a city in Pakistan with great history. I now live in Vehari with my husband. I have nine children and all my sons are currently working as laborers. One of my daughters sews cloth for the neighbors. I am a housewife and am not allowed to work outside my home because I live in a community where it is not considered acceptable. Last year one of my sons, Ali Raza, started a pan (beetle nut) shop. His business did not do too well and he had to close it down due to lack of working capital. Next he started working in a jewelry shop and is doing well. Now he wants to start his own business purchasing jewelry from Lahore and selling for profit in Vehari. He has experience in the business and I think he would do well. For this purpose, he needs a loan of $250 to start his business successfully.

loans.use: open a jewellery shop

loans.name: Eldar

texts.ru:
Mr Eldar lives in the city of Saatli in Azerbaidjan. He is 54, married and has 4 children. Eldar is the only breadwinner for the family. He earns money by raising cattle and selling it on the local market. Each year he buys young calves from nearby farmers and neighboring villages and raises them for 8 to 9 months on his property. When they are all grown up, Eldar sells them to the local butcher shops. Currently Eldar is thinking about increasing the size of his business because current income is insufficient to provide for his four children. He is planing to purchase 2 more calves than usual. In order to be able to do that he requires an additional $500. This is why he came to Normico, a Kiva partner looking for help.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Г-н Ельдар живет в городе Саатлы Республики Азербайджан, расположенном в Закавказье. Ему 54 года, он женат, имеет 4-х детей. Ельдар является единственным кормильцем семьи и имеет единственный доход от выращивания и продажи крупного рогатого скота на местном базаре. Ежегодно он покупает молодых телок с приусадебных хозяйств близлежащих деревень, выращивает их в течении 8-9 месяцев в своём хозяйстве и затем продаёт уже повзрослевших коров и быков местным мясникам. Сегодня Ельдар думает о расширении своего бизнеса, т.к. дохода с нынешнего стада не хватает для обеспечения необходимых потребностей его 4-х детей. Он планирует расширить ежегодный обьём закупок телят на 2 штук больше. Для этого ему требуется инвестировать в его бизнес около 500 долларов. Чтобы получить эту сумму, Ельдар обратился в микро кредитную организацию "Нормикро" - партнёру КИВА - для получения кредита.

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: I am Irshad B. and wife of Shabbir Ahmed from Lahore. I have six children: four boys and two girls. All of my children completed their studies up to tenth grade only and all are married except the youngest. My husband works at a paper factory for meager income and I sell cloth. I travel to Faisalabad (a city famous for its textiles in Pakistan) and buy cloth from there and sell it here in Lahore. I have been in this business for the past two years and make decent profits. I need a loan to expand my business further and buy cloth in bulk.

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk for the business

loans.name: Akota

texts.en:
Akota S. has a soap making business. He has been an LAPO member for 3 years. He is 54 years old and married with 4 children. Akota is from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria.

Akota needs a loan of $700 to enable him to buy more chemicals and ingredients for his soap making.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and other ingredients for making soap

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Luz belongs to the communal bank "Women towards Progress," located in Calleria, Ucayali in Peru. She is 61 years old, the mother of 5 grown, independent children, and she is separated. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 soles, she decided to invest in buying and selling corn.

Currently, she continues selling corn, but she also purchased a motorbike to contribute more to her income. She gets up very early to go buy corn and supplies for her daily sales.

With this loan for $625, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 20 sacks of corn and the rest will be used to maintain her motorbike.

Luz told us that she began selling chickens, which went very well, but later she decided to switch to buying and selling corn, which is yielding good results a it helped her purchase her motorbike. She finds herself pleased because at last she can enjoy the economic stability she has waited so long for. She is a fighting women and an example to everyone to follow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Suárez Nº 474, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre de 5 hijos, todos independientes y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la compra y venta de maíz.

En la actualidad continúa con la venta de maíz, pero también compro un motocarro para contribuir mas a sus ingresos económicos. Se levanta muy temprano para ir a comprar maíz y víveres para su venta diaria.

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,800 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 20 sacos de maíz y lo restante lo destinará al mantenimiento de su motocarro.

Luz nos contó que empezó primero vendiendo pollos, le fue muy bien, pero después se decidió por la compra y venta de maíz que le está dando buenos resultados porque le ayudó a comprar su motocarro. Se encuentra feliz por que al fin puede gozar de una estabilidad económica que tanto esperaba y además es una mujer luchadora y todo un ejemplo a seguir.

loans.use: Purchase of corn and maintenance of her vehicle (motorbike)

loans.name: Zamda

texts.en:
Zamda is 48 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 30, 29, 18, and 12 years old. Zamda owns a small food store, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Yai

texts.en:
Yai Khieng is asking for a loan from Maxima in the amount of US$3,00 to purchase vegetables and rice for resale along the village road. Yai is a widow and a mother of three: two sons and a daughter, all of whom are in school.

Yai started her sales business in 1998, and now has ten years of experience selling vegetables and rice. She buys the vegetables in Phnom Penh and resells them locally. Doing so, she can earn between 10,000 and 30,000 riel a day. The local village road is currently being repaved, but after the Khmer New Year (April 13-15), Yai will again be able to sell vegetables there.

In the future, Yai hopes to be able to send her daughter to a university. She is working on improving her business and is building a new stall for the vegetable sales business.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables and rice for resale

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
E. Gulbahor lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Mrs. E. Gulbahor is married and has one child. Like many of her fellow villagers, she raises livestock. It is the family business, and Mrs. E. Gulbahor is responsible for taking care the animals, collecting milk, and making sour-milk products. It is a very hard work, so her child helps her. In addition, she teaches in the rural school. She works hard and has good reputation.

Mrs. E. Gulbahor is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 2100 STJ ($625 USD) for 8 months to buy modern equipment for milk processing.

loans.use: To buy modern milk-processing equipment.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: A. Mahbuba lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. A. Mahbuba has engaged in commercial service and trade for many years. She knows the market specifications and is experienced in business. Now Mrs. A. Mahbuba is engaged in a wholesale business, trading socks, headscarves, packages, and other items. Mrs. A. Mahbuba has applied to KIVA for help with a loan of 2100 STJ for 4 months to widen her assortment and import new goods.

loans.use: Widen assortment of merchandise and import new goods.

loans.name: Roeurng

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeurng L. is a housewife in Prey Puoch Village in Kampong Chhang Province. Her husband, Mr. Sameth Meas, collects palm juice to make palm sugar. They have five children, one of whom is employed at a company while the other two are attending school. The remaining two are too young to work or study.

Although the family members have different business activities, they have insufficient money to hire construction workers to build a new house to replace the existing one. Mrs. Roeurng L. decided to ask a loan for this purpose. Mrs. Roeurng L. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To hire construction workers to build her a new house to replace her existing one.

loans.name: Edelvina Isolina

texts.es:
Edelvina is 37 years of age and currently lives with her five children and her husband.

More than half a year ago, Edelvina and her husband opened up a shop where they make musical instruments in an artisanal style. On a daily basis they make guitars and harps. Edelvina joins her husband in the daily work of the shop. She is in charge of putting on the finish, like varnish. In this way, she and her husband make a stupendous pair. After production, they sell their products at the main market in their town. This business is enjoyable for Edelvina and, above all, for her husband who had the brilliant idea of starting this shop and to apply all he learned since he was a child.

The goal of these efforts is to see their family and their children with a better quality of life.

They ask for a loan of 300 soles ($125) with which they will buy wood and materials for the making of the instruments. They would like see their shop improving all of the time and not only make instruments but also furniture and do metalwork.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Edelvina tiene 37 años de edad y en la actualidad vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo.

Hace más de medio año, Edelvina y su esposo instalaron un taller para la fabricación de instrumentos musicales de manera artesanal, diariamente fabrican guitarras y arpas, Edelvina acompaña diariamente a su esposo en los trabajos requeridos en el taller, ella se encarga de darle el acabado final, como el barnizado. De esta manera ella y su esposo hacen una dupla estupenda, luego de su elaboración los venden en el mercado principal de su localidad. Esta actividad es disfrutada por Edelvina, y sobre todo por su esposo, quien tuvo la brillante idea de implementar este taller y aplicar lo que aprendió desde su niñez.

El motivo de su esfuerzo es para ver a su familia y a sus hijos con una mejor calidad de vida.

Solicitan un préstamo de 300 soles, con el cual comprará madera y materiales para la elaboración de los instrumentos, ellos quieren ver su taller cada vez mejor y no solo fabricar instrumentos, sino también muebles y realizar carpintería metálica.

loans.use: Purchase of Materials for the Making of Musical Instruments.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia G. S. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Cecilia González S. es una muchacha soltera y tiene deseo de terminar una construcción que todavía aun no termina ella la comenzó con un préstamo que le otorgo su mismo trabajo. Pero ella recurrió a nuestra institución la cual tiene un programa (CONAVI) que es nuevo a la vez satisfactorio para la persona y la sociedad. Ella quiere subir mas alto la barda de su casa para tener privacidad y poner piso en el patio de atrás de su hogar. La cantidad que ella requiere es $950dólares.

Cecilia trabaja en una tienda de muebles y ella comenta que con estos ingresos que ella recibe pagara el préstamo.
texts.en:
Cecilia González S. is in the process of applying for home improvement assistance through a Mexican government program called Conavi. Conavi assists very low-income families by providing a small housing improvement subsidy that supplements a housing loan.This Kiva loan can thus have a big impact, since it is supplemented by additional funds that this low-income family will use to improve their housing circumstances.

Cecilia González S. is a single woman who very much wishes to complete her construction project. She has been unable to finish it yet, and started with a loan that her own employer provided to her. She has turned to our institution which runs a program (CONAVI), which is new and helpful to both the individual and the society as a whole. She wants to increase the height of the wall of her house, so she has more privacy. She would also like to add a floor to the patio behind the home. The amount she is looking to borrow is $950 USD.

Cecilia works in a furniture store and comments that she will repay the loan with the income from this job.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to house and add a patio floor.

loans.name: Sunnary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunnary K. is 46-years-old and sells used clothing door-to-door in her village by using a cart. She earns approximately US$2.80 per day. Sunnary has five children, two of whom are married. Her eldest daughter sells souvenirs and a son works as a blacksmith. She is married to Mr. Rom Kong, 49, who repairs motorcycles as his occupation.

Sunnary is requesting a loan of US$350 to purchase more used clothing for resale. She is a small group leader with two members who will jointly use this loan. Mrs. Sinoun C., 44, is a tailor and is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase a sewing machine for expanding her business. Mrs. Leap S., 46, sells roasted beef. She is requesting a loan of US$250 to add more capital for her roast beef business. All three members live in the Ratanak Commune of the Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline O. is 30 years old and married with three children. She sells eggs in wholesale and retail. She sells eggs at Olomuza market in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The demand for eggs in Nigeria is high because eggs are affordable and rich in protein. Roseline loves her egg business. She needs the loan amount of 102,000 N to purchase more eggs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 25 años, vive sola ya que es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de golosinas en su pequeña tienda, la cual administra desde hace ya 5 años, gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos. En el negocio le va bien, le gusta la venta, su capacidad de persuasión y su gran facilidad de palabra logran convencer y dibujar una sonrisa en el rostro de sus clientes, los cuales ya se van siendo más fieles a la tienda de Adela, no solo por los buenos productos que ofrece, si no también para conversar y alegrarse el día con las bromas que ella realiza. Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que solicita implementará mejor su tienda para tener a todos sus fieles clientes contentos con sus productos.
texts.en:
Adela is 25 years old, lives by herself, and is single. She sells sweets in her small store, which she has managed for 5 years thanks to her great efforts. Her business is going well and she enjoys it. Her capacity for persuasion and her great ability for conversation allows her to convince and bring a smile to the faces of her clients. Her clients are very loyal to Adela, not only because of the great products that she offers, but also for her conversation and joy she gives them with her jokes. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting, she will obtain more supplies for her store to keep all her faithful clients happy with her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products offered in her store.

loans.name: Zareena M. Mushtaq Group

texts.en:
Zareena baji is a 45 years old married woman and resides in a city named Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km away from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. Her husband name is M. M. who is a delivery man. He delivers fruit and vegetables from one place to another. She is the mother of nine children: five sons and four daughters. Her elder son works in a factory. The next is a tailor. The others are free and don’t do anything. Zareena baji keeps her daughters busy in embroidery. Her daughters make embroidered cloth and Zareena baji sells it in the cloth market. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institution in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a donkey cart for her husband because the old one is wearing down.
 
She is a group leader of a few women. Bushra baji and Zubaida baji each want a loan to repair their vehicle named “Shahzore” for loading and transporting. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy rice to resell.  Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Jeo baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a donkey cart

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Al inicio ella trabajaba en un puesto de abarrotes, verduras y carnes. Hasta hace tres años que su esposo sufrió de un derrame cerebral, por lo que tuvo que abandonar su trabajo para dedicarse a su cuidado.

Luego de estar al cuidado de su esposo ella también cayo enferma, sin embargo esto no fue un problema para ella quien luego de reincorporarse a sus actividades diarias pensó que seria una mejor idea abrir un negocio en su propia casa.

Fue así que luego de un año se encarga de alquilar cabinas de Internet  y  también maneja un locutorio. Felizmente le va muy bien en su negocio, ha podido crecer lo suficiente para continuar con las mismas ganas de seguir trabajando.

Las ganancias ella lo invierte en el mantenimiento de sus equipos y también para su casa, mas adelante esta pensado comprar una maquina fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
At first she was working in a stand that sold general items, vegetables, and meat. 3 years ago her husband suffered a brain hemorrhage and she had to leave her work to take care of him full time. After being the caretaker and nurse for her husband, which was not a problem for her, she reincorporated herself to her daily activities and thought it would be a good idea to open a business in her own home. After a year she began renting internet booths and managing a telephone booth. Happily, her business is going well. It has grown sufficiently for her to continue with the same income that she would have upon returning to work. The earnings she invests in equipment maintenance and also for her home. She is thinking about purchasing a photocopier in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
"I am the father and the provider; I will do my best to support well my family needs," says Norberto L., 49-year-old father of 6 children. "Because of our farm, we earn. Our earnings are what we use to feed our families," he said. "I have been working so many years in the farm. This helped me sustain my family and send all my children to school," he added.

Norberto is requesting a loan from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner) to grow his farm. He will use the loan to buy complete fertilizers and insecticides to ensure a quality harvest. He thinks that his loan will bring him a higher yield of his crops. In this way, he could support his children's educational needs well.

For 10 years, CEVI has been helping its clients like Norberto grow their businesses. Through credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage, more and more people succeed in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Turgunoy

texts.en:
Turgunoy M. is a very responsible and hard-working woman. She is married. Three years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has a sewing machine in her house where she produces dresses for women in the traditional style. She is asking for a loan of $350 USD that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. She has committed to repaying the amount in 12 months. Help this young family improve the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Turgunoy’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasing fabrics for sewing dresses

loans.name: Faasala

texts.en: Faasala L. is 32 years old and is divorced with 3 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the Taamu/Taro Plantation business. She sells to the public and village people in their village market in Safua twice a week. She has had 1 previous loan from SPBD. She will use her loan to buy cement, timber and iron roofing to renovate her house because it is getting damaged. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 80 WST.  SPBD loans are Faasala’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy cement, timber and iron roofing for home renovation

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia S., 42, is married with six children. She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the general public three days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala.  SPBD loans are Sesilia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides, spray gun, machetes, wheel barrow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Victoria es separada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Victoria viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra papa, queso, cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Victoria sueña con educar a sus hijos y ahorrar para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria is a partner of "Banco Comunal Arco Iris".

She is separated, 44 years old and has 3 children. Victoria travels to the regional fairs where she sells groceries and buys potato, cheese, and cereal to be sold at the wholesale food market in the town of Ayacucho.

Victoria needs a loan of 3000 soles to be invested in buying cereals. It is Victoria's dream to provide her children with schooling and to save money to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es: Jacqueline es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio para ayudar a su madre con quien vive, pues sólo se tienen la una a la otra. Siempre le gustó la comida, sus gustos la motivaron a aprender de cocina, su madre le enseñó a preparar diversos platos y variedad de aperitivos, y desde hace algunos años se dedica a la venta de comida, pues heredó los dotes culinarios de su madre quien siempre está con ella para ayudarla en la preparación, cuando son grandes cantidades. Al terminar su labor en la cocina sale a repartir los pedidos a las diversas obras de construcción, ya que sus pensionistas son obreros albañiles. Esta actividad le dio la posibilidad de crecer económicamente y de ayudar a su madre, con quien tiene proyectado a futuro, instalar un restaurante para dejar de lado las caminatas y el esfuerzo que tiene que hacer para distribuir los pedidos de comida. Ella es una las seis personas que conforman actualmente su banco comunal, y todas ellas trabajan con mucho esmero para incrementar sus ganancias y mejorar su economía, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP. Los 1500 soles que solicita serán utilizados para la compra de utensilios y muebles para instalar un puesto de comida que pronto estará en funcionamiento, primer paso en la obtención de su restaurante.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is very hardworking and very dedicated to her business to help support her mother with whom she lives, especially because they only have each other. She has always loved food and her tastes motivated her to learn cuisine. Her mother taught her how to prepare many dishes and appetizers. And for a few years she has been selling her foods, having inherited her mother's culinary equipment, although her mother is always helping her cook, especially for large orders. When she is done cooking she goes out to deliver her foods to the different construction yards, with most of her clientele being labourers. Her business has allowed her to grow financially and to help her mother and they hope to set up a restaurant together, to stop altogether the long distances she has to walk to deliver her foods. She is one of six people in the group of her Community Bank, and like them all she works very ardently to increase her earnings and improve her finances. This is her eighth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). The 1500 soles she is requesting will be used to purchase utensils and furniture to outfit her food stand that will soon be ready to run. This being the first step in establishing her restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase utensils and furniture for her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: Patricia cuenta con 23 años, vive en su casa propia, con su pareja por más de 4 años, con la que tiene un pequeño hijo. Desde los 18 años se dedica a la siembra y venta de café y de plátanos, actividad que heredó de sus padres, y que le complace mucho. Por ello, madruga diariamente para que a las 7.00am, con  el almuerzo preparado, enrumbe hacia sus chacras, algunas veces en compañía de su esposo, pero generalmente lo hace sola, ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil. Para Patricia todos los jueves de cada semana, son los días más arduos y complicados, puesto que tiene que preparar su carga de productos y muchas veces no encuentra cómo transportarlos. Pero pese a esas dificultades logra llegar al mercado de Santa Ana y Perené donde sus clientes la esperan muy ansiosos, ya que saben que los  productos que ella lleva, son de primera calidad, y eso la llena de regocijo, por lo que se esmera en atender bien a sus clientes, quienes durante estos años le han permitido obtener buenas ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia. Este es el quinto ciclo de su banco comunal, ella se incorporó en el tercero, puesto que este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, donde viene demostrando puntualidad en todas sus cuotas programadas por su asesor de crédito. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita plantea comprar fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus chacras de café.
texts.en:
Patricia is 23 years old and has lived in her own house with her partner and their child for more than 4 years. Since she was 18 years old, she has dedicated herself to sowing and selling coffee and plantains. She inherited this business from her parents, which pleases her very much. For this reason, she gets up every day so that at 7:00 am, with lunch prepared, she goes to her small farms. Sometimes she goes with her husband, but generally, she does it alone since her husband works as a plumber. For Patricia, Thursdays are the most difficult and complicated days given that she has to prepare her load of products, and many times she can't find the means to transport them. But despite these difficulties, she manages to get to the Santa Ana y Perené market, where her clients wait anxiously since they know that she brings high quality products. This fills her with satisfaction, and that's why she works hard to serve her clients well. Her loyal clients have allowed her to generate high profits to sustain her family during the past years. This is the fifth cycle of the community bank. She joined in the third since this is her third loan with MFP, where she has been very punctual in paying her installments with the support of her credit consultant. With the 500 soles that she is requesting, she plans to buy chemicals to fertilize her coffee plots.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor.

Abena prepares and sells "kenkey" (a staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling). She sells on a table top at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Abena has been in business for twelve years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk to produce "kenkey"

loans.name: Juditha's Group

texts.en:
Juditha T. is from the town of Loman, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 53 years old. Juditha is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Juditha owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Juditha has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In February 2009, Juditha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juditha has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Juditha is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia P. has been a member of Kiva partner, ASHI, since 2008. She joined this NGO because she wanted a loan that would make her dream of having a business come true. Her decision to join ASHI and take a loan was supported by her husband, a laborer and sometimes a charcoal maker.

In the village where Cecilia and her husband live, together with their five children aged from 1 to 22 years old, most families use charcoal for cooking food. These people are poor and are financially unable to buy electric or gas stoves. Therefore, Cecilia decided to venture into charcoal selling with the first loan she received from ASHI. After she had repaid her loan, Cecilia saw that she had made a good profit, and she was given a 10% credit rating (attendance rate, repayment rate and business rate) by ASHI staff, which means she qualified for bigger loans.

With this new loan, Cecilia wants to enhance further her charcoal selling business. She plans to buy a large volume of charcoal and negotiate with another vendor to be her supplier as well. With this plan, Cecilia is hopeful that her business will grow even more. She desires to send all her children to school until college, and hopes to be able to give them the life they should have.

loans.use: To buy a large volume of charcoal to supply other charcoal vendors in the village

loans.name: Monica Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Maribel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 01 hija, que esta en el jardín y su gran orgullo por lo que trabaja muy duro.

Mónica Maribel, mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que en la actualidad continua, lleva 03 años dedicada a sus productos de catálogos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Mónica Maribel, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Señora Mónica Maribel belongs to the “Los Eucaliptos” Community Bank in the district of Tarapoto, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 36 years old and lives with her partner. Her daughter is in kindergarten and is her pride and joy. She is the reason that Mónica Maribel works very hard. Mónica Maribel is a woman who has overcome many difficulties over the course of her life, but her desire to get ahead has allowed her to achieve much, and today she feels very pleased with what she has accomplished through her business. She started out selling different lines of cosmetics such as Unique, Esika, Leonisa, and Avon, and has been selling from catalogues for three years now. With this S/.2,000 loan, she will buy beauty products such as perfumes for men and women, creams, face powder, lipsticks, nail polish, as well as another display counter for the products. Because of her maturity, Mónica Maribel is an example for many women to follow as they start a business. She shows that with perseverance they can succeed in achieving their dreams. Mónica Maribel is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos organisation for helping her and other women start their own businesses and learn new business skills.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more products and increase her stock

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
