Peter A. is married and has five dependents. His wife is a trader. He has received senior high school education.

Peter sells firewood. He goes to the forest and cuts wood for sale at Abrodzirum near Shama-kedzi, which he has been doing since 1997.

Peter uses his income to pay school fees and to settle bills. He will use the loan to purchase more firewood to sell. Peter plans to save the new profits from his expanded business to enter into farming.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Dylinda

texts.en: Dylinda T. makes a living growing rice in Agusan Del Sur. She is 49 years old, married, has four children and is a member of CEVI, the first microfinance organization she has ever joined. Dylinda is happy to receive financial help because she is able to make good use of it on her farm. She is applying for this loan to buy items she needs to raise her crop and expand her small business.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Estrella Oriental Group

texts.es: El grupo “Estrella Oriental” son amigas, socias dinámicas emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y unirse mas como grupo; presidenta tiene como ocupación la venta de comida como ambulante, las demás  señoras tienen una amistad desde hace mucho tiempo como vecinas del barrio y como compañeros de negocio. Desempeñan diferentes tipos de actividades comerciales y de servicio como: venta de ropa, cosmético, venta de comida (pensión), venta de joyas, venta de películas, de celulares, confección de prendas de vestir como polleras para cholitas y elaboración de pan cuñape; desarrollando sus  actividades en su propio domicilio o como ambulantes.  En cuanto a la competencia se encuentra presente en el mismo barrio pero para solucionar la falta de ventas las socias trasladan sus negocios a diferentes periferias de la ciudad para generar el sustento diario de sus familias. El  destino del crédito es para surtir sus tiendas, compra materiales de trabajo y para la adquisición de insumos al por mayor. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando su primer ciclo dentro la Fundación pero conocen la modalidad de trabajo en conjunto por lo que saben como administrar sus fondos y sus mantener sus negocios a flote para brindad a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.En representacion del señor Elar se encuentra su esposa la señora Domitila en la fotografia ya que el no pudo salir del puesto de trabajo para esta reunion.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: María

texts.es: María Rodríguez es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, madre de un hijo. María se dedica a la crianza  y venta de pollos, ella cuenta con un galpón para la crianza, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la comercialización de tablas. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Gotitas de amor” desde hace ocho meses. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que invirtió en pollos para vender en el mercado, ahora necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de alimentos balanceados para pollos, para luego comercializados.
texts.en:
María Rodríguez is one of our dynamic and hardworking members. She lives in the district of Yarinacocha in Ucayali region. María raises and sells chickens. She has a barn that houses her birds. Her husband is a lumber merchant and provides her with his full support.

She joined the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Amor” (Droplets of Love) eight months ago. María used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase chickens to sell at the market. She is now requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy feed for her birds, which she will sell at a later time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for her chickens

loans.name: Baldandorj

texts.en:
Baldandorj C. operates a cellphone selling and repair business in his town. He is 22 years old and lives with his wife in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. They live together in a ger, which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife is currently unemployed but is very supportive of her husband and works hard to make their home comfortable.

C. started his cellphone business in 2008 after working as a shoe repairman for the previous two years. Switching to the cellphone trade has quickly proven to have been a good idea. C. has established himself in the local business community and has a steady income. He is a very hardworking and open-minded person who hopes his business will enable him to achieve his future dreams. He hopes to have his own electronic appliance store in his town one day. C. is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug loan to purchase cellphone parts for his business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase cellphone parts

loans.name: Nuñez Group

texts.es: Este Grupo Solidario Núñez tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que son mujeres muy responsables.  Está conformado por María y Milagro del Socorro ambas poseen las mismas actividades económicas como la venta de comida Milagro tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y como toda madre responsable mantiene a sus 4 hijos. Milagro  no cuenta con todos los ingresos necesarios, para mantener a todos sus hijos por lo que busca la forma de esta manera.  El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de granos básicos, carnes y otros.
texts.en:
The Núñez Solidarity Group has been working with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. Both women are very responsible. The group consists of María P. and Milagros del Socorro, both of whom are in the same business of selling food. Milagros is 29 years old and a single mother responsible for 4 children. She tells us that her income is necessary for maintaining her children, which is why she is seeking this funding. The loan will be used as operating capital to purchase necessary items such as grains, meat, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase grains, meat, and other products

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
La señora Karina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun depende de ella.

Karina, recientemente viene dedicándose al servicio de fotografías tamaño (carnet, pasaporte, jumbos, dni), poco a poco fue generando mas ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, para así seguir implementando mas su negocio y como tiene el carisma y habilidad, no duda en hacerlo y con el apoyo D. Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se siente mas realizada.
Nos cuenta que a diario, tiene muy buenas entradas, ya que se encuentra ubicada, al frente de la Reniec y son los moradores sus principales clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará 03 cámaras digitales.

Hoy en día esta muy contenta y se siente con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank, of Rioja, province of Rioja, department of San Martín. She is single, is 30 years old and is a mother of 2 children, both depend on her economically. Karina, a short time ago began taking pictures in sizes for documents like: identity cards, passports, large photographs, and national identity documents. Little by little, Karina began getting more profits and she began saving her money so that she can keep her business growing. Since she has charisma and talent, she does not doubt doing her job and with the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos (Kiva’s field partner) she feels more empowered.

She tells us that daily she has very good profits since she is located in front of the Reniec (National Registry of Identification and Civil Status) and they are her main customers.

With this loan of de S/. 3,000.00, she will buy 3 digital cameras.

To this day she is very happy and is motivated to make her dreams and goals come true. She is thankful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and to many women who want to grow in businesses as well.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 digital cameras.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 42 years old. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Betty works hard to support her husband to provide for the family.

She is a food vendor who prepares and sells kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian staple food made from maize). She sells by the roadside and buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Betty has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is married and has one child. She has received junior high education. Theresa sells raw rice, gari (manioc grits), maize, onions and other food items at Elmina, which she has been doing for the past fifteen years. Her husband is a teacher. Theresa uses her income to help her husband in the payment of utility bills, school fees, and other family expenses.

Theresa will use the loan to purchase more cereals for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest in her business to boost her profit so that she can have enough savings to help build the house she has planned to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: to purchase more cereals for sale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mrs. C., age 33, resides in the best territory of Kampong Chhnang Province. Here she built a small grocery store in the village where she sells a few cooking ingredients to the neighbors for a profit. She is able to earn a daily income of $4 a day to contribute the daily needs of her family. She has a good partner in her husband who helps feed the family by working in construction. C. has a young child who attends a primary school. C. is taking her loan to raise capital for her grocery business. With the rest of the loan, she will buy some children's toys to sell.

loans.use: Capital for her grocery business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Pilar es casada, tiene 34 años y 5 hijos, Pilar vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta de una escuela, actividad realiza de lunes a viernes, además los días domingos viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende panes.
Pilar necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de golosinas.
El sueño de Pilar es salir adelante.
texts.en:
Pilar is a member of the Guadalupe Communal Bank. Pilar is 34, married, and has five children. Pilar sells sweets as a street vender in the doorway to a school. She does this Monday through Friday. On Sundays she travels to the fairs in the area and sells bread. Pilar needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy sweets. Pilar’s dream is to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Luz Group

texts.es:
The Luz Group is made of three women entrepreneurs and workers, each with a strong vision.  ADIM promotes personal and business development programs to its clients. These women have taken the opportunity to learn how to manage their small businesses more efficiently, and to strengthened their self esteem and feel empowered.  Also, it has helped them to efficiently use their loans, to be more organized, and to improve their relationship with their clients.

The coordinator of the group is Señora Cisel del Socorro López.  Two years ago Cisel used her savings to purchase new products and begin her small store.  Now, thanks to the loans from ADIM she has been able to offer more variety, and better quality products, which has grown her business. She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to convert her store into a miscellaneous shop, she is sure she will achieve this.

Also in the group Señora Rosa María Pérez A. and Gloria del Socorro V..  Rosa is dedicated to her sales of all types of products.  She sells Avon and Zermat & Voguet brand cosmetics, clothing, shoes, traditional Nicaraguan sweets, and pork.  She wants to be able to fix up her home which is deteriorating. Gloria and her husband began a small funeral home ten years ago, additionally they began a small restaurant where they make and sell lunch during the day, fried foods in the evenings, and on the weekends soup and nacatamales. Her wishes are that her businesses continue to prosper.
texts.en:
The Luz Group is made of three women entrepreneurs and workers, each with a strong vision. ADIM promotes personal and business development programs to its clients. These women have taken the opportunity to learn how to manage their small businesses more efficiently, and to strengthened their self esteem and feel empowered. Also, it has helped them to efficiently use their loans, to be more organized, and to improve their relationship with their clients. The coordinator of the group is Señora Cisel del Socorro López. Two years ago Cisel used her savings to purchase new products and begin her small store. Now, thanks to the loans from ADIM she has been able to offer more variety, and better quality products, which has grown her business. She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to convert her store into a miscellaneous shop, she is sure she will achieve this. Also in the group Señora Rosa María Pérez A. and Gloria del Socorro V.. Rosa is dedicated to her sales of all types of products. She sells Avon and Zermat & Voguet brand cosmetics, clothing, shoes, traditional Nicaraguan sweets, and pork. She wants to be able to fix up her home which is deteriorating. Gloria and her husband began a small funeral home ten years ago, additionally they began a small restaurant where they make and sell lunch during the day, fried foods in the evenings, and on the weekends soup and nacatamales. Her wishes are that her businesses continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 42 years old and married with 2 children, 13 and 15 years old. Her children attend school and this makes her happy. Grace sells foodstuffs at retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to expand her business. Grace has requested a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a 45-year-old married man with four children. He passed the intermediate level of education.

The entrepreneur sells cosmetics. He is taking this loan to buy cosmetics, perfumes, make-up, and powders, in addition to ladies garments of different types and styles. He has a good reputation in the markets due to his occupation and could gain lots of clients in the market. His family income will rise as a result of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, perfumes

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 44-year-old carpenter based in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with six children and he is the breadwinner for his family of eight people. He has been doing carpentry and joinery for 26 years, through which he has been able to build his residential house and educate his children. He says as he grows older he is looking forward to starting a business that involves use of less energy. This is his third loan from HOFOKAM and he will use the funds for construction of his rental house.

loans.use: For construction of his rental house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two children and runs a small business selling children’s toys. She started this business ten years ago using advice form her friends who were in a similar business. Today she's got two business locations and has a desire to develop her business further.

At the moment there is growing demand for summer toys. Ludmila would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase more summer inventory. This business is the only source of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase summer inventory for her toy store

loans.name: Gloria  Maria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es una mujer trabajadora, se dedica a su propio negocio, un cafetín que administra hace varios años, en un hospital. Inicio con el deseo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos.
Desde horas tempranas llega al cafetín para preparar desayunos rápidos, y vender mas,  con el incremento que ah tenido con la inversión de los financiamientos ha logrado mantener rentable su negocio. A si como ha logrado hacer mejoras a su casa con el techo, repello de paredes, a un falta pintar y terminar por completo el techo que le falto capital para poder hacer la obra completa.

Con este préstamo hará lo que hace falta, en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros materiales para comenzar la obra y poder estar mas tranquila.
texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working woman. She has her own business, a cafeteria that she has run for many years, in a hospital. She began with the desire to help her husband with the bills. In the early hours, she arrives at the cafeteria to prepare breakfasts and sell more. With the increase she has had with the investment of loans, she has been able to maintain the success of her business. In this way, she has been able to make improvements in her home to the roof and walls, but still needs to paint and finish the roof to complete the work for which she still lacks funds.

With this loan, she will be able to finish the work, purchasing construction materials such as zinc, purlings and other materials to begin the work, and she will be able to relax.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase zinc, purlings and other construction materials to finish the roof

loans.name: Aslon

texts.ru: Чураев Аслон проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст, 25 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, экономист. Более 5 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Он в основном покупает и продает украшения. Целью кредита является закуп золотых украшений.
texts.en:
Aslon C. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 25 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a higher education as an economist. Aslon has been involved in retail sales at a market for over 5 years. He primarily buys and sells jewelry. The goal of this loan request is to purchase gold jewelry.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gold jewelry

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith B. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old. Judith is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling native delicacies for snacks and also selling ready-to-wear products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Judith is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emerson

texts.en:
Emerson L. is from the village of Mangcuram. He is 37 years old. Emerson is married. To make a living, Emerson raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Emerson has been engaged in his business for over 13 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Emerson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Emerson is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Emerson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana G. is  49 years old and she has four children; three of whom are now adults, with seperate families. Susana married at a very young age and now she has been married for 33 years.
She works as a dressmaker for 20 years, this profession develops in various ways; either working for others, as in the early stage or developing your own business, as it did later.
After working for a long time as a clothing factory worker, Susan left her job to pursue this activity by selling clothes;  a totally independent activity. She has been doing it for two years.
She took advantage of her husband’s travels , international travels who is a driver. When he goes to Chile, he brings clothes, blankets which she sell at a cheaper price at home. She also delivers the murchandise to others who carry out the sale and this way too she collaborates to employ other people.
The credit obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation is invested in the purchase of a good range of clothes and winter coats. Susan thanked the institution that provides support to micro business.
texts.en:
Susana G. is 49 years old and she has four children; three of whom are now adults, with seperate families. Susana married at a very young age and now she has been married for 33 years. She works as a dressmaker for 20 years, this profession develops in various ways; either working for others, as in the early stage or developing your own business, as it did later. After working for a long time as a clothing factory worker, Susan left her job to pursue this activity by selling clothes; a totally independent activity. She has been doing it for two years. She took advantage of her husband’s travels , international travels who is a driver. When he goes to Chile, he brings clothes, blankets which she sell at a cheaper price at home. She also delivers the murchandise to others who carry out the sale and this way too she collaborates to employ other people. The credit obtained from the Paraguayan Foundation is invested in the purchase of a good range of clothes and winter coats. Susan thanked the institution that provides support to micro business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets, pants, shirts, sweaters and coats

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (legemat & tamia)  and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil to sell.  Mary is 36 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: cette femme est  très dynamique, à 32 ans elle gagne sa vie en exerçant comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tissus, elle  exerce son activité au grand marché de hedzranawoé qui constitue en même temps son lieu d'approvisionnement. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. actuellement la rentrée scolaires approche et elle souhaite se réapprovisionner pour accroître ses recettes dans cette période c'est pour cette raison qu'elle demande chez WAGES son tout premier crédit. elle a une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic. At 32 years of age, she earns her living by operating a fabric sales business. She runs her business at the large market in Hedzranawoé which is also where she gets her supplies. Her clientele is composed of all people. Currently the beginning of the school year is approaching and she wants to restock in order to bolster her revenue during this period. It is for this reason that she is requesting her very first loan from WAGES. She supports one other person.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Help Together Group

texts.en:
Victoria K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Help Together'.  She is 42 years old, married, and has five children who are between the ages of 10 to 25 years old. She was only able to attend school through 8th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 14 years, she has been selling fish in Fiamah Market in Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 58,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of fish. 

She describes herself as an honest woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of fish

loans.name: Tieblé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Tieblé C. est un homme marié de 26 ans et sans enfant. Il vit avec sa femme dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Depuis à l’âge de 8 ans il suivait son père dans son atelier de couture. C’est d’ailleurs auprès de celui là qu’il appris la couture. Avec le décès de son père il est devenu le chef de l’atelier. Avec une expérience de plus de 10 ans, il maîtrise son activité. Son atelier est situé dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser son activité de couture, il décida d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter, un important lot de matériels pour son atelier de couture (aiguilles, papier, tissus, files etc). Il s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes.
Il est à son deuxième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso et le prêt précédent a été correctement bien remboursé. 
Il envisage  toujours bien rembourser ses prêts afin de maintenir la confiance. Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 32 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Mr. Tieblé C., 26 years old, is married without children. He lives with his wife in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. Not having gone to a modern school, he started earning a living very early on. Since he was eight, he helped out his father in the sewing shop. It is from his father that Mr. C. has learned this trade. When his father passed away, Mr. C. became the owner of the sewing shop. With over 10 years of experience, he knows his trade well. His shop is located in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni. In order to make his business more profitable, he decided to turn to the credit program of Soro Yriwaso in order to purchase a big lot of supplies for his shop (needles, paper, fabric, thread etc). He purchases his supplies from wholesalers in Bamako.

He is now on his second loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having properly repaid the previous loan. He plans to continue repaying his loans properly  so as to maintain [the organization's] trust. His customers come from the local population. He plans to achieve a monthly income of 32,000 West African Francs.

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for his sewing shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: bgrrhtujkrtghh
texts.en: bgrrhtujkrtghh

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: Makau

texts.en: Makau, a 30 year old man, is a very hardworking businessman.  He is the father of one child.  He started his charcoal sales business seven years ago.  Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has become more focused on his business.  He has employed two people in his business.  Makau also earns extra income from farming.  He hopes to own rental houses in five years.  He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Clisanta

texts.es:
doña Clisanta E. B. tiene 61 años de edad es viuda y se dedica a la venta de productos de comsumo diario como ser frijoles, arroz, azucar, cafe, jabon, papel higienico etc.
toda via tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria para surtir su negocio, ya que en estos momentos esta pasando por una situacion dificil y no tiene capital para comprar mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
su meta es poder hacer crecer su pulperia.
texts.en:
Ms. Clisanta E. B. is 61 years of age and a widow. She earns a living by selling products of daily consumption such as beans, rice, sugar, coffee, soap, toilet paper, etc. She still has two children who are dependent on her. 

She will use the loan to purchase groceries to supply her business as currently she is going through a difficult situation and does not have the capital to purchase merchandise. 

She needs the earnings to cover the costs of the household. Her goal is to be able to make her grocery store grow.

loans.use: To purchase eggs, drinks, rice, beans, sugar, lard, coffee, oil, soaps, toilet paper, salt, pastries, cornmeal

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita J. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Margarita is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Margarita owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coco lumber in variety of sizes in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margarita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coco lumber to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Margarita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un padre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el sector Boca Chica del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la agricultura y comercialización de cítricos en general. La zona en donde vive se caracteriza por producir este tipo de frutos, Luis Alberto los cultiva en un terreno de cultivo de su propiedad y sus cosechas las ofrece en venta a los acopiadores del lugar. Adicionalmente adquiere cítricos a sus vecinos para comercializarlos posteriormente. El negocio es una de sus principales fuente de ingresos por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para mantenerlo.

Luis Alberto desea contar con algún capital disponible que le permita adquirir su mercadería rápidamente durante la presente campaña de cosecha, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 37-year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the Boca Chica sector of the Olmos district, an agricultural and commercial zone that is located in the Lambayeque province, over two hours away from Chiclayo.

He grows and sells citrus for a living. The zone in which he lives is well-known for producing this type of fruit. Luis Alberto grows citrus in an orchard that he owns, and he sells the fruit to local resellers. He also obtains citrus fruits from his neighbors. This business is one of his main sources of income, which is why he gives his all to maintain it.

Luis Alberto would like to have some working capital so that he can obtain merchandise quicker during this harvesting season, which is why he sees fit to request a 1,500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, la zona cuenta con un clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno y ovino. El cría ovejas y vacas en unos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Alberto vende las ovejas a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente ofrece en venta la leche que producen sus vacas. Los ingresos que el percibe de estas actividades le sirven para sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Alberto desea adquirir alimentos para mejorar la crianza de sus animales y poder percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Alberto is 54 years old, married and lives with his wife and three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande.  The area has a semi-tropical climate and mainly produces fruit such as mangos, lemons and passion fruit.  It is located in Piura region, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Alberto raises and sells cattle and sheep.  He raises his sheep and cows in some pens located behind his home.  Alberto sells the sheep to his neighbors and the traders who usually visit the area where he lives.  He also sells the milk that his cows produce.  The profits that Alberto makes from this business help him to get his family ahead financially.  

Alberto would like to acquire animal feed so that he can improve his animal raising business and make more profits that will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To acquire animal feed to improve his animal raising business

loans.name: Jamalbubu

texts.en:
Jamalbubu S., 63, is a farmer with eight children. Seven of her children live on their own while the youngest son lives with her and helps in breeding cattle. They started this business with only 1,000 KGS of initial capital and managed to earn around 3,000 KGS in one month. Jamalbubu is also engaged in land cultivating with barley and wheat, which she sells seasonally at the local market places. Her success was achieved due to hard work and strong efforts. Jamalbubu is now applying for a loan of 25,000 KGS to purchase goats and sheep. Revenues from this loan will allow her to further develop her business and improve her living conditions.

Bai-Tushum and Partners, one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan, uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding.

loans.name: Tilebat's Group

texts.en:
Tilebat B. is the leader of this group. She is 53 and married. Her husband is a farmer. They earn money for their family by selling cattle. They have been doing it for 10 years. The family started to breed cattle with the initial investment of 40,000 Kyrgistani soms and now the monthly income is 12,000 soms. That profit made it possible for them to improve their living conditions and purchase a TV and DVD player. With money received from the loan Tilebat wants to purchase sheep for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Mercedes, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Auxiliadora” del Distrito D. Tarapoto, Provincia D. San Martin y Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 71 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, todos independientes.

Rosa Mercedes, se dedica a la venta D. Abarrotes. Su fuerza luchadora que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para convertirse en una mujer empresaria.  Ahora ha  ganando experiencia, confianza y ya es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.

Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija entre amigos del barrio, moradores y vecinos que a diario acuden a su tienda a comprar.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes tipos D. productos como: leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, avena en paquetes, té en diferentes sabores (manzanilla y anís), verduras D. la zona, utensilios D. aseo para el hogar y D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Rosa Mercedes está contenta con la actividad que realiza día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Rosa Mercedes is a member of the “María Auxiliadora” community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province and department.  She is 71 years old, widowed, and has 5 children who all live independently.

Rosa Mercedes' business is selling groceries.  Her fighting spirit and her desire to get ahead in life on her own resources have helped her become a businesswoman.  She has gained experience and confidence, and is now very well known and well liked by her customers.  She currently has a regular customer base maD. up of friends in her neighborhood, local residents and neighbors who come to her store daily to buy from her.

Rosa Mercedes will use this loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy different types of products such as boxes of different brands of milk and canned fish, packets of oats, different flavored teas (camomile and aniseed), local vegetables, household cleaning products and personal care products.  This way she will be able to continue providing a good service to her customers.

Rosa Mercedes is happy with the work that she does every day and she is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to achieve her goals and dreams.

loans.use: To buy boxes of different brands of milk and canned fish, packets of oats, different flavored teas (camomile and aniseed), local vegetables, household cleaning products and personal care products

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: The four people who make up this group loan have selected Mrs. Sophy to become the group leader. They will use their portion of the loan in various ways to improve their family's standard of living. Mrs. Sophy was born in 1967. She is a Khmer cake maker and a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Seng, is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare plot of land where he can plant rice. He sells part of the harvest and keeps the rest to feed his family. Recently, Mrs. Sophy faces an obstacle because her husband’s workplace is far away from their home. So Mrs. Sophy is applying for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transportation.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Davaasuren B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Davaasuren’s husband used to run a taxi business using his family’s car, but currently he is at home because he sold the car and is trying to replace it.

Davaasuren operates a public toilet on the Intercity bus station, which she rents from the local council. Her business is doing well and it is the only source of family income at the moment.

Davaasuren has applied for a loan to replace the old fences around the ger in which they live.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks to replace the old fences around her ger

loans.name: Florentina's Group

texts.en:
Florentina S. is from the village of San Jose. She is 51 years old. Florentina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Florentina S. Group".

Florentina is married and has three children. To make a living, Florentina owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport waste-management services. Florentina has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Florentina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florentina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to pay for registration, franchise and licenses. Florentina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Florentina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Patrick Ngigi

texts.en:
Patrick has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past eight years. He is 26 years old, married to Monicah Wambui and they have four children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan. He repaid his previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Patrick hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and clothing.

For more than 20 years, she has operated a restaurant, selling to her neighbors and market dwellers. She faces a major challenge of competition from other restaurant operators in the area. Loice dreams of establishing her own plot in the future.

She is requesting Kshs 20,000 to purchase construction materials and cement to repair her restaurant. Loice decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and cement to repair her restaurant.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 31 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Melva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Melva has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Talibon, Bohol with her family. She sells fish for a living. Her husband is a fisherman and the is the one who manages their fishing boat. Luciana sells all his catch at the market. Luciana has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other gear. She hopes for their business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other gear.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. She has six daughters and two sons. Taghreed and her family live in their own house but due to her husband's decent salary, they can't use two of the rooms in the house as they need painting and furniture.

Taghreed's husband could save money to have the room suitable for the children's use. Taghreed took out a loan from FATEN as her husband's money would only be enough for painting the walls and installing windows, etc

Taghreed's husband appears in the picture instead, as she is a conservative woman as are most of Gaza citizens.

loans.use: to expand the house and furnish it to fit the eight-member family

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 8 children. 

Rosalie has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Rosalie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosalie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 52 years old and married. She has seven children. The oldest child is 31 and the youngest is 13. Five of her children still go to school.

Merlita is a farmer. She and her husband own and till land in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. They grow rice to sell to rice traders. Merlita works hard to support her family and send her children to school. 

She requested a loan to help fund their farm. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Merlita hopes this loan will help improve their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Darinel Del Cristo

texts.es:
Darinel vive en el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla a 5 kilómetros del aeropuerto de la ciudad, contiguo a las poblaciones de Soledad, Sabanagrande y Santo Tomás, lo cual hace de su composición social sea muy especial, debido a que en sus habitantes encontramos una mezcla gente de todo el país,  que llega a trabajar de manera independiente mediante un negocio o  en El Parque Industrial Malambo S.A. -PIMSA- condominio industrial privado de completa infraestructura de servicios, orientados a garantizar reducciones en los costos a las empresas que se ubiquen en sus instalaciones y que tienen garantizada la disponibilidad suficiente de mano de obra a las empresas de la zona. 
Este es el ambiente en el cual se mueve el negocio de Darinel, donde vende ranchos víveres, y especialmente un refresco llamado “Raspado”  o   refrigerio  compuesto  de hielo troceado,  para mediante  una    máquina manual  o cepillo de hierro que muele  el hielo,  al que le añade esencias de frutas tropicales como, limón, tamarindo, rosa, cola, cereza cubierto con leche consensada, refresco   muy apetecido para saciar la sed,  que produce el candente clima del caribe. 
Para Darinel la actividad comercial es su día a día desde muy pequeño, a sus 10 años vendía los dulces que hacia su abuela, luego se dedicó a vender pescado, después emprendió  un punto comercial de verduras, posteriormente fritos en el mismo mercado de las verduras en compañía de su esposa, hasta que entre los dos,  lograron ahorrar, comprar un enfriador y obtener préstamos para iniciar su tienda ,  actividad con la que esta pareja  ha logrado sostener a su familia   compuesta por 5 hijos en las edades de 6 a 18 años. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio hasta lograr plena sostenibilidad y dejarle a sus hijos una buena empresa, con la cual puedan sacar adelante a su familia. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará en mayor volumen aceite, arroz, artículos de aseo y mantener un stock que le facilite disminuir los costos de transporte y acceder a una mejor oferta de precios en el mercado.
texts.en: Darinel lives in the municipality of Malambo, a metropolitan area of the city of Barranquilla 5 kilometers from the airport next to the towns of Soledad, Sabanagrande and Santo Tomás. This makes for a very special social composition since the inhabitants are a mixture of people from all over the country who come to work in their own business or in the Malambo Industrial Park (PIMSA), a private industrial complex complete with infrastructure services and designed to reduce business expenses for those set up there, along with guaranteeing the availability of sufficient labor. This is where Darinel moved his business, where he sells grocery items, especially a refreshment called "Raspado", a cold snack consisting of shaved ice from a manual machine topped with tropical fruit syrups like lime, tamarind, cola and cherry and then covered with condensed milk. It's a very refreshing drink to quench the thirst that the Caribbean climate produces. Commerce has been Darniel's day-to-day activity since he was very little. When he was 10 he sold treats that his grandmother made, and then he made a living selling fish before he set up his own sales post selling vegetables. Later on he started frying the vegetables working alongside his wife until between the two of them they were able to save enough to buy a refrigerator and obtain a loan to start their own store. This activity has allowed the couple to provide for their five children between the ages of 6 and 18. Darinel's goal is to strengthen his business until it becomes fully sustainable and he can leave his children a good business that can help them make headway for their families. This is his first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to use it to purchase oil, rice and toiletries in higher volumes to maintain his inventory and lower the transportation costs so he can offer better prices at the market.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice and toiletries in higher volume.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 30 years old. She is married and has two children. Juliana began earning income selling seasonal vegetables and fruits. She has eight years of experience in this field. After a while, she began working at other jobs, but realized that her work wasn't bringing in enough income to cover the expenses of her family. 

Therefore, Juliana decided to independently reengage in the seasonal vegetable sales business. Gradually, she is becoming known in the area; however, she still needs additional capital to purchase vegetables and fruit for sale, given the high demand during the current season. Julina is asking for a loan of P 7,000. With this money, Juliana will be able to buy additional fruit and vegetables for sale and thus earn more profit.

Juliana has a good client history and she is thankful to everyone for their support.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, pineapple, beans and watermelon for her roving store.

loans.name: Flor Kantuta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR KANTUTA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Fortunata. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Trenzado de mantas, faenado de chancho, bordado de ropa de moreno, hilado de manta de vicuña, cría de gallina y chancho, producción de leche, tienda de barrio, costura de chamarras, costura de camperas.
 
La señora Fortunata,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la promotora de crédito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de confección de chamarras que viene trabajando hace siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de máquina recta que servirá para realizar la costura de sus productos, posterior a la elaboración ella distribuye sus productos por entrega directa. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

En la fotografía no se encuentra la señora Zulma, ya que feu a realizar consulta médica
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta capacitación, salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The “Flor Kantuta” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Fortunata.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of business activities such as: blanket weaving, butchering pigs, embroidery work, vicuña wool blanket weaving, raising pigs and chickens, milk production, neighborhood store, jacket making, leather jacket making.

Fortunata says that this is the first time she’s joined Pro Mujer and that she joined thanks to an invitation from a loan promoter.  She currently sews jackets; she’s been in business seven years having learned from her husband.

The loan she’ll take out now is to buy a straight stitch sewing machine that will help her sew her products.  After she makes them she sells them via direct deliveries.  This method of work allows her to earn income to support her family as much as possible since she’s married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training, the health services and the savings.

Zulma does not appear in the photo because she had to keep a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
La señora Minerva, vive e en lugar muy bonito ya que ay una laguna muy grande  que  es visitado por muchas personas, ella vive en unión  libre con el señor  Enrique y con quien procreo  un hijo que aun esta a su responsabilidad.

    Ella se dedica a su hogar y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra y venta de pollos, en donde lleva practicando  dos años y siete meses en la que comenta que le va bien.

     Su inspiración por esta actividad inicio por si sola  así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa a un que su familia es pequeña quiere darle lo mejor.

      Su más grande deseo es que con esta actividad pueda tener sus ahorros para seguir trabajo  hasta que dios le preste vida y seguir apoyando a su hijo en su educación.
texts.en:
Minerva lives in a very beautiful place next to a large lake. Many people go there to visit. She is in a common law marriage with Enrique, with whom she has a son whom she is still raising.  

She is a housewife who asked for the loan to invest in buying ans selling chickens. She has been doing this for two years and seven months and says that it is going well for her.  

Her inspiration for this activity started with herself. She did it to support her husband with the household income, because her family is small and she wants to give it the best. 

Her greatest wish is to be able to have some savings with this activity so she work for as long as she lives and keep supporting her son in his education.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.name: Madusu

texts.en:
Madusu is 39 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is a widow and has six children ages 9 to 26, all of whom are currently in school and live at home. For twenty years she has been selling kola nuts and oil. She makes lots of profit and has many customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more kola nuts and oil for her business. She hopes to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more kola nuts and oil for her business.

loans.name: Hilda Yolanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Hilda es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Miraflores, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 23 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 6, 2 años de edad y una bebé de 7 meses, su primer hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive con sus suegros y comparten los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Hilda se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun están pequeños y como pasa en casa le da la oportunidad de criar pollos.
 
Este es su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y su alimento. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Hilda is a member of the communal bank La Esquina. She lives in the parish of Miraflores. This parish has some beautiful spots where you can observe nature, a great variety of local dishes as well as friendly and kind people who maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Hilda is 23 years old and lives in a common-law marriage. She has 3 children, 6 and 2 years of age and a 7 month old baby. Her first child attends a small school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They do not own their own house and so live with their in-laws and share the household expenses.

Señora Hilda takes care of her children at home as they are still small and this gives her the opportunity of raising chickens.

This is her third loan with the communal bank and with it she is going to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 28-year-old man, who is married and has four sons and one daughter. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a modest salary. Mostafa wants to improve his income by purchasing a new rickshaw to drive and take internal transports, but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

When Mostafa gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to complete the amount he has and purchase a new rickshaw, that will enable him to work extra and increase his income and so provide better living conditions to his family. Mostafa is photographed in the picture next to the rickshaw he will buy.


About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Julito

texts.en:
Julito is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed, with 3 children.  Julito has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Julito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mariyi

texts.es:
Mariyi de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Mariyi desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral y ovinos, su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones diarias de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Mariyi es una madre trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Mariyi is 26 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and child. They do not receive basic services. Mariyi resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for its businesses involving agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For several years, Mariyi has been raising and selling poultry and sheep. Her animal pen is located in an area behind her house and has an ample amount of appropriate space. The animals receive a diet of balanced feed, grains, and natural grasses so that they can attain optimal growth and be offered for sale at different markets in the area. As a result, she will obtain good earnings to resolve her daily household obligations.

She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can buy more balanced feed for her animals. The income that she earns will be used to repay this loan and improve her family’s quality of life. Mariyi is a hardworking and committed mother who only wants to see her family succeed and have improved finances.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Ann Muthoni

texts.en:
Ann used her second loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm during the planting season.  She planted and harvested and it was very profitable.  She repaid the loan amount well and in good time.  This will be her third loan and she plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs as well as pay for labor.

In the future, Ann hopes to improve her farming methods and get more income, hence improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
San Roque lleva por nombre el grupo integrado por 25 mujeres D. la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, las cuales son todas amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad. Ellas se unieron con el deseo D. progresar y D. salir adelante, ya que ellas desean darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y familiares. Se definen como mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy honestas.
Una D. esas mujeres muy trabajadoras es la señora Caren, quien con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a la venta D. sabanas que hace, ha podido ir creciendo y salir adelante. Comenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene muy buena venta pues ya tiene una clientela formada.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. más sabanas con las cuales podrá abastecerse y tener más en stock, con lo que podrá cumplir con sus clientes, agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
San Roque is the name of the group which consists of 25 women from the city of San Lorenzo, all of whom are friends and neighbours from the same city. They got together with the desire to progress and get ahead as they wish to give their children and families a better future. They describe themselves as determined, hardworking and very honest women.

One of these hardworking women is Señora Caren who with a lot of effort and thanks to her sales of sheets, has been able to grow and get ahead. She says that she is doing very well as she has very good sales due to an established client base. She is asking for the loan to buy more sheets with which to stock up and have more in stock as well as be able to meet her customers' demands. She is grateful to both Kiva and the Fundacion for the opportunity they give her.

loans.use: to buy sheets for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with 2 children.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has had twelve loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yessica Maria

texts.es:
Jessica, vive con una hija de 3 años y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas picadas y verduras, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, lo realiza en las afueras de la alcaldía municipal, su estrategia es ofrecer a los clientes la fruta y verdura picada lista para consumo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de frutas como manzanas, piña, papaya, además verduras como güisquil, zanahoria, papas, yuca, con esto espera mejorar sus ventas  para poder generar más ganancias a su hogar.
El objetivo de ella es crecer en el negocio, tener un puesto de venta fijo y sobre todo lograr comprarse una vivienda propia, para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Jessica lives with her three year-old daughter, and her husband. She sells cut fruit and vegetables. This business came about through her own initiative. 

She carries it on outside the municipal government building. Her strategy is to offer her customers ready-to-eat, cut fruit and vegetables.

She is applying for a loan to buy fruit such as apples, pineapple, papaya, as well as vegetables such as güisquil (pear squash), carrots, potatoes, and yuca. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales, in order to generate more earnings for her household. 

Her aim is to see her business grow, to have a permanent stall, and above all, to succeed in buying her own home, to live in with her family.

loans.use: To buy apples, pineapple, papaya, güisquil (pear squash), potatoes, and yuca.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 38-year-old livestock keeper. He is married to Veronica who is a farmer and they are blessed with three children aged 11, 5 and 2 years respectively. He has been keeping and selling livestock for the past seven years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Daniel will use the loan to buy a heifer and a goat. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to buy a pickup truck for transporting his livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy a heifer and a goat

loans.name: Karina Dengse

texts.es:
Karina tiene 24 años de edad, ella vive en Imperial, Imperial está ubicado alrededor de una hora y media al sur de Lima, Imperial, con sus playas de arena, ruinas pre-incas, y la producción del adorado nacional licor de Perú, el Pisco (una especie de aguardiente de uva), ha sido durante mucho tiempo un destino turístico para los peruanos adinerados. Pero la verdadera Imperial  es una ciudad cálida y tranquila con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un camino indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante el 2001 y 2007 terremotos Perú, pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia. Karina ha estudiado hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos suficientes para solventar sus estudios, ella no pude seguir estudiando la carrera de derecho.

Karina vive en casa de sus padres,  a los que apoya con el fruto de su trabajo ya que ella nos dice que ellos a pesar de sus pocos recursos le han ayudado mucho, Karina se dedica a su negocio de venta de abarrotes en el mercado de su barrio, desde hace ya 7 meses los cuales ha dedicado mucho esfuerzo para salir adelante, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas diarias y puede llegar a atender 25 clientes por día, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque brinda una buena atención a los clientes ya que le gusta que ellos regresen y la recomienden.

Actualmente está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda brindada ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio, con esta mejora podrá tener más variedad en los productos a ofrecer y con ello obtener mayores ingresos para así seguir ahorrando y ampliar su negocio y para lograr su más grande sueño: “Continuar sus estudios superiores”
texts.en:
Karina is 24 years old and lives in Imperial which is located about an hour and a half south of Lima. Imperial, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins and production of Peru's beloved national liquor, el Pisco (a type of liquor made from grapes), has long been a tourist destination for well-heeled Peruvians. But the true Imperial is a warm, peaceful city with a large Afro-Peruvian population, the result of an indigenous history and the influence of Spanish imperialism. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged in the 2001 and 2007 earthquakes in Peru, but has born up as it has throughout most of its history. Karina has studied through the eleventh grade. Since her parents did not have enough economic resources to pay for her studies, she was not able to continue on to study the field of law. 

Karina lives in her parents' home, whom she supports with the fruits of her labor since she tells us that they, in spite of their few resources, have helped her greatly. Karina devotes herself to the business of selling groceries in her neighborhood market, which she has done for seven months now, devoting much effort to getting ahead. She works about eight hours a day and may serve up to 25 customers a day. She believes it is going well  in her business because she provides good customer service since she likes for the customers to return and recommend her to others. 

Currently she is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since with the help provided she will be able to purchase more merchandise for her business. With this improvement she will be able to have more variety in the products she sells and thus obtain a better income in order to continue saving. She hopes to expand her business and achieve her greatest dream: "To continue her advanced studies."

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
DANAYA est un groupe constitué essentiellement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans,  2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à OUAYERMA I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts antérieures se sont  bien dénoués.
SALIMATA  3ème à droite sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes wax dans ce groupe de femmes DANAYA, sa renommée en la matière fait d’elle une vendeuse très sollicitée. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 8 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle les revend de façon ambulante et en famille au comptant et à crédit à sa clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et souvent au grand marché de Sikasso ville.
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Danaya is a group of women, the majority of whom are married and live in monogamous families in Ouayerma I, one of the working-class neighbourhoods of Sikasso city. They have an average age of 33 years, and have 2 children each on average. 

This is their fourth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, to help them meet their customers' needs. The previous loans have been successfully repaid. 

Salimata, third on the right of the photo, sells wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth) in this group. Her knowledge in the area makes her a sought-after seller. With her loan, she will buy 8 pieces of wax pagnes, which she will sell on foot in the neightbourhood and to her family, to both male and female customers who buy on credit or with cash. She purchases supplies at Bamako and often at the Sikasso city market. She is aiming to earn 27,500 FCFA per month on average, part of which will be used to repay the loan, and part of which will go towards her savings.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth).

loans.name: Ayidego Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDEGO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Abdala (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 29 ans n’a pas fréquentée. Abdala est mariée a un revendeur du nom de Soubérou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Abdala vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Abdala vend du beurre de karité depuis dix ans à son domicile. Abdala s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Abdala ensemble avec les membres du groupe AYIDEGO sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont étés bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du buerre de karité.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur aged 34 years. He is married with 2 children aged between 2 and 4 years. Not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maze for the past 8 years. Also his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers of maize.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 57 years old and married with five children. Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, and other groceries.

Lourdes has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
